 Heltid, möjlighet att arbeta på distans
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Banken arbetar ständigt med att förbättra integritet och överensstämmelse med regler inom finansinstitutsbranschen genom att identifiera och förebygga olika former av finansiell brottslighet, inklusive kringgående av sanktioner, penningtvätt och finansiering av terrorism.
 


  


 I denna roll kommer du att arbeta i projekt som syftar till att analysera och förbereda big data i syfte att förhindra finansiella brott. Du kommer att vara en del av ett erfaret team och ha möjlighet att lära dig och utvecklas genom att arbeta med kollegor både lokalt och internationellt.
 


  


 Detta är en långsiktig uppdrag genom Academic Work med möjlighet till direktrekrytering av banken om alla parter är nöjda med samarbetet.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Bli en del av ett stort internationellt företag i framkant av teknologi
  
* Möjligheten att utvecklas internt och öka din expertis inom bank och finans
  
* En dedikerad konsultchef från Academic Work som kommer att stödja och coacha dig i din framtida karriär
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Skapa högkvalitativa analyser och presentationsmaterial för högre ledning
  
* Identifiera potentiella förbättringar/optimeringar/automatiseringar och implementera nya lösningar
  
* Analysera big data och applicera den i ett brottsförebyggande syfte
  
* Arbeta som länken mellan tech och business med syfte att översätta krav för att skapa nya lösningar
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**

* Minst 1 år tidigare erfarenhet inom data analys i big data miljö.
  
* Goda färdigheter inom kommunikation och stakeholder management.
  
* Förståelse för att arbeta agilt.
  
* Goda kunskaper inom Hadoop.
  
* Goda kunskaper inom Excel.
  
* Goda kunskaper inom Python.
  
* Goda kunskaper inom SQL.
  
* Cloud erfarenhet (AWS/Snowflake etc.)
  
* Har svenskt medborgarskap eller giltigt arbetstillstånd för att kunna påbörja tjänsten omgående.
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Erfarenhet inom finansbranschen.

* Erfarenhet av att jobba i storskaliga förändringsprogram.
  
* Erfarenhet av projektledning.

 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.

title: Senior Datacenter Consultant
description:
This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2-3 days per week from an HPE office.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
   

  

**Job Description**
 HPE is seeking a Senior Datacenter Consultant.
   

  

 On this role, you must possess an excellent understanding of datacenter infrastructure and the ability to work in an Agile environment collaborating with Sales, Architects, Partners and the customers Developers, Testers, and Analysts. You will get to work in a collaborative environment that values your insight, encourages you to take on new responsibilities, promotes continuous learning, and rewards innovation.
   

  

 This position requires someone with a passion for Infrastructure, Infrastructure as Code, Automation, Security and improving infrastructure agility. The candidate is required to have strong analytical abilities, work independently, have strong communication skills and working knowledge of datacenter hardware and software
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Install and maintain VMware based platforms and technologies
* Install and maintain Linux-based platforms and technologies
* Understand current technologies and trends related to Linux-based computing and private/hybrid cloud.
* Use and administer automation tools such as Puppet, Ansible, Terraform.
* Use and administer container and kubernetes infrastructure.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate customer needs into different technology requirements that meet organizational and customer objectives
* Drive innovation with the objective to solve customers’ pain points utilizing both mature and evolving platforms
* Contribute to the definition of future architectures of automation systems, software, and networks
* Interact with both internal and external customers during all project phases, from planning to maintenance
* Be mindful of customer needs and clearly communicate complex information
* Demonstrate a high attention to detail, examining every aspect of the system


**Qualifications**
* Good knowledge of datacenter IT infrastructure.
* 4+ years of experience with Linux operating systems including installing, configuring, and troubleshooting.
* Expertise in Virtualization technologies such as KVM, VMWare ESXi.
* Experience in automation tools such as Puppet, Ansible, Terraform, etc.
* Knowledge of monitoring tools like Splunk, Grafana.
* Experience with Linux administration, shell scripting, and open-source security tools.
* Experience in container technologies including Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift
* Experience with maintenance and administration of container technologies including Docker, Kubernetes. Preferable OpenShift
* Strong foundational knowledge of networking models and technologies including Ethernet, IP, VLANs, routing, bridging
* Good understanding of cyber security
* Experience in system monitoring tools and performance analysis tools
* Experience working in large, complex, enterprise datacenter environments


**Desired Skills & Experience**
* Experience with HPE datacenter infrastructure products (compute, storage)
* VMware Certified Professional (VCP) Certification
* Red Hat Certified Engineer (RHCE) certification

**Personal & Professional Development**
 We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.

title: Deploja söker en Säljande konsultchef
description:
**Är du en person som har ett genuint intresse för att arbeta med människor och** 
**IT samtidigt som du älskar och brinner för försäljning och ledarskap** 
**?** 
**Är du** 
**en** 
**driven** 
**person som** 
**trivs i en händelserik miljö? Då ska du definitivt läsa vidare!**
**Vi gör just nu en intressekoll och söker just nu efter dig som letar efter möjligheten att kombinera sin sociala och affärsmässiga sida, med intresset för IT, teknik och utveckling.**
 Deploja söker dig som vill vara med och tillsammans bygga upp ett eget team av IT-konsulter och kunna påverka din egen lön utifrån prestation. Vi söker dig som är van vid att lyckas med det du tar dig an, som har stark drivkraft och som brinner lite extra för att göra andra människor nöjda.
   

  

 Oavsett om det rör sig om en kund, en kollega eller en helt ny kontakt. Att jobba som säljande konsultchef inom IT-konsultbranschen är dynamiskt, mångfacetterat och väldigt socialt och i vår mening är det världens absolut roligaste jobb!
 **Det här är en proaktiv annons** 
 , det innebär att vi inte planerar fylla vakansen här och nu men eftersom vi är i en expansiv fas så vet vi att vi snart behöver förstärka vårt team och därför vill vi redan nu höra från dig som är intresserad av att jobba som konsultchef hos oss.
   

  

**Som Säljande Konsultchef kommer du att:**
 Vara en del av vår expansionsresa där du garanterat kommer att utvecklas i din yrkesroll. Du blir en del av vårt Business Development- och Sales team som har sin passion i att leverera starka relationer och partnerskap som får våra kunder och medarbetare att växa.
   

  

**Affärsmöjligheter:** 
 Du ansvarar för att kontakta existerande och nya kunder inom IT-branschen och identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter inom IT-konsultförsäljning, Mjukvaruåtaganden.
   

  

**Kandidater** 
 : Med din tekniska förståelse inom IT bidrar du till att identifiera & rekrytera kvalitativa IT-konsulter via div. plattformar och telefon. Som konsulchef kommer du att vara ansvarig för att hitta de mest begåvade IT-specialisterna genom uppsökande rekrytering, LinkedIn-sökningar och telefonsamtal. Du kommer att hålla i möten och intervjuer med kandidater och skapa en stark kandidatpipe.
   

  

**Relationer** 
 : Du skapar och upprätthåller nära kontakt med både konsulter och kunder för att säkerställa att varje uppdrag förflyter smidigt och genererar värde för alla inblandade.
   

  

**Administration** 
 : Du ansvarar för löpande administration och tidrapportering.
   

  

**Team** 
 : Ditt mål är att bygga ett starkt team av seniora IT-Konsulter/systemutvecklare.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Brinner för IT och systemutveckling.
* Är resultatinriktad och utåtriktad.
* Har dokumenterad erfarenhet av konsultförsäljning inom systemutveckling.
* Har ett välutbyggt nätverk av kunder och konsulter inom IT-branschen
* Har ett entreprenöriellt tänk och drivs av att skapa framgångsrika affärer.
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med CRM-system och andra försäljningsverktyg
* Gillar att ha nära kontakt med både konsulter och kunder.
* Vill utvecklas både i din yrkesroll och som person.
* Bred IT-förståelse


**Start** 
 : Vi värderar rätt person framför datum.
   

  

**Placeringsort** 
 : Solna/Stockholmr(Hybrid). Vi är 3 dagar/vecka på kontoret.
   

  

**Ansökan** 
 : Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match.
   

  

**Vad vi står för:**
 På Deploja erbjuder vi branschledande lönemodell med stor frihet. Vårt mål är att hitta de bästa uppdragen för våra medarbetare och skapa en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi tror att kompetenta människor lockar likasinnade och vill arbeta tillsammans på spännande uppdrag.
   

  

 Vår ersättningsmodell är en av de mest förmånliga på marknaden och är anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation som värdesätter frihet.
   

  

**Vill du vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt?**

title: Product Specialist
description:
**Why join Bannerflow?** 




 Bannerflow is a hyper-growth company and one of Europe's most exciting SaaS companies. Our Creative Management Platform serves more than 6 billion ads each month, viewed on 500 million unique devices all over the world. This breaks down to a massive >25 000 requests and almost 2GB of data transfer - per second, on average, constantly! We allow enterprise brands to create, publish, analyze and optimize rich media ads in-house at scale. Our mission is to become the most user-friendly platform for creative automation and campaign management - across channels.To be able to deliver this, we have to stay in the front line of technical development and always keep up with the latest tools and technologies.
 



 We advocate and work along with an agile architecture without hierarchy and bureaucracy where we work in small autonomous and cross-functional feature teams. We are a Creative Management Platform that allows companies to focus on being creative rather than spending precious time on repetitive tasks and changing the game by removing the mystery of digital marketing. We simplify complexity, challenge the status quo and as a result, we have the happiest customers in the world.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 As a Product Specialist, you work cross-functionally with customers and prospects to ensure excellent product delivery, high adoption and commercial success throughout the customer lifecycle.
 



 Product Specialists have both broad and deep knowledge about the Bannerflow platform, the pains it solves, and the value the customer gets. The role acts as a trusted advisor within the digital advertising landscape by guiding customers to success by showcasing our platform, recommending best practices in ways of working, and leading customers in technical projects.
 



  





**Daily Tasks And Responsibilities Include** 



* Master and demonstrate how the Bannerflow platform works, what value it generates and the pains it solves different personas and industries.
* Master in-depth product training sessions with existing customers and conduct value driven sales demos for prospective customers.
* Have the curiosity to over time get an in depth understanding of the Bannerflow go-to-market execution, market dynamics, product vision, and our Must Win Battles (company strategy) that support the company growth.
* Lead customer - initiated projects together with Customer Success Managers and Account Executives who primarily own the customer relationship.
* Assist with customer ad-hoc troubleshooting sessions and solve complex software issues.
* Guide customers through a perfect account setup and best practices for customers network integrations.
* The role requires a high - level understanding of the network destination (DSP).
* Contribute to product development of our platform by sharing customer insights and feedback with Product and Tech.
* Identify improvement areas for internal processes and drive initiatives related to this.



  





**Who are you?** 




 To enjoy working at Bannerflow you should be eager to learn new things and happy to take on challenges. To succeed at Bannerflow in general you need to be passionate and have a black belt in collaboration. As the Bannerflow team is constantly growing, it’s important that you embrace change and thrive in an environment where the landscape is always evolving.
 



  





**Skills** 




 We are looking for someone with skills in these areas (you might be an expert on all of these or just a few):
 


* Solution-oriented and creative mindset.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. A listener as well as a presenter with ability to adapt communication to different personas and use industry specific terminology.
* Driven and structured problem solver.
* Previous experience from SaaS or B2B.
* An eye for design and experience from working with tools like Photoshop and Illustrator.
* Familiar with JSON and XML feeds.
* Knowledge about JavaScript, CSS and HTML.
* Experience and good understanding of digital marketing.
* Availability and flexibility to travel if needed.
* Fluent in English. It is a big bonus if you're fluent in Swedish or another language, but it's not a requirement.



  





**Why join us?** 




 We live alongside our values of Passion, Collaboration and Challenge; with many events going on at Bannerflow such as Friday beer, team activities, kick-ass inspiration webinars, health month, values week and level-up hackathons, there’s something for everyone. As a member of the Bannerflow crew, you will get the opportunity to work with a creative, enabling, and highly advanced product within a 100% cloud-based architecture. We take leadership very seriously and our leaders get extensive leadership training in order for you to get the best possible coaching and guidance in your role. Of course we offer a hybrid workplace, furthermore we offer a compensation package including pension according to ITP1, health care insurance and health allowance.

title: Technical Trainer to a global company within the electronics industry!
description:
Think of the most advanced electronics products You can imagine. Then open Your mind and go beyond this thought. What technology creates these products?Our clients technology does. They are special and a world-leading production equipment supplier. A spearhead in the electronics industry. Now they are searching for a Technical Trainer who will work with very complex machines, training, and documentation - all together. You are special. You love technology. You are verbal and smart. You do not stop when work gets hard. You are active, resilient, creative and solution oriented. You are a peoples person, highly passionate about pedagogy and communication.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Täby
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 According to agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 As a Technical Trainer your primary responsibilities are to develop and deliver product training and documentation. The target groups are service engineers and customers, but also other people within the global sales and service organization. In addition to this you will also deliver product training on an introductory level for other people within the company.
 


  


 The position as a Technical Trainer includes work in different roles such as being Instructor, Training Developer, Training Coordinator, Technical Writer and Subject Matter Expert. The mix and flavor varies over time. You will also take part in the ongoing digitalization.
 


  


 To learn, comprehend, and to keep being proficient in the products, you will at times also work with machine setups, installations and escalated technical support issues.
 


  


 Business travels to countries in Asia and to the U.S.A. occurs so it is required that you are able to travel.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* To be part of a company with a diverse workforce. To our client, diversity is a key competitive advantage, and also a good foundation for a great place to work and innovation to happen.
  
* Nice colleagues and high levels of expertise. You will find yourself side by side with leading experts, get inspired, and inspire others as you acquire and share knowledge.
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Develop training material, training programs, courses and materials
  
* Deliver training - teach in classroom as well as via Teams
  
* Plan and administrate courses
  
* Develop product documentation
  
* Provide product technical information and proof read documentation
  

  


**We are looking for**

 In order to succeed in this position, you must have a genuine interest for technology & nature science and a strong interest in teaching practice. You must have good pedagogic abilities and high social skills.
 


  


 We also see that you have an extensive self-drive and strong ability to initiate and conclude activities. Furthermore, as interactions with other colleagues and customers are frequent, you must be service minded and have a high level of personal responsibility. On top of this you must have:
 


  

  
* An engineering degree
  
* Previous experience from training, documentation, machines and technical support
  
* Strong interest in software or programs used to develop and deliver training.
  
* Good skills in PowerPoint and the Office-package
  
* High proficiency and experience of communication in English, in both speech and writing
  
* A Swedish citizenship
  


  


  

**It will be seen as a merit if you have...**



  

  
* Experience with Story Line, Learning Management Software and Film production programs
  
* Knowledge in Swedish, both written and spoken
  


  


 In this process, a background check will also be conducted.
 


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work

 Cassandra Martinsson or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on cassandra.martinsson@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15104156

title: Enterprise Support Manager, ES - EMEA - ISV - Nordics
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
**Description**
 As an increasing number of large enterprises move their critical systems to the cloud, we are in need of high-powered technical leaders to help Amazon's largest and most strategically important customers navigate the operational challenges of cloud computing. You will work with our top-tier customers, supporting the software development life-cycle for cloud services, operations management of active services, and business relationships with AWS.
   

  

 In this role, you will have the opportunity to help shape and execute a strategy to build mind-share and broad use of Amazon Web Services with one of our largest customers. You must possess management and customer-facing skills that enable you to represent AWS well within a customer's environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding incidents, trade-offs, best practices, and risk management. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges as you help our customers take advantage of the efficiencies, cost savings and quick innovation available only in the cloud.
   

  

 As Enterprise Support Manager, you will lead a team of Technical Account Managers who are the primary operational point of contact for your customer, helping to plan, review, and oversee ongoing operations of business critical applications. You will leverage your broad experience to work closely with sales leadership to plan and ensure successful launch and operations of AWS's largest application workloads. You will lead operations reviews, both internally and with your customers, while constantly seeking ways to improve your customer's AWS experience. In this role, you will also act as the voice of the customer within AWS to escalate problems and to drive prioritization of business needs for our customers.
   

  

 Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you:
   

  

* Champion and advocate for Enterprise customers within Amazon Web Services (be their voice)
* Develop the team responsible for solving technical issues and working directly with AWS engineers to ensure that customer issues are resolved as expediently as possible
* Participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud
* Help Enterprise customers define IT and business processes that work well with cloud deployments
* Engage with Director and C-Level executives to translate business needs into technical and operational plans
* Work with AWS executive leadership to influence the product roadmap
* Provide detailed reviews of service disruptions, metrics, detailed pre-launch planning


 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you:
   

  

* Champion and advocate for Enterprise customers within Amazon Web Services (be their voice)
* Develop the team responsible for solving technical issues and working directly with AWS engineers to ensure that customer issues are resolved as expediently as possible
* Participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud
* Help Enterprise customers define IT and business processes that work well with cloud deployments
* Engage with Director and C-Level executives to translate business needs into technical and operational plans
* Work with AWS executive leadership to influence the product roadmap
* Provide detailed reviews of service disruptions, metrics, detailed pre-launch planning


**About The Team**
 About AWS
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it's in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
   

  

 Stockholm, SWE
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Ability to analyze and present operational reviews to customer leadership
* Experience leading technical teams
* Extensive experience in direct customer engagement, with a focus on support to senior executives (Vice President and C-level)
* Have a track record of effectively leading technical teams
* English/Swedish language skills


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience scaling an organization through rapid growth or expansion
* Previous experience in technical account management, business relationship management or consulting
* An adaptable communication style that can fit diverse audiences (with varying technical backgrounds)
* Proficient in communicating complex ideas, either with the written word or in presentations
* Excellent analytical skills with a track record of achieving balance in innovative thinking with a strong customer and quality focus
* A degree in an STEM field is a plus; an MBA is a big plus
* Experience with AWS service offerings


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Supply Chain Planner to international company!
description:
Are you a strategic planner with a passion for logistics? We are now looking for a Supply Chain Planner who wants to take the opportunity to become a key player in a global organization and develop with them. The start for this position is immediately - welcome with your application!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Warehousing / Logistics
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, time-limited assignment of 6 months
 



  

**Start date :**
 ASAP
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 As a Supply Chain Planner, your main responsibility is to plan, coordinate, and optimize our packed goods operations at our clients European hub. You will ensure cost-effectiveness and high customer service by managing production planning for drums and IBCs, participating in improvement projects, and assisting the Head of Supply Chain Operations with cost follow-up and invoice management. Additionally, you will handle stock reconciliation and maintain statistical reporting databases. You will also play an active role in matching supply and demand within the NSP Supply Chain Department along with other stakeholders.
 


  


 On a personal level we are seeking for applicants who lives the companies values of dedication, cooperation and proactivity. The candidate has a good basic understanding of logistics and planning, is structured, positive, service minded, resilient, open to changes, flexible and has good social, influencing and diplomatic skills.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* A challenging position in an international setting and a highly motivated team.
  
* The opportunity of making an impact and work closely with dedicated colleagues around the world.
  
* The opportunity to develop within Supply Chain Management.
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Planning and optimization of the packed goods operation within the global hub in Antwerp including but not limited to production (filling of packed goods) planning for drums and IBC.
  
* Participation depot/hub improvement projects that have an impact on packed goods.
  
* Assist the Head of Supply Chain Operations with cost follow up and approval of costs/signing of invoices according to delegation.
  
* Synergi deviations related to packed goods and hub related operational and HSSE issues.
  
* Stock reconciliation at the end of each month.
  
* Maintaining statistical reporting database such as inventory levels, truck data, timeslots, demurrage, rejections, no shows, overtimes amongst others.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Academic degree, preferably in logistics and/or economics.
  
* Operational background experience. Previous work experience in logistics or the process industry, particularly within the chemical sector or any other company handling bulk liquids, is considered a valuable merit.
  
* Fluent in english. Knowledge in the Swedish or Dutch language is a valuable merit.
  
* Solid knowledge in IT and Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Structured
  
* Positive and service minded
  
* Good communication, diplomatic and social skills
  
* Self-sufficient
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.

title: Content Administration Coordinator
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Content Administration Coordinator** 
 in our
 **Stockholm office** 
 – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The role**
 Join our Content Acquisition team in Stockholm, working with content administration and operations. The team works across our Nordic territories and supports content across Viaplay Group’s channels and platforms. You will ensure that processes, rights, costs, and legal terms are accurately entered into our system to facilitate smooth content publishing and release. Collaborating closely with content acquisition, local content teams, legal and operations, your role will be crucial in maintaining our high standards.
   

  

* Efficiently process content deals from negotiation to approvals to final signature
* Enter deal rights, costs, and other data into rights management and scheduling systems
* Source, prepare, review, and analyze reports using various systems
* Communicate and collaborate with departments (buyers, programming, finance, legal) to resolve contract administration issues
* Produce reports for distributors and partners
* Become super user of our internal content management systems


**What** 
**we’re looking for**
 We are looking for a structured and detail-oriented individual with strong technical aptitude for learning new systems. You might have experience in a similar role at another media company, or you may have an administrative background and are seeking a new challenge. Recent university graduates eager to begin their careers in content are also encouraged to apply.
   

  

* Structured and organized
* Worked in similar environment or field
* Super user of the office package and used to work with other systems
* Eager to learn
* Eye for the details
* Fluent in English and one Scandinavian language
* Experienced with working with classified and confidential information considered a plus


****What** 
 we offer you**
**We’ve got you covered!** 
 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
   

  

**Your wellbeing matters.** 
 We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
   

  

**A safe space to grow and up-skill.** 
 Our learning culture puts you in the driver's seat of your own development.
   

  

**Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do** 
 . So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including series & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.
   

  

**Hit play today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Stort tekniskt intresse och nyexad högskoleingenjör?
description:
Du har precis avslutat dina universitetsstudier och vill ta ett första kliv i din karriär, in i ett spännande bolag som jobbar med innovativa lösningar. Du är kreativ och älskar teknik. Utöver det värdesätter du frihet under ansvar och vill vara med och driva projekt i en bransch som är i snabb rörelse. Stämmer du in på beskrivningen - fortsätt läsa och sök tjänsten redan idag!
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Teknik
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, tillsvidare
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Augusti
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

  

**ITS Future har sedan 2004 jobbat med strategier, rådgivning och projektledning inom intelligent infrastruktur, smarta städer och stora**
  

**infrastrukturprojekt. De är Sverigeledande på komplexa system inom trafikstyrning och smart city.**
 De tillför specialistkunskap i projekt och tar totalansvar för utveckling av kompletta lösningar. De är experter inom IT arkitektur, produktkontroll och integration, test av tekniska system, funktionstest till integrations- och systemtest.
 


  


 Du kommer i den här rollen få jobba ute hos ITS Futures kund som är en statlig förvaltningsmyndighet.
 


  

  

****Du erbjuds****
  

  
* Långsiktighet och en trygg anställning i en stabil bransch
  
* Möjligheten att ta stort ansvar, vilket också innebär goda utvecklingsmöjligheter
  
* En fot in i en spännande bransch
  
* Flexibilitet när det kommer till arbetstider och vart man jobbar
   

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuder vi stora möjligheter för dig att växa professionellt, bygga ditt nätverk och skapa värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande .
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**

* Driftstöd och utveckling av vägsidessystem för trafikstyrning och trafikinformation.
  
* ITS-lösningar för interaktion mellan vägsystem och fordon t.ex. för säkrare kollektivtrafik, säkrare vägarbetsplatser, trafikledningssystem för motorvägar.
  
* Delta i möten och bl.a. föra protokoll.
  
* Felsökning och konfiguration i IT system.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Nyligen examinerad högskoleingenjör inom t.ex. maskinteknik eller datateknik eller har en utbildning inom systemvetenskap eller programmering.
  
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
   

 Det är meriterande om du tidigare jobbat i en liknande roll efter examen. Har du kunskap inom nätverk och Linux är även det meriterande för den här tjänsten.
  


  


 I den här rekryteringsprocessen kommer vi värdera de personliga egenskaperna högst eftersom att det kommer avgöra huruvida du är rätt match för tjänsten. Vi ser gärna att du är självgående och alltid vill driva dina arbetuppgifter framåt, samtidigt som du inte drar dig för att ställa frågor i syfte att lära dig. Vidare ser vi att du är noggrann. driven och känner dig trygg med att jobba i en stor organisation och inte räds att söka kontakt med andra. Eftersom att det är en bransch där det händer mycket inom tekniken bör du som person vara kreativ och nyfiken.
 


  

  

  

  

  

  

**Övrig information**
  

  
* Start: Augusti
  
* Omfattning: heltid, tillsvidare
  
* Placering: Stockholm

title: Digital solution consultant process performance
description:
At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.
   

  

 Write the next chapter of your ABB story.
   

  

 This position reports to
   

  

 Principal Technical Consultant
   

  

 Your role and responsibilities
   

  

 In this role, you will have the opportunity to drive the execution of the digital ecosystem strategy in the assigned area. Each day, you will support in developing and implementing a comprehensive digital ecosystem, covering one or more specific assigned such as channels and partnerships for co-creation, onboarding, and monitoring solutions on ABB marketplace. You will also showcase your expertise by demonstrating a solid understanding of digitalization needs and trends in the industry and assigned aspects of the digital ecosystem.
   

  

 Capture market opportunities, understand customer drivers and digitalization needs, develop and evolve technology partnerships and translate these into a solution-based business strategy to leverage untapped digital value
   

  

 Develop and implement appropriate and often new business models for digital transformation opportunities in Process Performance (Advanced Process Control APC/MPC, Analytics, Performance Services, Simulation) with customers in all Process Industries verticals (Mining, Pulp & Paper, Metals, Food & Beverage)
   

  

 Analyzes customer requirements to ensure digital solution(s) meets objectives by combining industry best practices, product knowledge, and business acumen
   

  

 Acts as a high-level technical expert for the Process Performance portfolio across Process Industries verticals, providing knowledge and analysis of specialized software applications and operational environments, functional systems analysis, design, integration, and implementation advice for complex digital solution implementation
   

  

 Provides direction and mentoring to sales and project teams
   

  

 Interfaces with and influences customer’s senior technical and business leadership
   

  

 Continuously drives business development efforts by pursuing new opportunities and extensions with sales teams
   

  

  

**Qualifications For The Role**
* 5+ years of experience driving digital transformation in complex global organizations, ideally in a B2B environment (Process, Energy, software, technology, automation).
* Bachelor’s/Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field.
* Hands-on experience in the OT/software industry with a focus on digitalization and Industrial Software. Deep understanding of relevant technologies and trends.
* Proven track record in consultative selling, with a strong customer focus, exposure to top management, driving results, building pipeline, and turning opportunities into sales successes.
* Ability to drive success in direct and matrix organizations.
* Thorough understanding of the industry customer's end-to-end digital journey through hands-on exposure to transformation planning initiatives. Implemented APC through a full lifecycle from requirements gathering to aftermarket support.
* Deep experience in the industrial software environment; division-specific industry exposure (industrial automation/advanced software) preferred; experience and background in one or more of the division industrial domains such as Mining, Pulp & Paper, Metals, Cement, Food & Beverage.
* Background in cloud and edge technologies, digital twins, analytics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning as applied to Process Performance solutions.
* Experience in the justification, design, implementation, and maintenance of process control applications.
* Understanding of pre-test, tuning, step testing, model identification, inferential deployment, interfacing, and commissioning.
* Excellent networking skills developed in a highly international organization, with a “leading by influence” approach.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken, with additional languages being a plus.
* Availability to travel regionally as required.


 What's in it for you?
   

  

* Learn from highly experienced, genuine, and caring colleagues – people who are committed to helping you achieve your personal and professional goals.
* Help customers in driving efficiency and sustainability, making a strong impact
* Get exposed to cutting-edge technology in Process Automation and have a visible impact on the future


 More about us
   

  

 The Process Industries Division serves the mining, minerals processing, metals, cement, pulp and paper, battery manufacturing, and food and beverage, as well as their associated service industries. The Division brings deep industry domain expertise coupled with the ability to integrate both automation and electrical systems, increase productivity and reduce overall capital and operating costs for customers. For mining, metals and cement customers, solutions include specialized products and services, as well as total production systems. The Division designs, plans, engineers, supplies, installs and commissions integrated electrical and motion systems, including electric equipment, drives, motors, high power rectifiers and equipment for automation and supervisory control within a variety of areas including mineral handling, mining operations, aluminum smelting, hot and cold steel applications and cement production. The offering for the pulp and paper industries includes control systems, quality control systems, drive systems, on-line sensors, actuators and field instruments. Digitalization solutions, including collaborative operations and augmented reality, help improve plant and enterprise productivity, and reduce maintenance and energy costs.
   

  

 We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory
   

  

  

**92054710**

description:
Har du ett stort tekniskt intresse och hittar glädje i att hjälpa andra att lösa sina IT-relaterade utmaningar? Då kan du vara precis den vi letar efter! Vi söker en engagerad, nyfiken och kunnig servicedeskmedarbetare som vill bli en del av vår kunds dynamiska och sociala team, och bidra till att kontorets IT-miljö fungerar smärtfritt. Läs vidare för att ta reda på varför det här är nästa steg för just dig!

**Om tjänsten**

 Vi på Academic Work söker nu dig som vill ta nästa steg inom support och jobba med engagerade kollegor på ett av de största livsmedelsföretagen i Norden, med bland annat välkända godisbitar i sortimentet! Vår kund har expanderat från sina nordiska rötter för att bli ett internationellt företag, optimerat för ytterligare global tillväxt.

title: Bank Relationship Manager - European Markets
description:
**This is the job**
 Join Zimpler and Transform Financial Relationships
   

  

 Are you ready to redefine the future of banking and fintech relationships in Europe? At Zimpler, we are on a mission to revolutionize financial interactions, and we need a dynamic Bank Relationship Manager to lead this transformation. If you are passionate about fostering game-changing partnerships and driving innovation, this is your chance to make a monumental impact.
   

  

**Your Mission**
 As a Bank Relationship Manager, you will be the driving force behind nurturing and expanding our relationships with banks across Europe. You will ensure these partnerships are robust and mutually beneficial, focusing on compliance and overall satisfaction. Our banks won’t just buy into what Zimpler offers—they’ll buy into the exceptional people and vision behind our brand. Reporting to the Head of Core Relations in Stockholm, Sweden, you will be instrumental in cementing Zimpler's footprint in the European market.
   

  

**This Is What You’ll Do**
* Compliance Champion: Collaborate with the team coordinator to ensure ongoing KYC compliance, ensuring all banking relationships adhere to the highest standards.
* Strategic Insight: Map out the needs and wants of each bank relationship and proactively address these, ensuring seamless and effective collaboration.
* Risk Management: Conduct in-depth risk assessments of current banking partners, identifying and mitigating potential issues.
* Technical Coordination: Resolve any technical issues that arise, ensuring smooth operations and strong bank satisfaction.
* Market Expansion Enhance Zimpler's market presence with existing bank partners, driving increased engagement and collaboration.
* Industry Leadership Represent Zimpler in webinars and forums, positioning our brand as a leader in the fintech industry.
* Continuous Research Stay ahead of market and legal developments, ensuring Zimpler remains at the forefront of the industry.
* Relationship Building: Cultivate strong, lasting relationships through regular interactions, meetings, and social engagements.
* Internal Alignment: Coordinate with internal stakeholders to align strategies and objectives, ensuring cohesive efforts across the organization.
* Innovation Driver: Explore and initiate new product offerings and collaborations with banking partners, pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.


 ,
   

  

**This Is What You’re Good At**
* Exceptional Communicator: You excel in building and maintaining relationships, both externally with banks and internally within the team.
* Tenacious Problem-Solver: You thrive on challenges, breaking down barriers, and driving results in complex environments.
* Compliance Expert: You have extensive experience with bank compliance processes in the fintech sector.
* Multilingual Mastery: Fluent in English and Swedish, you communicate effectively across diverse cultures and markets.
* Banking Savvy: You possess high-level cash management experience and a deep understanding of the fintech landscape, with a particular emphasis on open banking.


 Join us at Zimpler and be a part of a team that is not just part of the industry but is reshaping it. Apply now and become a catalyst for innovation and excellence in the European fintech market.

title: Communication consultant within project management to big bank!
description:
Are you a driven project manager with a passion for communication and marketing? We are looking for someone who wants to lead the product development for commercial cards and ensure effective and cohesive communication. Selection is ongoing – welcome to apply!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm

 Marketing / Information / Media

 Full time

 August

 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 As a Project Manager, you will identify, manage, and deliver prioritized activities within product management for commercial cards. You will primarily work within marketing and communication, handling everything from applications, intranet information, user interfaces, and related processes, as well as supporting internal communication. Your goal is to ensure that the communication supports the product's goals and increases stakeholder engagement.
 


  


 This is a consultancy assignment through Academic Work. The project period starts in August and lasts until 31/12/2025. For the right person, there may be long-term opportunities with our client.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* Be part of a large international company at the forefront of technology
  
* Lead the product development for commercial cards at a major bank
  
* The opportunity to develop and enhance your expertise in project management and communication
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Conduct a current state analysis and identify potential improvements/optimizations
  
* Create and implement internal plans for improved communication
  
* Design and implement communication strategies for commercial card products
  
* Coordinate communication efforts by working closely with internal and external stakeholders
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Relevant education in PR, marketing, or business administration
  
* Several years of experience in communication or marketing, preferably from the banking or financial sector
  
* Several years of experience working in projects
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Experience with commercial cards
  
* Have certifications in relevant areas such as communication, digital marketing, or project management (e.g., PMP, CMP)
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Self-sufficient
  
* Problem solver
  
* Quality-oriented
  
* Communicative
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work

title: Manager of Integration Solutions
description:
Schibsted Media is establishing a new IT organisation that will be responsible for all IT services in the new company. As the Manager of Integration Solutions, you will be part of the leadership team for the Applications Solutions department, which is responsible for setting up and delivering the new future-proof Media application portfolio aligned with the overall IT Strategy.
   

  

 The Integration Solutions team is a pivotal part of our IT department, tasked with ensuring seamless interoperability across our diverse suite of applications and platforms. As a key component under the Application Solutions umbrella, this team of skilled professionals works closely with various business units to design, develop, and manage integration solutions that enable fluid data exchange and deliver excellent application services. Focusing on innovation and scalability, this team plays a critical role in architecting and delivering the new application portfolio.
   

  

**What will you do in this role?**
 Build up your organisation which will both support, drive and finalise the split of your services from the remaining Schibsted organisation during the temporary service agreement period - to the new News Media setup; at the same time looking proactively on how to best deliver on a long-term integration platform in close collaboration with Enterprise Architects.
   

  

**As the Manager of Integration Solutions, you will:**
* Lead the team responsible for the design, implementation, quality assurance, monitoring and ongoing management of integration solutions across various platforms and applications.
* Collaborate with IT and business stakeholders to understand integration needs and translate them into robust, scalable solutions.
* Oversee the development, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of integration solutions to ensure high availability, reliability, and performance.
* Drive the adoption of best practices in API development, data exchange protocols, and integration patterns.
* Foster a culture of continuous improvement, encouraging innovation and the exploration of new technologies to enhance integration capabilities and other areas where improvements can be made
* Manage project timelines, resources, and budgets to meet the organisation’s objectives and deliverables.
* Manage relationships with third-party vendors who provide software, hardware, or consultancy services.


**Your background/experience:**
* Strong leadership skills, with a proven ability to guide and develop a high-performing engineering team.
* Hands on experience in designing and implementing integration solutions using a variety of platforms, middleware, and APIs.
* Experience with integration platforms such as Mulesoft.
* Excellent project management capabilities, adept at balancing multiple priorities in a dynamic environment.
* Deep understanding of data models, database design and data integration patterns.
* Experience of stakeholders’ management, including effective communication skills, capable of articulating complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


**Also good if you have:**
* Familiarity with microservices architecture and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Certifications related to project management or specific integration technologies.
* Proven experience in developing an integration platform in accordance with a technical strategy, as well as maintaining and evaluating it to adapt to changes over time.

title: Säkerhetsskyddshandläggare till Sweco!
description:
Har du en bakgrund inom säkerhetskydd och vill ha ett jobb som gör skillnad? Till Sweco som är en helhetsleverantör av tjänster inom säkerhet och skydd, söker vi nu en Säkerhetskyddshandläggare! Läs mer om tjänsten här och skicka in en ansökan redan idag.

 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.

Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
