 Alina Finnberg eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stn01@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105313

title: Business Controller, Tefal OBH Nordica Group, Stockholm.
description:
Finally! Meritmind is now recruiting a Business Controller to join the great financial team at OBH Tefal Nordica Group!
   

  

 You will take full responsibility of the Business Controlling for the one of the Nordic countries and support with Group Controlling tasks on Nordic level. You are self-motivated and have great communication skills as you will be working closely with both sales and marketing team.
   

  

 The position offers you a varied job in a market leading company. You will have great opportunities to make a difference and will become part of a professional and engaged Finance team!
   

  

**About The Role**
* Responsible for the local P&L
* Monitoring customer budgets, bonus and market support
* Credit management
* Follow-up of sales budget
* Follow-up of KAM sales/development according to budget and forecast
* Category follow-up
* Responsible for the budget and re-forecast process
* Provide statement and reports for the follow-up of product and sales
* Proactively analyze invoice numbers and identify business improvements
* Reporting trade statistics
* Support sales team within a specific country and have responsibility for business reports linked to KPI performance tracking and trend analysis
* Structure and implement the company’s financial management processes, in order to optimize business performance
* You will be involved in various projects and have a closely collaboration with the local sales and marketing team
* Reporting and analysis are key elements for the role


**Qualifications Required**
* Relevant university degree or equivalent
* Minimum 2-3 years of relevant experience, preferably as a Business or Retail Controller
* High level of business English, if you speak/understand Nordic language, it´s a bonus
* Strong Excel skills is necessary, if you have worked in SAP that is a plus


**Skills & Attributes**
* Ability to learn fast and enjoy fast moving environment
* Analytical, results oriented with a good business sense
* Practical experience in costing, analysis of major transactions and business
* Proactive and independent with the genuine interest in continuously seek to improve processes within the organization
* As a person you are outgoing and structured with a strong drive and interest in working closely with other departments


**The position is a full-time permanent employment with a 6-month probationary, starting as soon as possible or by agreement.** 
**Tefal – OBH Nordica Group offer the** 
**opportunity for its employees to work at home 2 days/ week and has several generous benefits. The HQis located in central Sundbyberg.**
**About Our Company**
 Tefal – OBH Nordica Group / Groupe SEB Nordic is a subsidiary of Groupe SEB International, global leader in the manufacturing of small domestic appliances and cookware. Groupe SEB Nordic develops, distributes, and sells innovative and exciting products under the brand naarket in 1975 and two-fold over the last 10 years (turnover 2022: €8 billions).
   

  

 Groupe SEB Nordic’s turnover amounts to approximately 800 million SEK and has about 170 employees based across Nordics. We have our Nordic headquarters in central Sundbyberg outside Stockholm and sales offices in Oslo, Copenhagen and Helsinki. In addition we have our Nordic Retail team working on the floor in our 11 stores across Nordics in direct contact with our customers.
   

  

**Application**
 For more information about the position, please contact Elma Hadziefendic at elma.hadziefendic@meritmind.se
   

  

 Interviews will take place continuously, so please send your application as soon as possible. Make sure your name and contact details are included in your CV. It is only possible to attach one document. Meritmind works to promote an objective and non-discriminatory recruitment process, meaning you will be asked to do a test if you proceed in this process.
   

  

**Please apply with your CV and personal letter in English.**
 Consider this before submitting your application (in accordance with GDPR legislation) Your application must not contain personal data regarding marital status, family situation/children, ethnic origin, age, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, health or sexual orientation
   

  

 Welcome with your application!
   

  

**Godkänn datalagring**
 För att kunna registrera din ansökan behöver vi ett godkännande att spara dina personuppgifter. Läs mer på vår
   

  

**Ansök till denna tjänst**
 Ansök med
   

  

 För att vi ska kunna genomföra en så objektiv rekryteringsprocess som möjligt ber vi dig utesluta känsliga personuppgifter så som ålder, civilstatus, familjesituation/barn, etniskt ursprung, politiska åsikter, religiös eller filosofisk övertygelse, medlemskap i fackförening, hälsa eller sexuell läggning.

title: Tech Lead Open Banking APIs at SEB Stockholm
description:
**SEB in Stockholm is looking for a Tech Lead to Account and Payment services for Open Banking APIs!**
 Do you want to contribute to one of our most important technical and strategical domains and solutions? SEB in Stockholm seeks an experienced Tech Lead, versed in financial APIs and Open Banking to drive our team and technical environment forward – from development to operations. We’ve already started to reimagine and rebuild, making sure our solutions are both future-proof and compliant and our focus going forward is continuing that journey, parallel with PSD compliance. With us, your domain knowledge, technical expertise and drive will shape our future solutions.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
**SEB Offers You**
* Agile and modern ways of working.
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views.
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.


**Your Challenge**
 As Tech Lead within the Open Banking API development team you will lead the team, consisting of backend developers and testers in designing, developing, and maintaining Java and Spring Boot applications, microservices, endpoints and APIs. You conduct code reviews, align best practices and mentor the developers in the team.
   

  

 You collaborate with Product Managers, business and architects to define business requirements and specify user flows, translating them to technical requirements and decisions. Our team work according to the ´you build it, you run it´ principle and we are responsible for our solutions throughout the DevOps cycle.
   

  

 We use Java, Spring Boot, Kafka and Maven, with Github and Docker for CI/CD, deploying in Openshift and monitoring with Splunk. Our APIs allow Third Party Apps and Services to integrate with our banking services.
   

  

 Take a look at the API products we have built, for account and payment services!
   

  

 https://developer.sebgroup.com/products/psd2-account-information
   

  

 https://developer.sebgroup.com/products/psd2-payment-initiation
   

  

**The Team and Workplace**
 The team consists of backend developers, a Scrum Master, a Tester and a PO. You will work in a diverse environment with teams and colleagues located in Stochholm and Vilnius.
   

  

 SEB offers a hybrid workplace solution where you can work both from home and at the office in Solna, and we spend appr. 2-3 days in the office per week. In addition to 4,500 workplaces, our office of almost 100,000 (!) square meters accommodates a gym, restaurants, a bicycle garage and terrace.
   

  

**About You**
 We´re looking for a collaborative, communicative and driven Lead, able to question the status quo and to represent and speak for the team in various forums.
   

  

 You have proven experience (several years) as lead developer for DevOps teams in the banking, fintech or insurance domain, with deep knowledge of microservices architecture and event-driven systems. You´re well-versed in financial APIs, e.g., payment initiation, account information services as well as Open Banking and compliance requirements. You have hands-on experience in Java, Spring Boot and APIs, and it´s of course additionally meritorious if you´re familiar with the other technologies in our stack. You have strong modelling and documentation skills.
   

  

 Our working language is English, and you have strong communicative skills both written and spoken in English. Swedish is a plus.
   

  

**Let´s Connect!**
 SEB has chosen to work with Ada Digital in this recruitment. Our recruitment process focuses on transparency, inclusion and a fast moving candidate experience. And now we want to know more about you – on your own terms! To apply, please fill out the short form, briefly motivate why you are interested in the position, and attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile. No additional documentation is needed. You can then, in real-time, follow your application online as our recruiters are working with it. We work with a continues selection process which means we might hire a candidate before the final apply date, so apply already today! Interested and want to know more? Please contact our recruiter today. We are looking forward to connecting soon!

title: Partner Development Manager Sweden
description:
**Title:** 
 Partner Development Manager Sweden
 



**Location:** 




 Stockholm, Stockholm, SE, 11157
 



**Requisition ID:** 
 126622
 



  





**About NetApp** 




 We’re forward-thinking technology people with heart. We make our own rules, drive our own opportunities, and try to approach every challenge with fresh eyes. Of course, we can’t do it alone. We know when to ask for help, collaborate with others, and partner with smart people. We embrace diversity and openness because it’s in our DNA. We push limits and reward great ideas. What is your great idea?
 



 "At NetApp, we fully embrace and advance a diverse, inclusive global workforce with a culture of belonging that leverages the backgrounds and perspectives of all employees, customers, partners, and communities to foster a higher performing organization." -George Kurian, CEO
 



  





**Job Summary** 




 We are seeking a driven Partner Development Manager to deliver on our Hybrid Cloud Strategy and drive adoption of NetApp's Infrastructure Solutions and Cloud Services. As part of the Nordic Partner Team, you will work with various levels of partner organizations, developing joint GTM strategies and executing Joint Business Plans. Your role involves supporting partners in their Hybrid Cloud Strategy and digital transformation, leveraging internal functions to establish credibility. You will own partner engagement and growth as well as collaborating with the sales team. NetApp sells products or services through Distributors and Channel Partners.
 



  





**Job Requirements** 




 You are a self-motivated, trustworthy, and proactive individual with a strong desire to drive business initiatives and development with partners. Your influence increases partner preference for NetApp, boosts market penetration, and expands the share of wallet. You excel at translating NetApp's Infrastructure solutions into partner strategies and goals. You actively seek new contacts and opportunities within partner organizations, while also building external networks to support business needs. Additionally, you possess a solid understanding of the industry ecosystem.
 



  





**Education** 




 Our ideal candidate brings preferably a minimum of 8 years of partner engagement experience and a proven track record. A broad knowledge of IT-Infrastructure solutions is desired.
 



  





  





**Did you know…** 




 Statistics show women apply to jobs only when they’re 100% qualified. But no one is 100% qualified. We encourage you to shift the trend and apply anyway! We look forward to hearing from you.
 



  





**Why NetApp?** 




 In a world full of generalists, NetApp is a specialist. No one knows how to elevate the world’s biggest clouds like NetApp. We are data-driven and empowered to innovate. Trust, integrity, and teamwork all combine to make a difference for our customers, partners, and communities.
 



  





 We expect a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time off per year to volunteer with their favorite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. We also offer financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.
 



  





 If you run toward knowledge and problem-solving, join us.

title: Business Controller For a leading retail company
description:
We are now looking for a Business Controller with an interest in and understanding of Technology. This is a consultancy opportunity with a one year contract starting as soon as possible.
 



  





  





**About Client:** 




 Our client is a Swedish multinational clothing company headquartered in Stockholm. They operate in 74 countries with over 5,000 stores under the various company brands, with 126,000 full-time equivalent positions. It is the second-largest global clothing retailer. The company makes its online shopping available in 33 countries.
 



  





  





 As Business Controller, you will collaborate and work closely with stakeholders and other senior leaders within and outside Business Tech. A central part of the role will be to guide and support your units and to contribute to continuous improvement. Your main focus is to enable and encourage a sound business mindset for the invested funds to maximize business value in line with company objectives, while ensuring good control and knowledge of our spend.
 



  





 As a Business Controller, you´ll be an integral part of a collaborative team working closely with fellow controllers on a daily basis. We are looking for someone whose communication style is clear, inspiring and inclusive and who can effectively influence, empower and motivate others. In addition, you will contribute to a positive workplace where honest feedback is encouraged and appreciated. You should enjoy working in a changing environment and approach improvements and new ways of working with an open mind.
 



  





  





**Furthermore, you will:** 



* Be responsible for the execution of budgeting, forecasting and reporting for your units and consolidate financial reporting for Business Tech
* Manage monthly cut activities
* Support with analysis and guidance for strategic decisions and how to implement them
* Monitor and secure specific financial flows (recharge costs, invoices, accruals)
* Ensure data quality in relevant systems and sources
* Participate in the work to continuously optimize our budgeting and forecast processes
* Undertake analysis and investigations which contribute to business impact and cost consciousness
* Inform and educate Business Tech leaders on financial planning and follow-up
* Support and control the purchase processes including invoice handling and agreements
* Be involved all the way from analysis and setting short-term goals to follow-ups and building long-term strategies and challenging the way we do business.
* Have leadership ability, entrepreneurial spirit and a strategic mindset
* Have a genuine curiosity and interest in technology as well as numbers



  





**Qualifications:** 




 We believe you are flexible, pragmatic and able to work in an environment that is not yet formalized. We believe that you have the ability to support the business with a clear customer focus in mind and the ability to challenge and act independently, take own initiatives and lead the way – always striving to find the best way forward and with a strategic mindset. You are structured, analytical, and passionate about people. You understand and embrace agile ways of working and incorporate them into our daily work. You are a true team player and believe in a culture of collaboration, transparency, and trust.
 



  





  





**Furthermore, we believe you have:** 



* Minimum 3 years of experience of a similar Controller role, preferably in a global company
* Academic degree in business, engineering or equivalent area
* A solid understanding of financial principles and practices
* Ability to facilitate constructive communication, collaboration, and knowledge-sharing between different stakeholders
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and able to find solutions in complex situations and involve and influence various stakeholders
* Proficiency in financial tools and software such as Excel, Pbi, SAP etc.
* Ability to challenge status quo and ways of working
* Ability to inspire and come up with new ideas
* Ability to prioritize and focus on what is important



  





**Sounds interesting?** 




 If you possess the required skills and experience, we invite you to apply. Please note that ongoing screening will take place, and the position might be filled before the application deadline.

title: Head of Manufacturing
description:
*Want to influence the bigger picture? At Saab, you can realise amazing innovations that keep people and societies safe. Together, we can truly make an impact – and your part matters.*
 Your role
   

  

 Are you an experienced leader who excels in both strategic thinking and inspiring teams? If so, we invite you to join our dynamic team at Saab as Head of Manufacturing. You will be joining the production department during an exciting phase of rapid growth, where your role will be pivotal, and your influence will play a significant part in shaping our future directions.
   

  

 We are now looking for a manager to hook up with our existing Manufacturing Manager and take the lead together for further develop of our Production Järfälla department, holding 170 members, with 9 managers. As Head of Manufacturing, you will have the responsibility for approximately half of the Manufacturing department. You will be responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations and steer Production in the right direction in cooperation and harmonized way with your Manufacturing Manager colleague. This includes a diverse range of manufacturing activities.
   

  

 Your responsibilities in short:
   

  

* Lead according to Saab's core organisational values.
* Translate Saab, Surveillance, and Production strategies into clear and effectively communicated targets for your team.
* Ensure on-time deliveries with the right quality and cost.
* Develop and implement strategies to optimize manufacturing processes, focusing on efficiency, quality, and safety.
* Handle personnel related matters such as recruiting, target setting and follow-up, salary reviews, budgeting etc.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to meet production goals and timelines.
* Assume full responsibility for results within your domain, encompassing safety, health, quality, delivery capacity, efficiency, and finance.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance manufacturing capabilities and reduce costs.
* Cultivate a culture of innovation and excellence within the manufacturing team.
* Contribute to the overarching strategic direction of Production Järfälla as a member of the management team.


 Production Järfälla is part of the Business area Surveillance that offers world-leading technology for monitoring and decision support to protect against threats. The portfolio covers radar systems, electronic warfare, combat systems as well as safety and security solutions.
   

  

 We are part of the Business Unit Fighter Core Capabilities, with a mission to primarily serve Business Units Naval Combat Systems and Fighter Core Capabilities with production capacity and capability.
   

  

 You will be a valued member of the Production Järfälla management team, collaborating with colleagues from PMO, Production Planning, Production Development, and Quality, with support from HRBP, Finance, and Business Excellence. You will report directly to the Head of Production Järfälla.
   

  

 This position offers a unique opportunity to shape the future of manufacturing within a world-renowned organisation.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 We envision a management team where each member contributes their unique experiences and skills to create an effective and dynamic environment. As a leader, you will demonstrate effective communication and leadership skills to foster commitment and energy within the organisation. You lead through values, visions, and goals, and you're a leader who drives change alongside your team.
   

  

 Qualifications:
   

  

* Degree in engineering, manufacturing, or long experience in related field.
* A minimum of 5 years of experience within a production environment, preferably in low volumes and prototypes from electronic manufacturing, mechanical machine equipment or medical devices.
* Experience in leading and coaching teams, preferably in a role as Line Manager or similar.
* Proven experience in manufacturing leadership roles, with a track record of successfully leading teams and managing complex manufacturing processes.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and leadership abilities.
* Knowledge of quality management systems and lean and agile manufacturing principles.
* Proficiency in both spoken and written Swedish and English.


 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 What you will be part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 22,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 Do you want to get to know our business and our people a little bit better? Here you can find some stories told by our employees.
   

  

 Please note that this is an ongoing recruitment process, and the position may be filled before the advertised closing date.

title: Senior Engineering Manager (Trading)
description:
*We are Tibber, the energy company that wants you to use less energy. Whaaat? That’s right. We’ll get back to that. Yes, we are by definition an energy company, but we’re more techy than most. How and why you might ask? Well, a third of our employees are actually working on developing products and solutions that can help you use energy in a smarter way and at a lower cost – all with the help of cool fancy tech. Good for our customers, their wallets, and the planet.*
*Our growth rate has been truly amazing, and still, we’re just getting started. With millions of smart devices connected to the Tibber platform (like electric vehicles and smart thermostats), we have one of the most unique portfolios trading energy on the market* 
 .
   

  

 Hear This Brand New Podcast With Our Head Of Trading Jacob Dalton On Some Of The Latest And Greatest Projects Tibber Are Working On
   

  

**Job Mission 🚀🚀**
 We are now looking for a passionate and experienced Senior Engineering Manager to help us on our continued journey and growth within House of Engineering and specifically our Trading Product Area. As a Senior Engineering Manager at Tibber, you will inspire, be the manager of and apply leadership to the Engineers and engineering efforts in your Product Area. Within this area you will be part of the Product Area Leadership where you will be a partner in crime with your Product Area Lead counterpart. In this role you will balance business and product impact with accountability for sustained technical innovation and delivery as well as keeping the lights on of the technology ownership of the area.
   

  

 Tibber is on a mission to create Europe’s largest consumer Virtual Power Plant. As Senior Engineering Manager for Trading, you will lead the engineering team that builds the growth engine to propel us across Europe. You will work on technology that is at the heart of pulling off a magic trick so powerful that it moves energy through time. The engineering effort to pull this off includes both power trading and flexibility trading and requires a wide range of technologies including building portfolio optimisation and algorithmic trading infrastructure that seamlessly integrate with the larger HEMS orchestration through Orleans actor model infrastructure.
   

  

 Our Product Areas consist of development teams called squads, and in this Product Area, you will work with two squads both on Power Trading as well as Flexibility Trading. You’ll also work with Tibber's engineering systems and the bigger engineering team as well as your engineering leadership to build high-performing development teams that find alignment on Product Area priorities so that we can reach higher levels of autonomy and ultimately speed.
   

  

**This is you!**
**Relevant industry experience** 
 . Ideally you have proven experience working within the power trading industry. Having a focus around flexibility, and specifically of distributed energy resources, is a big plus.
   

  

**Lead, drive, and facilitate complex technical delivery.** 
 This is within the Product Area whether it's architectural alignment with Staff Engineers and Senior Engineers or coordinating and leading technical projects from start to finish that span across Product Areas.
   

  

**You thrive when coaching, mentoring, and growing great people** 
 ,
 **not just great tech and products.** 
 You do this with a big grain of humbleness and respect for each individual’s growth and competency. You find yourself easily building rapport and trust with the people around you.
   

  

**You have a proven track record of applying pragmatism to reaching your targets.** 
 You also follow this up with a solid leadership style that takes accountability for the long-term and strategic success of your team’s technology and the value it provides to our customers.
   

  

**The developer experience is close to your heart** 
 . You care for solid software practices and conscious experimentation letting data guide your decisions. You are an active part of the stand-ups of your teams and are not afraid to lead within the rituals of the teams.
   

  

**You have a strong engineering background.** 
 This allows you to quickly understand developer toils and challenges so that you can stay to the point and take correct action when needed. This also helps you in team discussions when trade-offs to solutions need decisions to move forward.
   

  

**Ideally you can ⚡️⚡️**
**Inspire with your leadership.** 
 As your Product Area grows you will lead engineering managers with teams of their own as well as build and lead groups of engineers directly reporting to you through hiring, coaching, mentoring, feedback and hands-on career development. Tibber is in constant change and growth and this requires dynamic and pragmatic leadership.
   

  

**Mission achieve.** 
 Be a partner-in-crime with the Trading Product Area Lead by driving the technical delivery and strategy to your reaching your mission.
   

  

**Naturally facilitate.** 
 Facilitate collaboration with other engineers, data analysts, product managers and designers for solutions getting us closer to our mission.
   

  

**Foster and nurture the team and it’s culture.** 
 Build and cultivate a healthy, transparent and open engineering culture that's inclusive and really really fun to work in.
   

  

**Grow and develop your team.** 
 Evangelize engineering best practices and grow the technical skills of the team.
   

  

**🦹🏽‍♀️👨‍🎤Get Ready For**
**Innovation.** 
 A way to change the landscape of one of the most important industries on the planet.
   

  

**Growth.** 
 A possibility to learn a lot and push the barriers of what you think is possible, with the possibility to grow personally and professionally.
   

  

**Autonomy.** 
 An autonomous and humble culture in a scale-up adventure.
   

  

**Empowerment.** 
 Your voice matters, we are a place to work where laughter and support amongst diverse and inclusive colleagues are guaranteed.
   

  

**Flexibility.** 
 Whether this is towards health, wellness, equipment, or other allowances important to you, we will do our best to accommodate your needs. Many of us are parents and we all value a good work-life balance.
   

  

**💆🏻‍♀️💆🏽‍♂️The Tibber Mindset**
 Being on a mission to change an industry as we do fundamentally also means being prepared for the unexpected. Tibber is a startup in the word's true sense, which means we are on a journey of constant change. We do what others say can’t be done, try and fail together but never lose sight of our users.
   

  

 We work passionately with sustainability and a circular approach, both with our products and in the entire ecosystem that is affected by everything we do.
   

  

 We're very proud of being a mission-driven startup with thousands and thousands of new users every month. Starting out with two passionate founders in 2016, we're now 300+ people working for Tibber in our offices in Stockholm, Førde, Berlin, Amsterdam, Oslo, and Helsinki, and with that number growing each week, we’re still just getting started. Through 2024 we will continue to grow within our markets, and we are thrilled to be backed by investors like Balderton Capital, Eight Roads Ventures, Founders Fund, Summa, and Schibsted.
   

  

*At Tibber, we are committed to hiring, developing, and retaining exceptional people regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, or gender identity. We strongly encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply.*
 Tibber is a different company in a very traditional industry. We are aiming to create the best digital tool so that you as a user can apply new technologies to reduce energy consumption and power costs.

title: Vice President Consulting Services, Trilogy (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 If you think most CEOs are full of themselves (and full of other stuff)... keep reading.
   

  

 Here’s a CEO track that requires — and actually rewards — zero experience being a CEO. In this role, you’ll become an incredibly effective, customer-facing CEO in an environment with more than 100 software products.
   

  

 Who You Are
   

  

 You’ve never been a CEO before. Probably because most of the time, “CEO” is just a 3-letter code for “an exhausting hamster wheel of team building and internal operations logistics.” And hopping on that hamster wheel would be a huge waste of your talent and potential.
   

  

 You’re smart. You keep things clear and direct. And while you’ve worked in SaaS for many years, you don’t have a decade of outdated “leadership” learnings to unlearn. You’re ready to be the leader that smart employees like you have been waiting for. This job right here is your launchpad.
   

  

 You're a generative AI power user. You've used ChatGPT, Claude, Bard, or a similar tool to automate previously manual workflows (note: this role does not require a software development background).
   

  

 You should already be well on your way to building a strong personal brand. We believe in the importance of a personal brand, and we’ll help you develop yours. You should understand the benefits and impact of a personal brand, the long-tail nature of content, and the effort it takes.
   

  

 You have experience with quickly moving products, particularly in leadership roles during the launch of epic new features. If you’ve been part of teams going from Seed through Series A/B rounds, that’s a huge plus. You’ve got proven ability to get customers excited about new product features and have used metrics like net dollar retention and win-back rates (and others) to measure the impact of new product features.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Implementing AI-driven Productivity Improvements: Utilizing generative AI tools to streamline and automate various workflows across the company.
* Customer Engagement and Feedback: Interacting with customers to gather insights and feedback, and using this information to enhance product offerings.
* Develop a Personal Monopoly: Publishing podcast episodes and blog posts and building a social media following to evangelize your portfolio's AI-driven products.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Busywork that drains your creativity.
* Day-in, day-out team management or internal operations that distract from your vision.
* Tinker with the business model to figure out what works. (Remember, we’re giving you the playbook.)


**Basic Requirements**
**Vice President Consulting Services key responsibilities**
* At least 8 years of work experience in the enterprise software industry
* Leadership experience in marketing, sales, business development, partnerships, professional services, or another hands-on customer-facing domain
* Experience using generative AI tools to achieve quantifiable productivity improvements
* Currently based in North America, South America, or Europe


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-4649-SE-Stockhol-VicePresidentC.002

title: Channel Marketing Lead till Samsung
description:
Everything we do at Samsung is driven by an unyielding passion for excellence – and an unfaltering commitment to develop the best products and services on the market. In today’s fast-paced global economy, change is constant and innovation is critical to a company’s survival. As we have done for 70 years, we set our sights on the future, anticipating market needs and demands so we can steer our company toward long-term success. As a Channel Marketing Lead, you will have an integral part in ensuring we stay on top of the market and continue to enrich and simplify the consumers’ lives.
   

  

**You will be responsible for**
* Creating marketing business planning with key partners in partnership with Key Account Managers for selected customers (resellers and customers)
* Optimizing Samsung brand presence with reseller; ATL, BTL, CRM, homepage and in-store with dedicated customers for our products within MX Division; Smartphone & Connected Devices.
* Be responsible for marketing business planning with key operators and customers: yearly, quarterly channel and monthly activation planning with customer and sales.
* Be responsible for understanding the business strategy for the given customers and operators as well as key consumer and shopper strategies.
* Together with sales set the omni-channel strategy and secure best presence and mix of activation for given product groups and customers. Ownership of Samsung branded presence online and in-store in given reseller.
* Planning of fixed installations, as well as secure share of voice for branded retail, as well as ROI.
* Work with MX teams and organize and execute work needed to reach existing and new customers.


 The Channel Marketing Lead will be responsible for channel marketing and sales driven activation as well as for bringing concepts to the major sales channels. This includes responsibility for ensuring sell-through activation in the channels/stores where Samsung products are represented and sold.
   

  

 Co-hosted events are other areas where the CML will be responsible for planning and execution.
   

  

 Qualifications and Experience:
   

  

* University degree within marketing and communication.
* Fluent in Swedish & English, both verbally and written.
* Minimum 3 years’ of experience within Customer/Channel Marketing roles measured on sell-out growth
* Media and customer campaign planning experience
* B2C experience is a merit
* Customer joint sell-out 360 planning, execution & review
* Customer channel integration & sales maximization
* ROI understanding
* Experience from local media landscape
* Understanding of local consumer journey Traffic generation/conversion driven marketing experience
* Branded Retail development experience


 Samsung is a highly dynamic company in a fast-moving industry, so there are many opportunities to grow and develop! In order to enjoy working with us you must be a doer and a person who appreciate tempo, change and take own initiatives. You need to be open to new ideas and new ways of thinking. No day is like the other here at Samsung, and we want you to be curious, to see the opportunity in fast and sometimes unexpected changes.
   

  

 Samsung Nordics is a multicultural company with people from all over the world. This is one of our greatest strengths since it makes us a team with very varied knowledge and experiences. But despite our differences, we all have one thing in common – and that is our pursuit for innovation. We work to address some of the issues that society faces in the Nordics, and we believe that our innovative technology can be a force of good helping us with this.
   

  

**About The Assignment, We Prefer Project Employment**
 For this assignment, you will be hired as a consultant by HIROY. We offer our consultants a generous package, and you will also become a part of our extensive network of agencies. This will provide you with the opportunity to deploy your skills and interact with our network of consultants.
   

  

 We often offer on an ongoing basis. This means that we sometimes remove the assignment from our website earlier than the application deadline. If you are interested in an assignment, we recommend that you apply immediately.
   

  

**Startdage:** 
 01-Jul-2024, 100%
   

  

**Hybrid Model** 
 : Stockholm, Kista

title: Accountant
description:
foodora is a quick commerce and delivery company, present in eight countries in Europe - Austria, Czech, Denmark, Hungary, Finland, Norway, Sweden and Slovakia. With the mission to deliver an amazing, fast and affordable experience, foodora aims to give customers more time to focus on what matters most to them, as well as growing along with their partners, riders and community along the way. foodora is part of Delivery Hero, a pioneer quick commerce company, building the next generation of e-commerce across its operations in over 70 countries across Asia, Europe, Latin America, the Middle East and Africa.
 



 For more information, please visit www.foodora.com
 



  





 foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s leading local delivery platform operating in 70+ countries worldwide
 



  





**About the opportunity** 




**Are you an Accountant we can count on? We are looking for a driven person to join our finance team who will work with the day-to-day bookkeeping for foodora, our platform company. We are looking for someone who is as passionate about their work as we are and who thrives in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. We need you to tackle your tasks with confidence and commitment, and not shy away from new challenges.** 




  





**Your mission** 



* Participate in monthly, quarterly, and annual financial closings and audits.
* Perform balance account reconciliations in ADRA Balancer.
* Handle B2B accounts receivable, including payment follow-ups, reconciliation, and sending reminders.
* Follow up and reconcile accounts payable and expense reserves.
* Actively participate in and develop ongoing restaurant/store invoicing.
* Participate in and drive projects related to the development and automation of our processes in SAP and other internal financial systems.
* Perform cash and bank reconciliations.
* Manage and reconcile expense reporting.



 We are looking for a true foodorian who dares to go further. We are looking for someone who is
 **solution-oriented** 
 , has a proactive approach, and dares to take initiative. You can
 **prioritize** 
 and see things from a helicopter perspective. You put
 **the team** 
 before yourself and agree with us that having fun at work is important. If you are also both
 **structured** 
 and organized, then you might be the person we are looking for.
 



  





  





 Our selection process is continuous and the ad may close before the recruitment process is completed, if we’ve moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
 



  





 Our recruitment process will include the following:
 



 📞 Telephone interview - Let’s cover the basics!
 



 💡 Psychometric tests via Alva Labs - We use science-based methodology.
 



 🤝 First interview - Time to know each other a bit better!
 



 💼 Case interview - Do your magic and show us your skills!
 



 ✔️ Reference- & background check - Final step before we’ll become colleagues.
 



  





 Start date: Upon agreement
 



  





**Qualifications / What you need to be successful** 



* Relevant post-secondary education, for example, from Vocational School or University.
* Approximately 1-2 years of relevant experience working with accounting.
* Experience with performing monthly reconciliations independently.
* Proficient in Excel and previously worked in a high-transaction company with partially automated accounting processes is meritorious.
* A big plus if you have previous experience with SAP and/or ADRA Balancer.
* foodora’s corporate language is English, so we prefer that you are equally comfortable working fluently in both Swedish and English.



  





  





 Studies have shown that women and some minorities are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. If you are interested in this role and you have most of the skills we’re looking for, we encourage you to apply anyway!
 



  





**What’s in it for you?** 



* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora such as free group training at Sats & reduced price on massage.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and inspiring courses within our learning tool Sana
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!

title: Director Operational Excellence
description:
Join our esteemed team at Basware as a
   

  

**Director of Quality and Operational Excellence** 
 - Integrated Management Systems & Certification.
   

  

 In this role, your primary focus will be on process management, fostering continuous improvement, and ensuring compliance with ISO standards and other relevant certifications as we embark on our journey to become best-in-class in Software as a Service (SaaS). You will lead the oversight of the integrated management systems and information security control frameworks. As a Director of Quality and Operational Excellence, you'll spearhead initiatives in risk and quality management, driving process development and improvement.
   

  

 At Basware, we're pioneers in our industry, filled with passionate innovators who strive for excellence every day. The leadership culture thrives on driving the mission and strategy, leading business performance, and building sustainable growth. As a critical part of our global team, you'll work alongside highly motivated individuals to make it all just happen for our customers.
   

  

 We're seeking a dynamic individual with high integrity and global mindset to lead our operational excellence endeavors, reporting directly to the CIO.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Own and Drive Excellence: Take charge of our Basware-wide Integrated Management System (IMS) and information security control frameworks. Drive process development and quality initiatives to ensure continuous improvement and compliance with selected standards according to our IMS
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Participate in enterprise-wide initiatives, working closely with stakeholders and process owners to assist with process improvements and documentation, and on the overall quality strategy, key performance indicators, policies, work instructions, and KPIs to enhance business performance at Basware
* Enterprise Risk Management: Oversee our Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) procedures
* Certification Maintenance and Roadmaps: Ensure compliance with existing certifications (ISO 9001, ISO 27001, ISAE 3000 and 3402, and HIPAA) while charting roadmaps for obtaining new certifications (ISO27017, ISO27018)
* Educate and Communicate: Act as an ambassador for quality standards across the organization, educating stakeholders on the IMS and obtained certifications
* Internal Audit Program: Drive and maintain our Internal Audit Program, providing necessary support to ensure adherence to standards
* Quality Reporting: Produce monthly Quality reports and host Integrated Management System reviews with executive leaders
* Vendor Management: Manage vendors engaged in quality, process development, and certifications, including price negotiations
* Team Leadership: Supervise and mentor Operational Excellence team members, providing guidance and support for professional growth and development
* Subject Matter Expertise: Serve as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for customer inquiries concerning IMS and standards related questions, providing expert guidance and support as needed.


**Key Qualifications**
* Extensive Experience: Minimum of 10 years of experience in defining and developing business processes in a global company
* Strong Quality Management Expertise: Proven track record in maintaining and improving Quality Management Systems, encompassing strategies, policies, processes, personnel, and systems. Demonstrated proficiency in standards such as ISO 9001, ISO 27001, ISAE 3000 & 3402, and HIPAA
* Implementation Experience: Proven track record of successfully leading one or more enterprise-wide process and system implementations, demonstrating expertise in project management, stakeholder engagement, and driving organizational change
* Leadership Skills: Demonstrated ability to effectively lead and motivate teams to achieve both tactical and strategic goals. Experienced in third-party management and skilled in cross-functional collaboration with interdisciplinary teams
* Results-Oriented: Driven by results, with a focus on prioritization and efficiency in a fast-paced environment
* Vendor Management: Experience in vendor management, including price negotiations.
* Language skills: Fluency in spoken and written English


**Desired Attributes**
* Integrity and Confidentiality: High level of personal integrity and professionalism in handling confidential matters
* Energy and Enthusiasm: Thrive in a dynamic environment, with energy and enthusiasm to drive positive change
* Global Mindset: Comfortable working in a global matrix organization, with the ability to navigate cultural nuances and complexities.


**Education:**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Sciences, or Business Administration.


 Join us in shaping the future of Basware and making a difference on a global scale. Apply now to be part of our journey towards operational excellence.

title: Nordics COO
description:
Chief Operating Officer, Nordics
   

  

 Marsh is seeking exceptional candidates for the position of Chief Operating Officer, Nordics, based in our Stockholm office. This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact and shape the future of our operations division.
   

  

 What can you expect?
   

  

* Collaborate with the European COO to build a world-class, centralized operations division for Europe, influencing and selling the future structure to our leadership team.
* Support the Nordics CEO and Executive team as a trusted advisor on all matters related to operations and technology.
* Lead the development and implementation of strategies critical to achieving operational excellence in a region or function with revenue exceeding >USD 100M
* Drive the operationalization of the Nordics' business strategy, creating a best-in-class Operations & Technology organization.
* Oversee a talented team of 40+ employees and contractors.


 What is in it for you?
   

  

* Join an organization that values your growth and development, providing ample opportunities to learn and advance your career.
* Thrive in a client-focused environment that emphasizes operational excellence and accountability.
* Gain exposure to senior leadership and contribute to major growth initiatives.
* Collaborate with a high-performing team that values efficiency and embraces a culture of collaboration.
* Be part of an organization that recognizes and rewards exceptional performance, offering opportunities for advancement and professional success.


 We will count on you to:
   

  

* Create a client-focused environment that drives operational excellence and accountability.
* Develop and implement Operations-related initiatives to maximize performance, revenue, and market share.
* Design and implement capability models to optimize operations within core brokerage and portfolio businesses.
* Establish and monitor operating level expectations through service level agreements (SLAs).
* Ensure successful delivery of strategic initiatives, including M&A and transformation, to optimize project portfolio returns.


 What you need to have:
   

  

* Extensive experience in Operations and Technology, ideally within the insurance industry.
* Demonstrated results in leading organizational transformation projects.
* Experience in leading M&A post-acquisition integration for transactions between $10-250M.
* Proven capability of leveraging technology in operational arenas.
* Excellent leadership, managerial, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to thrive in a matrixed and ambiguous environment.


 What makes you stand out?
   

  

* A proven track record in leading successful organizational transformation projects.
* Experience in M&A post-acquisition integration.
* Strong technology acumen and ability to leverage technology in operational arenas.


 We look forward to receiving your application and welcoming you to our dynamic team!
   

  

*Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk adviser. With over 45,000 colleagues operating in more than 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh & McLennan Companies (NYSE: MMC), the leading global professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue approaching US $17 billion and 86,000 colleagues worldwide, MMC helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer, and Oliver Wyman. Follow Marsh on Twitter @MarshGlobal; LinkedIn; Facebook; and YouTube or subscribe to BRINK.*
*We embrace a culture that celebrates and promotes the many backgrounds, heritages and perspectives of our colleagues and clients regardless of their gender expression or identity, marital or civil partnership status, ethnic origin, nationality, age, background, disability, sexual orientation or beliefs. We are proud of our inclusive culture where everyone feels empowered to bring their whole selves to work and thrive. Learn more about our foundational values, mission and vision for the future by reviewing our Greater Good Policy.*
**R\_264867**

title: Senior Product Designer, Design Systems
description:
**Job Description**
 Wolt is seeking a
 **Senior Product Designer** 
 to join our
 **Design Systems team** 
 . In this role, you will help to build and maintain design systems that enable our product design teams to create high-quality, consistent, and scalable user interfaces for our platform. You will collaborate closely with designers, product managers, and engineers to ensure that our design system upports their needs and aligns with our brand guidelines and design principles.
   

  

 At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

 You are someone who has mastered the craft of turning insights into beautifully designed products, who can inspire organizations through prototyping and storytelling to ensure their final work has maximum impact for the customer. We hope that you have strong visual design and interaction design skills, and must be an excellent communicator in order to support designers who are using the system, and to align and collaborate with them on the evolution of the system.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Shape, maintain and manage the Wolt design language system that meets the needs of our product and engineering teams.
* Listen carefully. The better you understand our users' problems the better your solutions will be. It’s important for us to know we are solving for real people and not just the loudest voice in the room.
* Collaborate across teams. You’ll partner closely with product and engineering teams to find elegant but practical solutions to design challenges and ensure the design system is driving the desired user experience. You’ll provide the thought leadership to inspire and develop the right design direction. Together, you’ll solve problems and come up with solutions that delight our users.
* You work closely with engineers to ensure the efficient and effective implementation of the system, and collaborate with designers to help them identify and create design solutions, new elements and components that adhere to the system.
* Imagine the way forward. You’ll take full ownership of your work, and be responsible for every last detail, every step of the way. You monitor the usage of the system and provide feedback on how to improve it.


**Our humble expectations**
* Mastery. You are a versatile t-shaped designer who uses a full range of skills—product design, interaction design, and visual design—to ensure you deliver magical experiences to the customer.
* You understand the importance of delivery and how it can impact people’s lives for good.
* You’re a strong communicator. Who can inspire teams towards action and empathy for the user. Who communicates the design system to all stakeholders in product, engineering and design.
* You have a people-focused design mentality. Constantly looking to hone your design instinct through user feedback. Whether that’s hands-on user research or a quantitative A/B test.
* Are passionate about delivery and how it can impact people's lives for good.
* Can concept on the fly and collaborate with anyone to get things done
* Keep up to date with the latest design trends and techniques.
* Thrive in a fast-paced organization.


**Next Steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Elif Dilan Ayaz (elifdilan.ayaz@wolt.com).

title: Chefscontroller till Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset
description:
*Är du en skicklig och detaljorienterad ekonom med starkt ledarskap? Har du förmågan att navigera genom komplexa finansiella landskap och driva förbättringar i ekonomiska processer? Vi söker nu en engagerad Chefscontroller som vill vara med och forma framtiden på Karolinska universitetssjukhuset.*
**Du erbjuds**
* Att vara ansvarig för att leda och utveckla våra grupper inom Central Controlling, Specialister och Financial Control
* Att säkerställa att våra finansiella rapporter är korrekta och i tid samt att våra interna kontroller är robusta och effektiva
* Unika möjligheter till professionell utveckling erbjuds i en av Europas främsta sjukhusmiljöer. Självklart får du också ta del av våra generella förmåner som Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset erbjuder dig.


**Om tjänsten**
 Stab Ekonomi och Inköps uppdrag är att tillse att Karolinskas ekonomiska resultat redovisas på ett korrekt sätt externt och internt. Vi stöttar verksamheten i planering, uppföljning, rapportering och analys av Karolinskas ekonomi och vårdproduktion. Vi ansvarar för ekonomistyrning av teman/funktioner och staber samt utveckling och förvaltning av ekonomiprocesser exempelvis budget, självkostnader och KPP samt fakturering. Vi har även ett samordnande ansvar för styrningsfrågor samt ansvarar för upphandling och inköp på Karolinska
   

  

 Som chefscontroller kommer du att leda fyra grupper med totalt 50 medarbetare. Grupperna leds av en gruppchef som är direktrapporterande till dig. Grupperna arbetar med rapportering till ägarna, utveckling av styrninen inom sjukhuset, fördjupad kunskap inom olika områden, verksamhetsnära ekonomi- och verksamhetsstyrning med mera. Genom enhetliga arbetssätt i linje med Karolinskas Produktions- och Ekonomistyrningsmodell så säkerställs god kostnadskontroll och produktionsutveckling.
   

  

**Som Chefscontroller Ska Du**
* säkerställa effektiva och tvärfunktionella arbetssätt, inom controlling men även inom sjukhuset
* leda och utveckla gruppen mot uppsatta mål i linje med Karolinskas värderingar och principer
* vara en delaktig och aktivt bidra till Karolinskas styrmodell implementeras i hela verksamheten
* vara delaktig och aktivt bidra till utveckling av Karolinska kärnprocesser
* säkerställa att resurser fördelas mellan verksamheterna utifrån behov och efterfrågan


**Vi söker dig som**
 Har en bakgrund som chefscontroller eller motsvarande roll. Du besitter goda kunskaper inom
   

  

 ekonomistyrning i komplexa organisationer.
   

  

* Du är en naturlig ledare om är villig att tillsammans med gruppen göra vad som krävs för att leverera
* Arbetar strategiskt och resultatinriktat med stor självständighet
* Är driven och har en stark kommunikativ förmåga
* Är serviceorienterad och engagerad och inställd på att kunna lösa komplexa problem
* Besitter affärsmässighet, kundfokus och kundförståelse
* I ditt arbete är strukturerad, noggrann, analytisk och har förståelse för detaljerna såväl som förmågan att se samband i ett större perspektiv


 I denna rekrytering lägger vi stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Krav**
* Högskoleutbildning inom ekonomi eller motsvarande
* Kvalificerad ekonom med betydande erfarenhet (10 år) i en finansiell ledningsroll
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Excel samt arbete i ekonomisystem, BI-verktyg eller liknande
* Har förmågan att bygga nätverk på alla nivåer inom Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset
* Förmåga att proaktivt identifiera utmaningar och möjligheter, ta fram lösningar och agera inom hela mandatet för att implementera dem


**Om rekryteringsprocessen**
 I vår rekryteringsprocess använder vi oss av Assessio:s test MAP och Matrigma. MAP är ett personlighetstest och Matrigma är ett icke-verbalt begåvningstest och båda bygger på arbetspsykologisk forskning. Testerna används som ett komplement till dina erfarenheter och kompetenser och syftet är att göra vår urvalsprocess kvalitetssäker och transparent. Efter ansökningstidens slut kommer du att få ett mejl med en länk till testerna. Du får sedan tre arbetsdagar på dig att genomföra testerna. Din ansökan är inte komplett förrän du genomfört testerna.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte.
   

  

 För att din ansökan ska vara komplett ska den innehålla:
   

  

* CV
* Genomförda tester (MAP och Matrigma)
* Övriga bilagor (bilagor bifogas i förekommande fall)
* Personligt brev (frivilligt)


 Inför tillsättning av befattning som innefattar vård av barn och ungdom, kontrolleras den som erbjuds tjänsten mot misstanke- och belastningsregistret. Läs mer om rekryteringsprocessen och om vilka kontroller som utförs på Karolinska här.
   

  

**Om Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset**
 Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.
   

  

 Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!
   

  

**Stab Ekonomi och inköp**
 För att stödja sjukhusets alla kliniska verksamheter arbetar jurister, ekonomer, kommunikatörer, HR, Inköpare och IT för att vi tillsammans ska generera vård i världsklass och vara en verkligt Attraktiv Arbetsgivare! Här kan du läsa mer om oss.
   

  

**Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm**
 Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar.
   

  

 Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
   

  

 Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen.
   

  

 Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion.

title: Marketing Lead
description:
About the role
 
  





**Do you want to join us and together embark on a journey where we take the B2B Marketing space by storm as our Marketing Lead?** 

  
 

 We’re building an AI-powered product with the potential to transform B2B Marketing, and we’re looking for a hands-on and strategic marketing partner to join us on this exciting journey. As our Founding Marketing Lead (with the opportunity to grow into the CMO role), you’ll have a unique opportunity to not only shape the future of a company poised to make a significant impact in the AI landscape, but also to leave your mark on the brand and product we bring to market.
 




  





**Team** 
 Business Development
 



**Location** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



**Employment type** 
 Full-time
 



**Start date** 
 Q3/Q4 2024
 



**Application deadline** 
 15 July 2024
 



  




 What you'll do
 
  




* **Shape our brand and product narrative:** 
  Your voice and vision will be instrumental in defining how we communicate the value of our AI product to the world.
* **Define and execute our GTM strategy:** 
  You’ll be instrumental in creating a launch plan that generates buzz, attracts customers across various industries, and drives revenue growth for our AI product.
* **Lead all aspects of marketing:** 
  This includes branding, content creation (with an emphasis on AI-focused content that resonates with diverse audiences), social media, PR, email marketing, and any other relevant channels to reach our target markets, whether they are within the AI space or other industries that can benefit from our technology.
* **Drive hands-on marketing tasks:** 
  In the early stages, you’ll be actively involved in creating content, managing social media accounts, and tracking campaign performance across various channels and audiences.
* **Analyze data and optimize strategies:** 
  You’ll leverage data-driven insights to measure the effectiveness of marketing initiatives across different segments and make informed adjustments to reach broader audiences.
* **Build and lead a marketing team:** 
  As we grow, you’ll have the opportunity to recruit and manage a team of marketers with expertise in reaching diverse industries and customer personas.
* **Evolve into the CMO role:** 
  As our company scales and your team grows, you’ll transition into the Chief Marketing Officer role, overseeing the entire marketing organization and driving our long-term marketing vision for diverse markets and customer segments.



  




**Preferably you are...** 

  




* **Passionate about AI and its potential:** 
  You’re excited about the transformative power of AI and eager to contribute to its advancement.
* **A self-starter with a bias for action:** 
  You thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative startup environment and are comfortable taking initiative and making decisions independently.
* **A creative problem solver with a passion for marketing:** 
 You have a knack for coming up with innovative ideas and a deep understanding of how to reach and engage audiences, especially those interested in AI.
* **Data-driven and results-oriented:** 
  You’re comfortable with analytics and passionate about measuring and optimizing marketing performance.
* **A strong communicator and collaborator:** 
  You can effectively communicate with internal stakeholders, external partners, and customers, especially within the AI community.
* **Experienced in both strategic planning and tactical execution:** 
  You have a proven track record of developing and implementing successful marketing campaigns, as well as a strong understanding of marketing strategy within the B2b SaaS or AI industry.
* **Leadership-oriented with the ambition to grow:** 
  You have a desire to lead and inspire a team, and you’re excited about the prospect of growing into a CMO role.



  




**What's in it for you?** 

  





**Leadership pathway:** 




 You'll have the opportunity to grow your skills and responsibilities as our company scales, ultimately stepping into the role of Chief Marketing Officer.
 



  





**Shape a groundbreaking brand:** 




 By contributing your skills and vision, you will lay down the essential foundational stones that define our company's brand.
 



  





**Inviting culture:** 




 Excel in an agile and flexible work environment that wants you to explore new ideas that has the potential to directly have an impact on the company's direction and success.
 



  





**Competitive incentives:** 




 We value your dedication and creativity, offering a suite of benefits tailored to foster your professional growth and the unique opportunity to be part of "idele's" success story from the ground up.
 



  





**Design your work life:** 




 We value flexibility and balance. Shape your working style around your life, in an environment that supports your well-being and productivity.
 



  




**Does this sound interesting?** 

  





 If you want more information or even ready to start with your application, explore our website for further details.
 



 https://idele.com/careers/marketing-lead/
 



 or contact us at careers@idele.com with any questions that you might have.

title: Löne- och systemansvarig till Löneenheten, Danderyds kommun
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
 Var med och gör Sveriges bästa kommun ännu bättre. Danderyds kommun erbjuder gemenskap, utveckling och delaktighet på jobbet. Vi gör skillnad och skapar värde i vardagen i dialog med alla som lever, bor och verkar här. Genom närhet och korta beslutsvägar får du möjlighet att ta ansvar och jobba med både delar och helhet i ditt yrke. Här växer vi tillsammans med engagerade invånare, företag och kompetenta kollegor i trädgårdsstadens vackra miljö. Ta steget till ett utvecklande och hållbart arbetsliv i en lagom stor kommun nära allt.
   

  

 HR-avdelningen består av löneenheten och HR-enheten och vi sitter tillsammans på Djursholms slott. Vi som jobbar med lön är en lönechef, tre lönekonsulter, två löne- och systemansvariga. Tillsammans jobbar vi för att leverera bästa service, stöd och styrning till våra verksamheter. Vi har mycket fokus på att utveckla och effektivisera vårt arbete och söker dig som vill vara med på vår utvecklingsresa.
   

  

 Tycker du om ett eget ansvar? Vill du bidra i utveckling av Danderyds kommuns lönehantering? Vill du hamna på en avdelning med mycket värme, skratt och engagemang? Om du har svarat ja på dessa frågor så låter det som att du skulle trivas hos oss. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som löne- och systemansvarig är ditt huvudfokus att hantera och utveckla lönesystemet Personec P, schema- och bemanningssystemet Medvind samt andra system inom HR för kommunen. Du jobbar för att säkerställa att systemen stödjer chefer och medarbetare, är driftsäkra och ger användarstöd. Det innebär att du planerar och genomför regelbundna bearbetningar och körningar, samarbetar med leverantörer och IT-enheten för uppdateringar, håller utbildningar, administrerar behörigheter och ger löpande support till kommunens enheter.
   

  

 Du bidrar även till förbättringar och utvecklingsprojekt, kvalitetssäkrar data i lönesystemet och arbetar aktivt med att hitta sätt att öka effektiviteten och använda systemen som ett bra stöd för verksamheterna. Dessutom ansvarar du för att uppdatera systemet till nya versioner enligt rekommendationer från leverantören och för att underhålla och säkerställa att organisationsträdet är uppdaterat. Som löne- och systemansvarig ingår det även att omvärldsbevaka genom nätverk och research för att hålla dig och oss uppdaterade inom området.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom lön eller systemutveckling, eller arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer är likvärdig.
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av lönehantering.
* Goda kunskaper inom lönesystem, och därmed kunskap kring systemuppdateringar och tillhörande utvecklingsområden.
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska i tal och skrift.


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Arbetat med lönesystem Personec P, Heroma, eCompanion och/eller HR-plus.
* Arbetat med schema och bemanningssystemet Medvind.
* Arbetat med lönehantering inom offentlig sektor och därmed har kunskap om de kommunala kollektivavtalen.


 Vi söker efter dig som har ett stort intresse för lön och system i kombination. Du följer en klar struktur, planerar och organiserar effektivt, och är van vid att hålla deadlines. Du är skicklig på att lösa problem utan att tappa fokus på långsiktiga strategier och kan identifiera logik och samband även i komplexa situationer. Din kreativitet gör att du ofta hittar innovativa lösningar och tänker utanför ramarna för att lösa utmaningar. Du är också en lagspelare som trivs när du får samarbeta med andra, och har en god kommunikationsförmåga. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Danderyds kommun strävar efter en personalsammansättning som speglar samhällets mångfald. Vi erbjuder en spännande arbetsplats med många trevliga och kunniga medarbetare. Besök gärna vår jobbportal https://www.danderyd.se/ovriga-verksamheter/jobb/ om du vill veta vad våra chefer säger om kommunens uppdrag och utvecklingen framåt. Här kan du också samla information, bland annat om våra förmåner. Mer information om vår verksamhet hittar du på www.danderyd.se.
   

  

 För att kvalitetssäkra rekryteringsprocessen i Danderyds kommun samt möjliggöra god kommunikation med våra sökande önskar vi att du skickar in din ansökan digitalt enligt ovan.
   

  

 Betyg och övriga handlingar tar du med vid en eventuell intervju.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Vi undanber oss alla erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp i samband med denna annons.

description:
