**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Lizette Wiedel eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stn01@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105298

title: Senior backend developer to leading music company!
description:
Are you ready to revolutionize the way products and offers are managed in the digital commerce space? We are seeking a passionate and experienced Senior Backend Engineer to join our customer´s dynamic Opus Squad. The team is at the forefront of overseeing the Products and Offers domains on their client´s Commerce Platform, driving the end-to-end process of product creation, merchandising, order management, and purchase flows.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 Immediately
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 As a Senior Backend Engineer on the Opus Squad, you will play a pivotal role in advancing our client Commerce Platform. Your primary focus will be on the Products and Offers domains, where you will manage and enhance backend services and data sets. You will be responsible for the solution design and end-to-end implementation of new features, ensuring seamless integration and functionality within our product and offer creation ecosystem.
 


  


 This role requires a strategic mindset to align foundational entity data sets with our customer´s Commerce Platform Data Vision, as well as the technical expertise to build and scale robust services on the Google Cloud Platform. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, drive engineering deep dives, and effectively communicate with stakeholders to deliver high-quality solutions that power our merchandising, order management, and purchase flows.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* Be part of a forward-thinking team that values innovation and collaboration.
  
* Work on cutting-edge technology that shapes the future of digital commerce.
  
* Enjoy a supportive and inclusive work environment with opportunities for professional growth and development.
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Design and implement new capabilities within our product and offer services, ensuring seamless integration and functionality.
  
* Develop and maintain multiple backend services and data pipelines to support our customer´s product and offer catalogue ecosystem.
  
* Align foundational entity data sets with our customer´s new Commerce Platform Data Vision.
  
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions.
  
* Lead engineering deep dives, workshops, and stakeholder demos, demonstrating strong problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Proven experience in building and scaling Golden Path (Java, Postgres, BigTable) services on Google Cloud Platform.
  
* A strong interest in data and data pipelines, with experience in technologies such as Scio and Flight.
  
* Excellent problem-solving skills with a strong bias for action and fast decision-making.
  
* Great writing and communication skills, capable of effectively conveying technical concepts to diverse audiences.
  
* Ideally, you have a background in e-commerce or financial engineering domains, bringing valuable insights to our team.
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Filippa Danell Karlberg or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on filippa.karlberg@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15104944

title: Security Sales Cisco
description:
Are you a dynamic and result driven professional with passion for Cisco Cybersecurity? We are seeking an experienced Business Development Manager to join our team in Solna, Sweden. If you thrive an dynamic environment, have a proven track record in the industry and possess excellent communication and relationships building skills, we want to hear from you.
   

  

**Job Description**
* Business development expertise: identifying and capitalizing on new opportunities within the IT security domain
* Autonomous execution: demonstrating a high level of ownership and accountability.
* Influence and persuasion: develop and maintain strategic relationships that contribute to success of the business.
* Communication skills: Collaboration with internal team and external partners to articulate value propositions clearly.
* Self-management skills: Thrive in a dynamic environment by demonstrating the ability to self-manage. Adapt to evolving price challenges with resilience and a proactive mindset-
* Relationsship building: Exhibit skillful relationbuilding capabilities, fostering connections at multiple levels.
* Industry knowledge: Bring a complete understanding of IT security functions, industry best practices and standards.


**Skills**
* 4+ years of experience in the IT industry, preferably in business development, or sales.
* Experience with IT Security Cisco (or Fortinet)
* Proven track record of influencing stakeholders and driving business growth.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
* Strong relationship-building skills with a high level of energy and motivation.
* Language requirements: Swedish and English


 Ingram Micro
   

  

 Ingram Micro is the world's leading technology distributor. A modern, business-oriented, and value-creating technology distributor at the center of the technology industry. Our vision is to transform the world around us through the distribution of technology. To achieve this, we create opportunities for people and businesses every day by realizing the promise of technology. Ingram Micro Nordics has 350 employees with an annual turnover exceeding 1.3 billion USD.
   

  

 We invest in your professional and personal development. Ingram Micro is committed to diversity, equality, and inclusion. Our workplace is for everyone. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more everyone will thrive, contribute, and innovate!

title: Senior Technology Sales Representative
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
**Senior Technology Sales Representative**
 Oracle is leading the digital revolution. We are empowering nearly half a million businesses across the globe to turn untapped potential into real business value. You will connect the biggest enterprises of today with the tools to compete in the digital economy of tomorrow.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

 Be the vital piece of the puzzle that connects us to the millions of businesses that need our help to evolve. If you are passionate, entrepreneurial, innovative, and believe in being consultative and having fun whilst you work, then this could be the perfect opportunity for you.
   

  

 We are seeking a motivated sales individual who can sell our most complete all technology solutions portfolio in a license sales model. As we continue to help customers to transition to Cloud, we make sure their needs for an On premise solution are still covered.
   

  

 You would cover a wide rage of solutions from Database, data management Solutions (Analytics, Integration..etc) as well Cybersecurity, middleware and other exciting digital solutions. You will help your customers, who have growing data volumes and aggressive service-level expectations, maximize the potential of their IT organizations
   

  

 Having a sense of humor in what can be a pressure environment helps, and the rewards for your contribution include a compensation and benefits package and a continuous training program in a structured environment that are world class.
   

  

 Career Level - IC5
   

  

* Develop infrastructure/Database/Middleware/BI/Big data License Sales opportunities and maintain customer relationships in the assigned territory.
* The portfolio will be our wide technology portfolio. Although the right candidate should be able to orchestrate a speech across the complete offering of Oracle in front of a client and work alongside other internal teams to be one Oracle for the customer.
* Promote and evangelize Oracle products to selected customers, partners, and internal audiences
* Develop relationships and collaborate with our partners to define, recommend, and drive sales
* Develop and execute a sales plan that provides complete territory and sector specific coverage
* Develop appropriate sales programs and solutions; maintain up-to-date competitive information and compile regional success stories
* Meet with senior customer contacts to build credibility and develop lasting relationships
* Engage with Pre-Sales support for customer meetings to develop customer discussions further
* Lead successful go-to-market campaigns by working closely with internal marketing specialists
* Contribute and lead in account planning, customer/market analysis, and strategy sessions
* Contribute individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Being able to orchestrate proposals together with other internal business groups in the same solutions team or others. Understand that is all about the customer.


**What You’ll Bring**
 Your enthusiasm, knowledge, and customer-centricity will help us continue our growth as a top IT company.
   

  

**We Also Look For**
* 5-10 years of experience in direct software sales to complex/Large Enterprises
* Experience in the designated market vertical /customer would be required
* Good understanding of the information technology customer needs and strong technical expertise to become a trusted advisor across a wide technology portfolio.
* Proven track record in a sales-driven organization, selling technology-related products and services
* Solid written, verbal, and presentation skills
* Creative with strong problem-solving skills and an ability to succeed in a fast-paced environment
* Proven ability to work well as part of an extended sales team
* Knowledge of Oracle products preferred but not essential
* Fluency in Swedish
* Team player and self-motivated


**Life at Oracle and Equal Opportunity**
*At Oracle, we don’t just respect differences—we celebrate them. We believe that innovation starts with inclusion and to create the future we need people with diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. That’s why we’re committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before*
**https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/diversity-inclusion/**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
   

  

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

title: Studio Coordinator & Video Producer
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Studio Coordinator & Video Producer for our Brand & Marketing team based in Stockholm!**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 300 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 We are seeking a dynamic and highly organized Studio Coordinator and Video Producer to join our team. You will be responsible for managing our state-of-the-art studio, ensuring the smooth execution of all productions, and leading the recording and live streaming of webinars and other productions featuring our cybersecurity experts. The role also involves collaborating with the CMO and other team members and cybersecurity experts to create and produce a variety of video content from concept to completion.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
***Studio Management:***
* Maintain and organize the studio, ensuring it is always ready for use.
* Manage studio scheduling and coordinate with internal teams for bookings.
* Oversee the maintenance and functionality of all studio equipment.


***Video Production***
* Record and live stream webinars and other productions, ensuring high-quality audio and video.
* Set up, operate, and troubleshoot all production equipment, including cameras, microphones, lighting, and streaming software.
* Direct live streams and recorded sessions to ensure seamless and professional delivery.


***Content Creation:***
* Collaborate with the CMO and other stakeholders to develop video content that aligns with our marketing strategy and organizational goals.
* Create and produce various video formats, including promotional videos, educational content, interviews, and case studies.
* Manage the entire production process, from brainstorming and storyboarding to filming, editing, and final delivery.


***Project Management:***
* Coordinate all aspects of video production projects, including timelines, resources, and deliverables.
* Ensure all projects are completed on time, within scope, and to the highest quality standards.


***Collaboration and Communication:***
* Work closely with cybersecurity experts and other team members to ensure content is accurate, engaging, and informative.
* Provide technical guidance and support during video productions and live streams.


 Your Potential Background
   

  

 To succeed in this role we believe that you have:
   

  

* Proven experience in video production, live streaming, and studio management.
* Proficiency with video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere, Final Cut Pro) and live streaming tools (e.g., OBS, vMix).
* Strong technical skills, including the ability to operate and troubleshoot video, audio, and lighting equipment.
* Excellent organizational and project management abilities.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Creative mindset with the ability to develop engaging video content.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Knowledge of cybersecurity or a willingness to learn about the field is a plus.


**Required Skills:**
* Attention to Detail: Ensuring every aspect of production meets our high standards.
* Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to quickly troubleshoot and resolve technical issues.
* Adaptability: Flexibility to handle changing production needs and schedules.
* Initiative: Proactively manage studio resources and seek opportunities to enhance video content quality.


 This role offers an exciting opportunity to manage a cutting-edge studio, lead high-impact video productions, and contribute to the growth and visibility of our organization. If you are passionate about video production and have the skills to ensure our studio and content are of the highest quality, we encourage you to apply.
   

  

*Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.*
 Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future
   

  

 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Data Scientist
description:
You will be part of our B2C Sales & Marketing Services Analytics team. We are a team of data scientists and analysts, working across the Nordics to create, promote and grow our B2C offering. Our success relies on collaboration – both within the team, and with other teams such as Product, Data, Tech and Sales teams.
 



  





**Job description** 



* Analyze large datasets with different types of data from Dun & Bradstreet's sources as well as several different types of customer data.
* Develop models and new attribute variables, and deliver on client specific projects (targeting optimization, segmentations etc)
* Apply machine learning techniques to build predictive models and other data driven solutions.
* Evaluate model performance using appropriate metrics and validate models to ensure reliability and robustness.
* Join cross-team collaboration to develop Analytics capabilities integrated in our products
* Contribute with your expertise on new data sources and internal product development processes.
* Thirst for advancements in data science and machine learning to enhance expertise and contribute to innovation.



  





**We are looking for a Data Scientist sharing our values** 



* You like working in teams
* You are a social person who likes to share your expertise, experiences and tips.
* You are curious and like to learn new things.
* You see solutions, not the problems!
* You are flexible and thrive on change



  





**Your experience** 



* You have an analytical and critical thinking, if you have worked with consumer and market analysis before, it is even better!
* Academic university degree in data science, statistics, econometrics, mathematics, computer science, economics and / or civil engineering.
* 4+ years of experience working with Python/PySpark. developing models and processes, creating integrated analytics modules.
* Expertise in organizing and refining raw data for analysis, coupled with ability to craft impactful data visualization.
* Ability to evaluate model performance and iterate on solutions for continuous improvement.
* Solid knowledge about statistical models and / or machine learning.
* You have good knowledge in both English and Swedish, verbal and written.
* Tech stack keywords: Python, PySpark, SQL, Github, Databricks, GCP, ML Flow

title: Product Coordinator Special Vehicles (EMTDS)
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

**The team**
 Do you want to take part in coordinating the changes and content in the product structure for the customized truck and bus product portfolio?
   

  

 Product coordination is a global organisation that works with product structure for both Traton and Scania. We develop and maintain both the Traton modular system (TMS) and Scania’s “bygglåda”. The close cooperation and a common modular system within the Traton group will affect the way we create and use our product structure. Hence, it is an interesting time to be working with Product Coordination.
   

  

 We are a team of 12 people who work with customized vehicles, towards Scania S-order.
   

  

 One of our senior colleagues within the cab team is leaving us for new challenges so we are now looking for a new team member. We believe that our new candidate could be a good fit by starting with the basics and gradually working towards a senior role.
   

  

 The tasks revolve around the change management of our modular system in the form of our product structure.
   

  

**As a manager**
 I would describe myself as a pragmatic and responsive person who coaches my employees and looks out for the group's best interests in the collaboration within the section and with other parts of the company that we work with. Before I became head of this group, I worked as a product coordinator for several years.
   

  

**Your Role**
 As a Product Coordinator, you will be responsible for managing changes and content in our modular system, focusing on our product structure.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

  

* Coordinate and implement changes in the product structure.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth integration of new products.
* Support the development and maintenance of both Traton Modular System (TMS) and Scania’s “bygglåda”.
* Gradually take on more responsibilities, moving towards a senior role.


**Your profile**
 You probably have an academic degree with a focus on technology and have taken programming courses or a relevant education in programming. Alternatively, you have work experience that corresponds to this, with a vested interest in programming.
   

  

 As a person, you are energetic, curious and analytical. You are communicative, support-oriented and appreciate to work both by your own and in a team.
   

  

**We Offer**
 At Scania, we believe in investing in our people. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes:
   

  

  

* Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
* Flexible working arrangements and work-life balance initiatives.
* A supportive and inclusive work environment.
* The chance to be part of a forward-thinking company committed to sustainability.


 We can also offer other benefits such as free training at Scania's health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, performance bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at a reduced price, the opportunity for a staff car and much more.
   

  

**For more information**
 Don’t hesitate to contact me, Asko Grön, Group Manager, +46855372436
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 30 June 2024. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.

title: HR-koordinator
description:
Trivs du i en koordinerande roll med många kontaktytor där varje dag erbjuder nya utmaningar att lösa tillsammans med dina kollegor? Har du även ett stort intresse för HR-frågor, är riktigt vass på administration och vill vara navet i vår HR-avdelning? Det här är rollen för dig som är specialist på att ge förstklassig service till våra chefer och kollegor inom HR där du ges möjlighet att arbeta brett med operativa frågor i rollen som HR-koordinator. Ta chansen att utvecklas professionellt och som människa hos oss på Atea!
   

  

 Din roll i laget
   

  

 Vi vill utöka vårt härliga HR-team med ytterligare en kompetent kollega som kan bidra med administrering och koordinering i världsklass. Som HR-koordinator supporterar du våra chefer, medarbetare och kollegor inom HR bland annat genom service via vår HR-support där du är first line support för olika typer av HR-frågor. Tillsammans med dina kollegor utveckla funktionen vilket innebär att förnya och optimera befintliga arbetssätt, effektivisera arbetet genom nya lösningar och upprätthålla ett gott och väletablerat samarbete med medarbetare, kollegor och chefer.
   

  

 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter~
   

  

* First line support till chefer och medarbetare i HR-supporten
* Stöd till HR-specialister i HR-processer löpande under året
* Stöd till HR Business Partners
* Uppdatering av information, policyer etc. på vårt intranät och chefsportal
* Diverse HR-administration såsom exempelvis nyckeltal, uppföljning av rutiner, manuell hantering av information och data
* Delta i diverse utvecklingsprojekt eller initiativ inom HR


 Ditt team
   

  

 Ateas HR-avdelning består av drygt 20 kollegor, en härlig mix av personer med olika kompetenser som arbetar tillsammans som ett lag och hjälps åt när det behövs. Gemensamt för oss alla är att vi älskar HR, har roligt tillsammans och samtidigt tar vårt uppdrag inom HR på stort allvar. Då vi står inför stora, spännande utvecklingskliv inom HR behöver vi en ny lagkamrat som kan komplettera oss med administrativa och koordinerade färdigheter.
   

  

 Din närmsta chef i rollen kommer vara Kristina Bergstedt, ansvarig för HR Strategy & Operations. Kristina är en erfaren och lyhörd ledare som är öppen och lämnar rum för sina medarbetare att ta eget ansvar för sina uppgifter. Varje medarbetare får helt äga sina egna områden, medan Kristina finns med längs vägen som stöd. Teamet består av 10 medarbetare som samtliga rapporterar direkt till Kristina där merparten utgår ifrån Stockholm.
   

  

 Vad vi söker hos dig
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen som HR-koordinator och trivas hos oss på Atea är det viktigt att du gillar att arbeta i ett team som värdesätter humor, arbetsglädje och samarbete. God service är en självklarhet för dig och du är mån om att ge snabb återkoppling och har en lösningsfokuserad approach i dina samarbeten – inget är omöjligt! Som med all administration och koordinering är noggrannhet otroligt viktigt för ett lyckat resultat och du sätter stolthet i att leverera med kvalitet. Rollen som HR-koordinator är bred och varierande, vilket ställer höga krav på din förmåga att arbeta självständigt, prioritera och ta eget ansvar för ditt uppdrag.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har några års tidigare erfarenhet av en koordinerande HR-roll där din erfarenhet har gett dig en god förståelse för chefers vardag och utmaningar. Du är van att arbeta med känsliga uppgifter och de höga krav på integritet som detta medför. Utöver detta tar du med dig erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med HRM system och Excel in i rollen. Du behärskar svenska obehindrat i tal och skrift samt har goda kunskaper i engelska.
   

  

 Vårt löfte till dig
   

  

 Hos oss får du vara med att bidra till ett smartare, effektivare och mer hållbart samhälle. Med fokus på utveckling, laganda och personligt ansvarstagande ser vi till att göra skillnad. Vi uppmuntrar och stöttar varandra, och tar vara på våra individuella förmågor, perspektiv och erfarenheter. Det är därför du är viktig för oss. För att du är du, för att du är nyfiken och för att du vill växa professionellt – och som människa. Tillsammans skapar vi laget som bygger Sverige med it.
   

  

 Dina förmåner
   

  

 Nedan är ett urval av förmåner hos oss. Atea har höga ambitioner, vi vill vara The Place To Be och branschens bästa arbetsgivare och vi arbetar ständigt med att, på olika sätt, verka för detta. Ateas filosofi om förmåner är att vi är ett lag och därför erbjuder vi alla medarbetare samma utbud.
   

  

* Hybrid arbetssätt med kundens, verksamhetens och medarbetarens behov i fokus
* Belöning via gemensam kvartalsbonus för samtliga medarbetare
* Fokus hälsa med engagerade träningsaktiviteter och friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000kr
* Atea Career Program med möjlighet till karriärutveckling
* Vi utbildar våra ledare genom ett ledarskapsprogram
* Möjlighet att bli nominerad till Atea Champions Club och få åka på en resa med andra kollegor
* I vår medarbetarundersökning ligger vi över snittet i branschen på att tänka sig rekommendera Atea som arbetsgivare
* Aktiespararprogram


 Kontakta oss & mer information
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Kristina Bergstedt, ansvarig för HR Strategy & Operations, via kristina.bergstedt@atea.se. Har du frågor om rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Fanny Sandberg, Talent Acquisition Partner, via fanny.sandberg@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag!
   

  

 Nästa steg i processen består av ett kortare telefonsamtal där dina erfarenheter och kompetenser stäms av, du får även höra mer om tjänsten och ställa dina eventuella frågor. Därefter följer intervju med rekryterande chef samt case. I slutskedet av processen kommer du även bli inbjuden till att genomföra tester. Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidat en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan till oss!
   

  

*Med anledning av kommande semesterperiod kan återkoppling på din ansökan samt rekryteringsprocessen dröja något längre än vanligt.*
**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Digital Marketing Specialist till Enjoy Wine & Spirits
description:
Har du verktygen för att ansvara för kundupplevelsen i digitala kanaler som webb, mobil, e-post och sociala medier? Har du dessutom ett genuint intresse för mat och vin? Då är det dig vi söker för ett uppdrag på ett år hos Enjoy Wine& Spirits, med start i mitten av september.
   

  

 I rollen som Digital Marketing Specialist arbetar du brett med Enjoy Wines digitala kanaler och ansvarar för kundupplevelsen i kanaler som webb, mobil, e-post och sociala medier. Du planerar, genomför och följer upp digitala aktiviteter och ansvarar för vår CRM-bearbetning. Du kommer att vara en del av marknadsavdelningen och rapporterar direkt till Marknadschefen.
   

  

**Arbetsbeskrivning**
* Ansvara för att våra hemsidor är uppdaterade och fungerar i samarbete med produktchefer, IT och systemägare för PIM.
* Hantera löpande förvaltning av hemsidan inklusive löpande kontakt med webbyrå.
* Ansvara för att content är uppdaterat på hemsida och i övriga digitala kanaler.
* Ta fram och publicera innehåll på webben och i övriga digitala kanaler.
* Planera, genomföra och följa upp digitala aktiviteter.
* Ansvara för sociala medier-kalendrar samt PR-kalender.
* Ta fram och publicera innehåll i sociala medier och på My Newsdesk.
* Ta fram och skicka ut e-post till vår kundbas.
* Systemägare för CMS, Sociala Mediekonton, E-postklient och My Newsdesk.
* Planera och producera podden
* Sökordsplanering & optimering
* Administrera budgeten för digital kommunikation.


**Din profil**
 För att lyckas i rollen som Digital Marketing Specialist ser vi att du har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom marknadsföring med fokus på digitala och sociala medier. Du har arbetat i några år som Digital Marketing Specialist eller i liknande roller på marknadsavdelningar eller konsultföretag. Du arbetar dagligen i WordPress och känner dig trygg i dina kunskaper. Du har även goda kunskaper i grafiska program som InDesign, Photoshop, After Effects och Premiere Pro samt andra relevanta program. Det är önskvärt att du även har praktisk erfarenhet av Googles verktyg som Stack, Analytics, Campaign Manager, AdWords, Tag Manager och Data Studio. Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Du har ett genuint intresse för mat och vin, är en lyhörd teamspelare med mycket god samarbetsförmåga. Du är lösningsorienterad och strukturerad, har ett helhetsperspektiv och ett gott sinne för detaljer. Du är ansvarstagande, prestigelös och drivande inom ditt område, samt nyfiken med analytisk kompetens.
   

  

**Om Enjoy Wine & Spirits**
 Vi är ett familjeföretag med starka rötter i Italien och den traditionella vinvärlden. Vi springer dock över hela jorden i vår jakt på sensationella dryckesupplevelser. Portföljen består av produkter från både stora etablerade producenter och småskaliga hantverksmässiga vinmakare. I sortimentet finns även en växande skara naturviner, blanddrycker, sprit och mineralvatten.
   

  

 I en värld av medvetna kunder och konsumenter med höga krav, ska vi vara den bästa dryckesleverantören genom att skapa och förmedla livskvalitet. Våra relationer till partners och kunder är viktiga för oss. Vi är specialister på det vi gör och vi vågar vara innovativa och nyskapande tillsammans. Integritet och samhällsansvar är alltid högt upp på agendan och vi är stolta över att kontinuerligt jobba för ökad hållbarhet. Självklart ska vi även ha roligt på jobbet, varje dag.
   

  

 Enjoy Wine & Spirits är en av de volymmässigt största vinimportörerna på den svenska marknaden och en av Systembolagets äldsta leverantörer av vin. Företaget har mer än 30 års erfarenhet av vinhandel och representerar ett 50-tal producenter på den svenska marknaden. Förutom vin importerar vi sprit, cider och blanddrycker samt marknadsför egna varumärken. Enjoy Wine & Spirits AB är en del av koncernen Gruppo Di Luca där bolagen Di Luca & Di Luca AB (med bla varumärket Zeta) och Deli Di Luca AB (restaurang) ingår.
   

  

 Läs mer om företaget på www.enjoywine.se.
   

  

**Värt att veta!**
 Tjänsten är ett vikariat med start i september 2024 och ett år framåt. Du kommer att utgå från Enjoy Wines kontor i Stockholm.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Enjoy Wine & Spirits med Inhouse.
   

  

**Ansök enkelt med ditt CV**
 Vi tar inte emot några ansökningar via mejl, utan du söker enkelt med ditt CV här på hemsidan, inhouse.se. Du behöver inte skicka med något personligt brev, vi vet att ditt CV räcker gott och väl. Om du går vidare i processen kommer du som ett första steg att få svara på ett antal urvalsfrågor. Processen innehåller även arbetspsykologiska tester. Ansök senast den 3 augusti. Urval och intervjuer sker i början av augusti.
   

  

 För mer information eller frågor, kontakta rekryteringskonsult Sandra Pettersson.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan.

title: Data Domain Owner - Finance
description:
Join Our Team as an Information & Data Domain Owner!
   

  

 Are you passionate about data governance and eager to drive transformation in the finance sector? Look no further! At Scania’s Finance Way and Innovation Office, we’re searching for a seasoned and dynamic professional to take charge of our data and information landscape. As an Information & Data Domain Owner, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of information and data management across Scania’s finance and IT organization.
   

  

 Who are you?
   

  

 To thrive in this role, you can act as a project manager with an eye for what needs to get done to shift focus and change minds within our global finance community. You are also a specialist with proven experience in the area of information and data including e.g. data governance, data quality management, and information modeling, to guide both data/information owners as well as senior managers.
   

  

 You should be comfortable navigating and networking in large and global organisations. You leverage your drive and communication skills as a true change-maker. For example, you are not opposed to facilitating, influencing, and negotiating in a, sometimes, high-paced environment.
   

  

 We believe your approach is pragmatic and situation-based with the capability to navigate a number of large transformation initiatives that all have a need and impact related to data. We think that you may have worked in different architecture roles and have a track record of tight collaboration with business process owners, understanding their challenges Overall, you will benefit from a large portion of team spirit, and change awareness combined with self-confidence.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

  

* Drive the area of Data & Information: Champion data quality and compliance within the finance domain. Take ownership and monitor governance processes to maintain data accuracy and reliability.
* Chair the Information Domain Council: Lead the council’s initiatives by planning, executing, and following up on actions. Facilitate meetings, coordinate presenters, and meticulously document decisions.
* Prioritize value: Drive the finance data roadmap and backlog. Collaborate with key stakeholders to ensure seamless execution of initiatives.
* Coordinate Stakeholders: Train stakeholders, align data owners, and manage demands across various data domains. Lead and coordinate data management assignments effectively.
* Strive for data excellence where it matters: Define and uphold rigorous data quality and availability standards. Keep our data catalog and information models up to date.
* Foster organizational Development: Establish and maintain an effective organizational structure. Foster ongoing data discussions, prioritize tasks, and clarify roles within our cross-functional data governance framework.
* Facilitate Cross-Domain Coordination: Mobilize resources from different domains, IT, and business units to ensure alignment and value creation based on council decisions.


 What We Offer
   

  

 Join a forward-thinking team in an innovative work environment where professional growth is encouraged and opportunities for skill development and career advancement abound. Work with Scania, a globally recognized leader in the automotive industry, and be part of a supportive and collaborative culture that values teamwork and continuous improvement.
   

  

 Ready to make an impact? Apply
   

  

 More Information
   

  

 In the event of questions about the position contact Lill Lööf Thunqvist +46 73 688 09 21 or email lill.loof@scania.com
   

  

 Application process
   

  

 Submit your CV, a personal letter, and relevant certificates by June 26. Selections will be made continuously, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Senior Fullstack Developer** 
 to join our team Phoenix in the
 **Stockholm** 
 office. Are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The role**
 As a Senior Fullstack Developer at Viaplay, you will have the opportunity to work at the forefront of digital media and develop the platform to meet the challenges of a continuously growing user base. You will work on our web platform but also on our back-end services to enable rapid improvements in our core solutions. Your engagement will shape the future of our service as you will be involved in defining the forefront for video on demand. We are now looking for a new team member to help us grow the platform, enhance our user experience, and create the next generation of streaming services.
   

  

 We thrive in using innovative technology, always keeping up to date and constantly challenging the status quo. We work with React and Node.js in a micro-services architecture that runs in AWS. Also, we build our whole product in-house.
   

  

**The journey ahead** 
 : You will join a kick-ass and stable cross-functional but mighty squad based in Stockholm to deliver engineering solutions aligned with long-term technical and product visions. The team delivers clear goals based on our customer journey and is focusing on the customer account-sharing journey but has other responsibilities within our core services.
   

  

**Some Of Your Daily Tasks Will Include**
* Building features for our consumer-facing Viaplay web app (built in React)
* Building well-structured and high-performing backend services/lambdas (primarily Node.js) in a micro-services/serverless environment
* Deploying to a production environment supported by Docker hosted on AWS Cloud
* Working within an agile development process where we encourage pair/mob programming
* Directing our product iterations based on consumer feedback and user-behavioral data


**What We’re Looking For**
 We believe in keeping an open mind during our recruitment process, understanding that you might excel in certain areas more than others. To thrive in this role, you should be a passionate developer with a genuine interest in software development and an ambition to constantly improve. You have worked with a variety of tasks requiring complex problem-solving using JavaScript. If you also have an interest in multiple programming languages, you will fit right in! You will be part of a team that makes things happen in a brilliant manner.
   

  

**Here Are Some Key Qualifications**
* 5+ years' experience in Software development in frontend and backend
* Experience with Cloud environments, preferably AWS
* Experience with Client-facing REST API
* Demonstrable leadership skills like communication, mentoring, leading architecture initiatives, and risk analysis


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* A can-do attitude, resilience, and the ability to collaborate humbly with others, even under tight deadlines
* Experience in product A/B testing and a basic understanding of associated statistics


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and a generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various well-being initiatives including wellness allowance.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Project Manager to Finance Business Transformation
description:
We are looking for a talented project manager to join us in shaping the future of finance at Scania. Together, we will drive the shift towards digitalisation, leverage of data, and end-to-end processes that support profitable business decisions in today’s fast-paced climate.
   

  

 You will be part of a competent and engaged team aiming to be the change engine of Scania’s global Finance Community. We are the “Finance Way and Innovation Office” – the centre of excellence for finance strategy development, digitalisation, information management, PMO, portfolio management, project management, change, and communication.
   

  

 Our project managers lead initiatives across a spectrum of areas and timeframes. This currently includes large projects targeting Scania’s new process and IT landscape addressing financial planning and analytics as well as new technology and process ways of working when we introduce SAP S4/Hana as our new global industrial ERP backbone.
   

  

**Your contribution**
 You will contribute to the realisation of Scania’s Finance Strategy by leading finance transformation initiatives across the organisation. These may include high-profile projects covering areas such as technology, data, finance processes, and analytics. You could lead multiple workstreams consisting of employees and consultants with diverse professions and geographical locations. Along with typical project management tasks, it will be particularly important to manage relationships and anchoring with both senior management and peers. You will have opportunities to make good use of your strategic mindset, but also to fold up your sleeves and work closely with your project team. All of this occurs in an international and dynamic environment that requires consideration to differences in corporate culture. You will not only need to make complexity understandable and use effective storytelling to convey it to various stakeholders across the organisation.
   

  

 Tasks in this context can typically be exemplified with:
   

  

  

* Work closely with project sponsors to understand the strategic direction and align expectations on objectives, budget, and overall project plan.
* Lead and coach your team in the agreed direction to secure deliveries according to the project plan.
* Prepare and share decision material, status reports, and risk evaluations with senior management committees.
* Ensure coordination between business functions, Scania IT, and third-party suppliers with regard to your project scope.
* Participate in our Finance Transformation operative management team and cross-collaborate with representatives of other portfolio initiatives.
* Ensure continuous evaluation and implementation of improvement areas within the project


**Who are you?**
 To thrive in this role, you are a bold and strong project manager with an eye for what needs to get done to shift focus and change minds within our global finance community.
   

  

 You should be comfortable navigating and networking in large and global organisations. You leverage your drive and communication skills as a true change-maker. For example, you are not opposed to facilitating, influencing, and negotiating in a, sometimes, high-paced environment.
   

  

 We believe your approach is pragmatic and situation-based with the capability to effectively incorporate agile methodology. Experience with implementation of SAP solutions such as S/4HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud, BW/4HANA, and Datasphere is desirable, but experience with similar technology in the finance area will also be considered. Overall, you will benefit from a large portion of team spirit, and change awareness combined with self-confidence.
   

  

**We offer**
 We can offer you a dynamic workplace with diverse and challenging tasks in a hybrid work setup, meaning you can work from home or at our remote office at Scania Sergel a few days a week if the job allows. We can also provide you with a development plan, so you can reach your goals and receive the right support along the way. Scania offers many opportunities to develop your career both within the country as internationally. The professional development of our employees is a priority for us, so education via internal and external courses is encouraged and supported. In addition to career and development opportunities, we can offer you other benefits such as free training at Scania's health center Gröndal, or a wellness allowance. You will also be offered performance bonuses, an occupational pension, flexible working hours, the opportunity to lease a car through the company, and much more. Scania also organizes several events yearly where family and friends are always welcome. If you live in Stockholm, we also offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Jobexpress.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 For more information please contact Gunilla Stjernlid, Head of Program & Portfolio Mgmt, gunilla.stjernlid@scania.com or 08- 553 85 159.
   

  

**Application**
 We look forward to receiving your application, including your CV and cover letter no later than 2024-06-23.
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: ED78C: Handler (ID)
description:
Air Network; Road Network; Hub Operations; Storage, Fashion & Solutions; Ground Operations: Ramp/Air Operations; Ramp & Gateway Operations; Air Feeder Linehaul; Air Network Support; Operational Support; Road Networks; Hub Operations; Handling; Handling (Ground Ops); Safe Onloading & Offloading of Vehicles, Aircraft & ULDs; Scanning & Sorting of Packages; Supporting Administration as Required; Security Screening as Required
   

  

 Responsible for the completion of specific operational activities at station or hub locations which may include sort activities, driving and location based tracking and reporting.
   

  

 Accuracy & Attention to Detail; Planning & Organizing Skills; Problem Solving Skills; Team Working Skills
   

  

 FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all
   

  

 Our Company
   

  

 FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.
   

  

 Our Philosophy
   

  

 The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.
   

  

 Our Culture
   

  

 Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

title: German and English-speaking Technical Inside Sales Representative
description:
If you want to be part of building a new department as a technical inside sales representatives within an international company, you've found the right position for you. In this role, you will work with both short and long sales processes divided into geographical areas. You will have your own clients whom you will drive sales with from the office, and you'll have the opportunity to grow within an already large but rapidly expanding company!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Solna, Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Sales
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 By agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 The client works with IT-based security solutions and is a growing player in the market. They are expanding their sales operations with an inside sales team focusing on small and medium-sized enterprises. You will be responsible for building long-term relationships with a focus on customer satisfaction, initially with existing customers, but as you become more experienced, you will also work with your own prospects. You will have the opportunity to be involved in the entire process alongside the customer and support them from small individual assignments to large, complex installations and solutions.
   




**Work tasks**
  
* Manage a significant portion of the company's accounts and drive growth
  
* Build long-term relationships with new and existing customers
  
* Proactively work with customers to easily meet their needs as they arise
  
* Explore new solutions to help the customer find the best solution for their problems
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Has relevant experience in sales of, e.g., SAAS/access control solution/security installer
  
* Has at least completed secondary education, preferably in technology
  
* Fluent proficiency in both spoken and written German and English, since it will be used in daily work
  
* Someone who is based in Stockholm, Sweden
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Good verbal and written knowledge in some other Southern European language
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, you have to following personal skills:**



  


 We believe that you have the ability to drive your work forward independently, and you are not afraid to pick up the phone and call the customer. You prefer to ask one question too many, and you enjoy working together with others. We see that you have high ambition and are eager to develop and learn. We will focus on the following personal qualities during the recruitment process:
 


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
 



 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Sofia Wahren or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on ste03@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15104946

title: Mekaniker
description:
Vill du vara med och göra skillnad som mekaniker? I denna roll får du chansen att arbeta med både förebyggande och avhjälpande underhåll, bidra till förbättringar och säkerställa att vårt raffinaderi fungerar på topp. Vi söker för närvarande mekaniker till avdelningen Maintenance Technical Service i Nynäshamn
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Arbetet som mekaniker innebär att du arbetar för att upprätthålla och förbättra raffinaderiets produktionstillgänglighet genom förebyggande och avhjälpande underhåll inom statisk och roterande utrustning. Du kommer att få arbeta med allt från enklare servicearbeten till felsökningar och avancerade renoveringar. I arbetet ingår eventuell beredskap på kvällar, nätter och helger. Beredskapen är upplagd efter ett rullande schema och innebär att du ska kunna inställa dig med kort varsel för att kunna utföra felsökning och akut avhjälpande underhåll.
   

  

**Några av dina ansvarsområden är:**
* Arbeta med förebyggande och avhjälpande underhåll inom området mekanisk utrustning.
* Bidra aktivt till att avdelningen når sina uppsatta mål
* Arbeta för kvalitets- och miljöförbättrande åtgärder även utanför ditt direkta ansvarsområde.
* Hjälper till att planera för reservdelshållning av mekanisk utrustning.
* Rapportera och planera underhållsaktiviteter i vårt underhållsystem.
* Ingå i beredskapsgruppen.


**Om dig**
 För att lyckas i denna roll är det viktigt att du är ansvarstagande och säkerhetsmedveten. Du är en lagspelare med ett genuint intresse för att arbeta med både människor och teknik. Du tycker om praktiskt arbete och trivs med att mecka och serva. Du arbetar i ett mindre team och därför ställs det krav på att din samarbetsförmåga är god och likaså din kommunikation.
   

  

 För den här tjänsten söker vi både kandidater som har tidigare erfarenhet som industrimekaniker och även dig som är i början av ditt yrkesliv och har mer baskunskaper inom statisk och roterande utrustning inom industrin.
   

  

 För att kunna söka rollen har du minst:
   

  

* En gymnasial examen med verkstadsteknisk inriktning eller motsvarande
* Grundläggande kunskaper kring pumpar, kompressorer, uppriktning, växellådor etc.
* Goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska
* Goda IT-kunskaper
* Kan läsa och förstå ritningar och annan teknisk dokumentation
* B-körkort
* Meriterande om du har tidigare erfarenhet från Raffinaderi eller processindustrin


**Om Nynas**
**Lösningar för omställningen till ett hållbart samhälle**
 Nynas erbjuder bitumen och nafteniska specialprodukter för applikationer som berör människors liv varje dag, till exempel inom elektrifiering och väginfrastruktur. Vår kärnkompetens är att förädla tunga molekyler till högpresterande specialprodukter med lång livslängd. Vi verkar på en internationell marknad med starkt fokus på Europa och vi har ett nära samarbete med kunderna för att skapa lösningar för att möta utmaningarna och fånga möjligheterna i omställningen till ett hållbart samhälle
   

  

**Kontakt och ansökan**
 Du ansöker om tjänsten via ansökningslänken. Eftersom urvalet kommer att ske löpande är det viktigt att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar på detta sätt. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdatum.

title: Sociala medier-specialist (vikariat)
description:
**Nu har du chans att fortsätta vårt framgångsrika arbete i sociala medier! Vår fantastiske Fredrik ska på föräldraledighet och vi behöver någon som kan ta över stafettpinnen i sociala medier.** 




  





**Om Dina Försäkringar** 




*Dina Försäkringar är en grupp lokalt förankrade, kundägda försäkringsbolag med 250 års historia. Hos oss är beslutsvägarna korta, utvecklingstakten hög och möjligheterna att påverka stora. Vår vision är att ge hela Sverige trygghet i vardagen och mod att investera i en hållbar framtid. Det gör vi genom att förstå kundernas vardag, tänka nytt, vara nära och finnas till för våra kunder när de behöver oss. Och det uppskattas. För fjärde året i rad har vi branschens nöjdaste privatkunder enligt Svenskt Kvalitetsindex och vår Mäklardisk har fått utmärkelser för bland annat bästa service. Vårt engagemang i lokalsamhället är stort och vi stöttar föreningar, kulturevenemang och skadeförebyggande insatser över hela landet.* 




  





**Beskrivning av tjänsten** 




 Som sociala medier-specialist är du den som jobbar vidare med vår strategi och plan. Mest tid spenderar du helt klart på att leverera innehåll till våra sociala kanaler, stötta vår kundtjänst samt följa upp och bidra till att vi når våra uppsatta mål. Tjänsten är ett vikariat under åtta månaders tid med start i september 2024.
 



  





 Rollen är placerad i Stockholm i teamet Kommunikation och webb, men innebär tätt samarbete med hela Dinagruppen. Från norr till söder. Vi har sedan starten 1768 fokuserat mycket på att förstå våra kunder (och tillika ägare), bygga relationer med dem och anpassa vårt erbjudande, vår dialog och våra processer efter deras behov. En förutsättning för det är att träffa dem där de är, och sociala medier är naturligtvis en viktig del av det. Det är här du kommer in.
 



  





**Rollen innebär mer specifikt att du:** 



* Planerar, projektleder, producerar och genomför en- och tvåvägskommunikation på sociala medier. Fokus på Facebook, Instagram och LinkedIn. Både organiskt och betalt.
* Följer upp reaktioner och anpassar våra aktiviteter därefter.
* Följer upp och analyserar utfall.
* Samlar insikt från marknaden samt kunder och förstår interna behov.
* Stöttar de som arbetar med sociala medier som kundkommunikationskanal.



  





**Kvalifikationer** 



* Vi tror att du har flera års erfarenhet av att praktiskt arbeta med sociala medier.
* Utbildning inom marknadsföring, kommunikation eller motsvarande.
* En fena på att skapa engagerande innehåll för olika målgrupper och på många teman.
* Väl insatt i vad det är som gör att sociala medier fungerar och kan använda den kunskapen.
* Flytande svenska och en vass penna.
* Praktiska kunskaper inom Adobe-programmen eller andra verktyg för producera bild och film.
* Ett gott öga för grafisk design.



  





**Vem du är** 




 Vi söker dig som har solid erfarenhet från området men fortfarande har en del kvar att lära. Vi vill hitta dig som har driv och engagemang att fortsätta utveckla våra relationer med nuvarande och framtida kunder. Och framförallt, du älskar området, att engagera människor internt och externt och att själv skapa relevant innehåll. Vidare är du:
 


* Nyfiken, du gillar att ha fingret i luften och hänga på det som kan vara relevant för våra kunder.
* Gillar att se resultat av det du gör för att förstå vad som ska göras härnäst.
* Proaktiv, kreativ, har gott om energi och genomför det du tar dig för.
* Sugen på att göra skillnad, på riktigt.



  





**Därför ska du bli en i vårt team** 




 ”I den här rollen arbetar du med stort handlingsutrymme och hos oss kan du verkligen göra skillnad. Jag vet, ”det har jag hört förr”, men det stämmer verkligen.
 



  





 Här får du möjlighet att vara med och bygga ett område vi satsar på, tillsammans med teamet och företaget i stort, bidra med det du är duktig på och samtidigt lära dig och utvecklas på vägen. Jag ser verkligen fram emot att göra den resan tillsammans.”
 



*- Tomas Roos, chef Kommunikation och webb* 




  





**Kontakt** 




 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Tomas Roos, chef Kommunikation och webb, på telefon 072-55 44 825. Facklig representant för Forena är Sammy Bergman, telefon 08-518 038 27.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Eftersom vi jobbar med ett löpande urval får du gärna skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast den 5 juli. Använd ansökningsknappen här nedan. Vi uppmuntrar och ser gärna sökanden som bidrar till en mångfald inom vår organisation.
 



  





**Om Dina Försäkring AB** 




*Dina Försäkring AB är en serviceorganisation och ett försäkringsbolag som ägs av Dina Försäkringars fem lokala bolag. Här bedrivs gemensamt utvecklingsarbete, IT-drift, analys, marknadsföring och annan typ av service för och i samarbete med hela bolagsgruppen. Du hittar de flesta av oss på servicebolaget i våra fräscha lokaler på Skeppsbron 2 i Stockholm. I alla fall de dagar vi inte arbetar hemifrån eller på något annat av våra kontor runtom i Sverige.*

title: Norweigan Business Development Representatives to Reliable AB!
description:
Do you speak Norwegian and have an interest in customer relations and business development? If you are looking for a role where you can develop your sales ability and gain relevant experience, this is the role for you! Apply today as we work with ongoing selection.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Reliable AB
 



  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Sales
 



  

**Extent :**
 Part time, 1-3 days a week, 50h/month minimum
 



  

**Start date :**
 End of August 2024
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 Reliable AB staff develop their sales assignments with niche talent recruitment, directly from universities and colleges. They work in a youthful environment with unique conditions to be able to staff and optimize results for all types of sales assignments. Every customer contact is a marketing opportunity and they place great importance in the person who represents a customer always having a relevant education, knows the market, the company and the product it represents. In this role your main responsibility will be to book appointments for Reliable's customers, and offer them the best conditions for their business growth.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* **An exciting experience where you can develop your sales skills**
  
* **A dedicated consultant manager to help and guide you in your role and future career path**
  
* **A competitive salary with the possibility of a generous provision salary**
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Prospecting and lead generation: Identify and research potential clients or partners through various channels
  
* Relationship Building: Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and ensuring exceptional service delivery
  
* Pipeline Management: Manage and update the CRM system, keeping accurate records of interactions, leads, and opportunities
  
* Booking meetings: Putting clients together with their prospects and organizing these meetings.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* An ongoing tertiary education, with at least one year left of studies, of at least 50% study rate
  
* High speaking and written proficiency in Norwegian
  
* An interest in business development, sales, and customer relations
  
* Previous experience from sales or customer service
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Self-developer
  
* Service-minded
  
* Results-oriented
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Reliable AB**

 Read more about Reliable AB here.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Emma Nydén or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sts05@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105332

title: Avdelningskoordinator sökes till universitet i Stockholm!
description:
Nu söker vi en avdelningskoordinator för ett konsultuppdrag på 75 %! Har du minst två års arbetslivserfarenhet av administrativt arbete och tillgänglig för ett konsultuppdrag med start omgående?
 



  





 Då kan detta vara något för dig!
 



  





 Välkommen in med din ansökan!
 



  





**Arbetsbeskrivning** 




  




* Ansvara för frågor och ärenden på avdelningen
* Vara ansiktet utåt vid mottagande av gäster samt sköta kontakten med interna och externa gäster på avdelningens servicecenter
* Koordinera besöksplanering, koordinera och planera lokal och skrivbordsplatser på avdelningen, både för anställda och besökare
* Ta hand om nyanställda genom onboarding-checklista, ordna rum, uppdatera maillistor, visa runt och introducera kollegor för övriga på plats samt ordna datorer och utrustning.
* Vara behjälplig handledaren/ närmaste rekryterande chef, genom kontakt med IT- avdelningen inom beställning av dator osv till den nyanställda.
* Samordna och bevaka skötseln av avdelningen genom framföra felanmälningar till service/infra, samt koordinera/beställa städning, catering osv som behövs till avdelningen
* Arbeta löpande med att upprätthålla och uppdatera avdelningens interna gruppsida samt avdelnings webbsida
* Dokumentera, utveckla rutiner, uppdatera system och intranät med rutiner och information
* Övriga arbetsuppgifter ingår i rollen.



  





**Vem är du?** 




  





 Personen vi söker är kommunikativ, ordningsam och har förmågan att ha fler aktiviteter igång samtidigt. Du är relationsskapande och har en god samarbetsförmåga. Vidare är du självgående, självständigt och noggrann i ditt arbetssätt.
 



  





 För att vara kvalificerad för uppdraget ska du uppfylla följande:
 


* Gymnasium eller likvärdig utbildning
* Minst två (2) års arbetslivserfarenhet av administration
* Stor vana att arbeta med webbaserade system/molnapplikationer
* Goda kunskaper i MS Office
* Kan uttrycka sig väl i svenska, och engelska såväl tal som skrift.



  





 Det är
 *meriterande* 
 är om du har:
 


* Lämplig högskole-/universitetsutbildning
* Erfarenhet av gäster, resebokningar och hantering av event
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat på högskola/universitet tidigare
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat i koordinerande roll med många kontaktgrupper.



  





**Du erbjuds** 




  





 Du erbjuds ett konsultuppdrag på på 75 %. Uppdraget förväntas starta så snart möjligt och löper några månader framåt med eventuell chans till förlängning. Du blir anställd hos Jurek i en tidsbegränsad anställning med bra förmåner och en god kontakt med din konsultchef. Vid frågor gällande tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig konsultchef, Elvira Björebäck på Elvira.bjoreback@jurek.se
 



  





**Om verksamheten** 




  





 Jurek Rekrytering & Bemanning är ett starkt växande företag med fokus på flexibla och kundanpassande rekryterings- och bemanningslösningar. Genom vårt nytänkande och entreprenöriella arbetssätt är vi unika i Sverige idag. Våra uppdrag är främst inom juridik, ekonomi, HR, administration samt marknad och management.

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)
description:
Do you want to be a key player in growing a company that works to empower consumers to make smarter and more conscious financial decisions?
   

  

 Would you also like to work in an entrepreneurial environment across Scandinavia, striving to reach a growing number of users with services that help them save money and manage and improve their personal finances?
   

  

 If yes, then take the opportunity to join Lendo, the leading marketplace for loans in Scandinavia. On our marketplace, people seek guidance, browse, get, and manage consumer loans, car loans, credit cards, business loans, and mortgages. Today, we operate in Norway, Sweden, and Denmark, employing 250+ talented colleagues who work each day to make it easier for people to get a fair price on loans, often reducing their interest substantially.
   

  

 Since 2009 Lendo is also a part of the Schibsted Marketplaces family of brands.
   

  

**In this role, you will**
* Solve engineering problems using software development practices
* Design and develop our cloud infrastructure
* Collaborate with the security teams to perform risk analyses, assessment, and mitigation
* Improve observability, such as monitoring and alerting
* Contribute to incident management


**What we have been doing for the last six months**
* Established operations in three countries and multiple different products in the Google Cloud Platform
* Deployed Kubernetes, RabbitMQ, PostgreSQL, Istio, Envoy, and many more using Terraform
* Improved monitoring, logging and alerting using tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, Stackdriver and Humio
* We replaced our continuous delivery tool from Flux to ArgoCD in one of our products and are rolling it out to the rest of our products and platforms.


**Some things we will be doing**
* Improving the developer experience using self-service and automation
* Drive the architecture design among our existing platforms
* Identity and access management and auditing
* Define and implement SLIs and SLOs for our infrastructure and the Lendo platform
* Enabling and training engineering teams with DevOps
* Playing the Elevation of Privilege card game to assess and improve the security and compliance of our infrastructure products
* Leading the SRE team in initiatives, as well as being a key player in bigger initiatives the SRE team is involved in.


**We offer**
* A place for everyone - an international environment where we have teammates coming from 20+ different countries.
* Be a part of the Schibsted Marketplaces family with endless possibilities
* Room for you to do things your way
* We like to inspire your passion by organizing hackathons, knowledge-sharing events, as well as giving you the opportunity to join global conferences
* Lots of things you can learn through our Schibsted Learning platform, skilled sparring partners as well as make use of a good budget for competence development
* A wellness program if you want to do yoga, meditation, running, and other activities with colleagues and coaches
* 4 000 SEK of health promotion allowance
* 30 days of paid leave
* Super central location in Stockholm with an awesome rooftop ( Please notice that this position is for Stockholm - we'll offer you a hybrid workplace :) )
* We also chip in on your pension and give you extra Schibsted shares for free if you join our share-saving plan
* And yes, we have the industry standard perks such as team activities and fun parties!

title: French - Speaking Talent and University Network Development Internship
description:
**Start date: 19th August 2024**
**Location: Stockholm, Sweden or Remote - Please specify in your Cover Letter whether you would be able to work in Stockholm, or if you would be working Remote. If working Remote, please specify which country you would be working from.**
*Are you an ambitious and outgoing self-starter driven by the possibility to make an impact? Do you thrive in entrepreneurial cultures and want to be a part of an international team working within an important global industry?*
 Potentialpark is looking for you!
   

  

**About us:**
 We believe in a future of work where every person has the right place and opportunities to grow their potential.
   

  

 As thought leaders in the field of Talent Communication since 2002, we bring the voice of candidates to employers by providing knowledge and insights to help shape the future of employer branding, talent acquisition, and talent communication.
   

  

 Every year, candidates worldwide take part in Potentialpark’s Communication Studies and Experience Panels to share with us their expectations, preferences, and needs during the job search and application processes. Our in-depth analysis of this data helps local and global employers improve their career channels and stay up-to-date with what is important for young talent.
   

  

**What we offer:**
* A full-time, 6-month, internship position with a dynamic and international organization
* The opportunity to develop your skills in communication, marketing, sales, research, HR and employer branding
* Experience within the ever-important industry of talent communication, candidate experience, and employer branding
* A fun working environment with flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home


**The core functions of your role will include, but not be limited to:**
* Maintaining relationships with current and new members of the Talent and University Network
* Attract and retain new members to the Talent and University Network through phone calls, marketing, and other methods of communication
* Localization of materials and communication into local market language and based on that markets’ needs
* Management of the information and quality of the CRM system used for our Talent and University Network - Pipedrive
* Develop and monitor advertising campaigns to promote the annual study and our brand
* Support and implement the Talent and University Network strategy
* Continuous input to and support of ongoing research projects


**You will also have the opportunity, depending on ongoing projects, to:**
* Support and coordinate online and in-person events
* Build and implement social media strategy and communication
* Support and drive B2B marketing and communications initiatives


**To succeed in this role, you are:**
* A great communicator
* A relationship builder
* Target-oriented with a willingness to challenge yourself and find creative ways to achieve results
* A self-driven, independent quick learner with great organizational and prioritization skills
* Confident with strong negotiation and interpersonal abilities
* Interested in our areas of expertise


**We expect you to have:**
* A university degree or currently studying for one
* Fluent in English and French
* Swedish is NOT required for this position. English is our working language
* Experience in sales, account management and/or digital marketing is a plus


 Even if you feel you do not meet all of the requirements, please do apply. We care more about your passion and your drive, than your qualifications!
   

  

**Please apply with your CV and a short cover letter, in English.**
 We look forward to receiving your application! Please note that we have a number of open vacancies that we are sorting through, so we might take a while to respond to your application. We aim to respond within a few weeks, but this may vary.
   

  

 If you have any questions, feel free to contact:
   

  

 Tangui LeGoaller at Antonieta Fitch at
   

  

**IMPORTANT**
 By submitting your application for this job, you accept that your personal profile and all data related to it will be kept and used for recruiting purposes only and will not be shared with any third parties. We will store your personal details and data in our Applicant Tracking System. When the position you have applied for is filled, we will inform you by email if we will delete all your personal details and all data related to it or keep it for future recruiting purposes only. We cannot estimate the exact time period, but we will consider this period over when a candidate accepts our job offer for the position for which we are considering you.
   

  

 If you want us to delete your personal profile and all data related to it, or wish to get in touch with us, please email potentialcareer@potentialpark.com.
   

  

 Powered by JazzHR
   

  

 OZkzmmui2C
