title: Dustin söker juristpraktikant till juristavdelningen för HT 2024
description:
**Vi söker dig som är i slutet av dina juridikstudier och vill prova på att jobba som bolagsjurist på Dustin inom ett brett fält av affärsjuridiska områden.** 




 Dustin är en ledande onlinebaserad IT-partner i Norden och Benelux. Vår juristavdelning består för närvarande av cirka 20 kollegor som jobbar inom olika specialistområden, såsom Corporate Affairs, Contracts & Commercial och Data Protection. Som juristpraktikant kommer du att få möjlighet att arbeta med samtliga områden.
 



 Vi hoppas kunna ge dig värdefulla praktikveckor hos oss. Vi är ett härligt gäng med stark gemenskap och som brinner för att leverera högkvalitativ support till Dustins verksamhet. För att passa i rollen som praktikant hos oss, förutsätter vi att du har ett starkt intresse för affärsjuridik. Du har en god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift, såväl på svenska som på engelska. Som person är du driven, strukturerad och ansvarstagande. Du är också uthållig, positiv och målfokuserad.
 



 Vi erbjuder en praktikperiod som omfattar heltidsarbete under 10 veckor, med start i september. Om du önskar påbörja din praktik vid ett annat tillfälle, går det bra att ange det i din ansökan. Praktiken är oavlönad och finansieras med studiemedel.
 



 Om du har frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Sara Hedblom, Senior Legal Counsel, via e-post sara.hedblom@dustin.com. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Tech Lead with a passion for democratizing data with technology
description:
**Job ID:** 244426


**Date posted:** 14/06/2024


**Why we will love you**  

  

At IKEA, you’re welcome no matter where you come from, what you believe, and what you look like. We don’t even care how you have furnished your home. We’re interested in you simply because you’re you. Our different views, backgrounds, and personalities make us better understand our customers, give us more fun at work and spark more and better ideas. Perhaps your unique take on something could lead to a great idea that creates a better everyday life for the many people.
  

  

We are the data platform enablers - through tooling and services we simplify life for IKEA data citizens, to democratize data
  

  

The Ingka Data Platform offers streamlined solutions to save time, gain valuable business insights, and manage costs effectively.
  

  

We as a Platform Team supports data producers, data consumers and data governance teams making products discoverable with the right design and technology, (this is done with the metadata backbone concept and components for data quality, data pipelines, data sharing etc.). The platform is enabled by technical services, software components and frameworks.  

  

**Who you are**  

  

As a person, you have experience with architecting data platforms and solutions using GCP Products & Services. You have proven ability converting requirements & user journeys into architecture and design serving as blueprint for the final product implementation. You have a technical background in software engineering and ability to drive technical activities for implementation within an engineering team. You are experienced with tech breakdowns, solution architecture and code reviews.
  

  

You have a curious nature and actively acquire new knowledge, skills, champion new methods, and processes to improve performance. Independently drive tasks and improve/find better ways.
  

  

By encouraging simplicity, efficiency, ownership, and accountability you easily collaborate with others to achieve our common goals.
  

  

To be successful as a Tech Lead in the team, you have both deep understanding of the area of expertise, as well a broad understanding of other related areas. In addition, you have demonstrable experience in working in an Agile and DevOps working set-up. You get energized by delivering technical solutions with sustainable and scalable design and architecture.
  

  

The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day to day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values! You can read more regarding our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com  

  

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
  

As Tech Lead, your main responsibilities will include:
  

* Responsible for tech breakdowns, solution architecture and code reviews, mainly using GCP technology
* Converting requirements and user journeys into technical solutions
* Driving technical activities for implementation within a team
* Work closely with software development teams in Retail Areas to understand application requirements and enhance platforms.

  

Our current technology stack:
  

* CI/CD: Git/Github/Github Actions
* Cloud: Google Cloud Platform
* Programming backend: Python, Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes
* Programming frontend: JavaScript/Typescript, React

  

**Together as a team**  

  

We’re a small team quite autonomous, self-organizing and self-sufficient in many ways, which means part of our daily work is to define how we get things done together. We are based in Helsingborg & Malmö
  

  

We are passionate about collaboration and the IKEA value of togetherness where we all work together to set the direction of the team and to deliver the best possible outcome. Anyone on our team can come with ideas on things to work on and we believe in the test and learn approach.
  

  

We value development speed and data driven feedback a lot, we are responsible for the things we build throughout the whole life cycle, which means operations is an important part of our work.  

  

**Questions and support? Let's connect!**  

  

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they’re 100% “qualified”. If this is part of the reason you hesitate to apply, we like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think. We look forward to receiving your application.  

  

From: “Why Women Don’t Apply for Jobs Unless They’re 100% Qualified” by Tara Sophia Mohr, August 2014”  

  

The role is based in Helsingborg or Malmö, and you will report to Nina Novakovic, Engineering Manager
  

  

For more information about the role, reach out to hiring manager Nina Novakovic at nina.novakovic@ingka.ikea.com
  

  

If you have any questions about the recruitment process, please reach out to tech recruiter Jay Mistry at jay.mistry@ingka.ikea.com We will be interviewing continuously and are looking forward to hearing from you!  

  

“In this recruitment there is no relocation support provided by Ikea, hence we are looking for people living in the mentioned location.”

title: Test Automation Engineer
description:
**Why this job is for you:**
----------------------------

Because creating software solutions together with others is your passion. As a test automation engineer, you are the one responsible for developing tests and test automation environments to mainly embedded software. You always aim to create products that last, and you prefer to do it together with cross-functional teams. And this job gives you that chance, the chance to create value for some of Sweden's most forward-leaning industries.


**Responsibilities:**
---------------------

* Creating test automation environments, using Gitlab or similar tools
* Creating Devops pipelines, using industry leading tools.
* Creating/executing tests in a Devops environment ideally using Python

**Qualifications:**
-------------------

* To join Knightec we think that you have at least a bachelor's degree from a university and a couple of years of experience developing embedded systems tests or test environments.
* We also think that your main program languages are some of these three, Python, Java, or C++.
* Your expertise is in automated tests and, you are fluent in Swedish or in English.
* Experience with devops tools such as Gitlab, Docker or Jenkins is required.
* Hands-on experience with languages & tools relevant to CI/CD Pipeline implementations.
* Experience with DevSecOps is desirable.
* ISTQB certification or a similar certification is advantageous.

**What we offer:**
------------------

At Knightec, you will work in an innovative and supportive environment that promotes your personal development through exciting projects and training. We value diversity, with over 40 nationalities contributing to a dynamic and inclusive workplace. A vibrant culture of curiosity, collaboration, and knowledge sharing.


With a hybrid work model, we support your work-life balance, and offer competitive benefits for your well-being and financial security.


**About Knightec:**
-------------------


Knightec is a strategic partner in product and service development, dedicated to helping companies drive positive change for future business opportunities. We believe that collaboration and co-creation are keys to success and approach our clients' challenges from a holistic perspective. Our experts from around the world bring unique perspectives and skills, and together with our clients, we create innovative and sustainable solutions.

**Application process:**
------------------------

Please send in your application with a CV and cover letter. The application period is open until further notice.

title: Engineering Manager - Payments
description:
**Engineering Manager (Payments)**


Join us at Kivra! We are looking for people with passion for software development, love solving problems, and thrive in agile development environments. We have grown tremendously and are looking for an Engineering Manager to help us scale!


At Kivra, we are building services that connect almost 6 million people by providing a safe and accessible digital infrastructure that everyone in Sweden can trust and use. At the same time, we are saving trees - reducing the paper that is printed and transported - by providing a better digital alternative to physical paper communication.

**What you’ll be doing**


We are looking for an Engineering Manager that will work both strategically and hands-on with our Payments team.


Part of being our new Engineering Manager is to lead a small team of engineers. You will manage, develop and coach the people in your team so they are happy, motivated and have the opportunity to grow. The payments team works in an agile environment committed to the DevOps principles, and you will have a great influence in enabling scalability and technical innovation.


Our services deal with large amounts of users, data and transactions daily, and our objective is to do so with 100% availability. We believe in doing things smart, simple and open source - and this is reflected in our tech stack. Our platform and core is built on Erlang and Riak. We also utilize Docker, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, GCP, Kafka, Ansible, Elixir, Go, Splunk, Github, and more. We believe that you will be actively involved in development, operations and incidents, leading by example and contributing to the overall success of the team.


Security, reliability, and scalability are three areas we value highly and that serve as a foundation for our services; and central to the work you’ll do. You will provide technical direction, reinforce engineering practices and ensure adherence to coding standards, reliability, and scalability principles. You will also be establishing cross functional relationships and working closely with our domain architects, product managers and other engineering managers to ensure that technical solutions align with business goals.

**About you**


We believe that you have experience managing software engineering teams and are used to empower, support and coach on a daily basis. You have a strong engineering background and can support your team with the roadmap, design and implementation tradeoffs. As you will be an essential part of driving the Payments team forward, we believe that you have a genuine interest in financial technology and payments. Furthermore, you have extensive experience with Agile/Scrum processes and their role in DevOps.

**We also think that you**

* Have excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Have a relevant degree in computer science or equivalent.
* Have strong analytical and problem solving skills with a proactive approach.
* Have passion for continuous learning and development for yourself and your team.

**We offer**


Kivra offers a role in a caring and committed team, in a company that is growing and continuously innovating. You’ll join a warm and friendly culture that thrives on collaboration and teamwork. You will be involved in shaping and influencing a product currently used by more than half of Sweden’s population.


We offer competitive remuneration and great benefits. We offer a hybrid way of working where working from home is of course accepted, however you are always welcome to join us in our vibrant office located in central Stockholm.

**How to apply**


Easy peasy, just send in your CV and cover letter as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact Sarah Ohlsson, Talent Acquisition Partner at sarah.ohlsson@kivra.com.

title: Data Scientist in Group and Business Services Data & Analytics Team \u007C SEB, Stockholm
description:
Do you see the potential in data and want to contribute to accelerating our data driven automation journey using Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and other data driven automation tools? Then this might be the right challenge for you!

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our group of data professionals. Our Data & Analytics Office is a function within the Group & Business Services (GBS) - a cross-divisional function support SEB’s business across multiple business areas. Our mission is to empower Group & Business Services by unlocking the potential of data we create in our processes to identify improvements with a focus on data driven automation. We provide support to enable data-driven decision-making and leverage process intelligence across Group & Business Services.  

As a part of the SEB Group, we provide world-class financial services to support SEB on the journey of becoming the leader in efficiency and innovation. Our dedicated team of over 2800 employees consistently strives to enhance business development and growth. If you want to be part of an engaging and enabling environment where you can turn your everyday actions into global results, this is where you get to shine.  

  

**About the role:**
As a Data Scientist, you will play an important role in accelerating our organization's data journey and creating business value. In this role you are expected to understand business needs and pain points in the process flows that can be addressed through data-driven solutions. You will have to analyze large datasets, apply advanced statistical and machine-learning techniques to drive actionable insights, data-driven decisions and improve services to the customers.

**Core roles and responsibilities:*** Work closely with stakeholders to understand their business needs and identify problems that can be solved using AI/ML techniques.
* Collect and refine business requirements using various methods, such as data-driven insights, interviews, document analysis and workflow analysis.
* Identify opportunities for AI/ML use cases, focusing on optimizing our manual processes and improving customer service.
* Lead and drive data workstreams engaging stakeholders and cross-functional teams in the implementation of the solutions.
* Collect, clean and analyze large amounts of data from various sources using various tools, methods, and formats to create business insights.
* Create ML algorithms and models to address specific business challenges and identify business opportunities
* Deploy models into the production environment, take care of the maintenance, monitor performance and secure reliability.
* Collaborate with the Data, ML/AI, Cloud Engineers, Data Scientists and DevOps teams across the bank to accelerate AI/ML use cases


### **To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**

* You have a strong academic background in Machine Learning and Data Science (at least hold a Master’s degree in relevant fields).
* You have working experience as a Data Scientist or similar role for at least 3 years and have been involved in developing and deploying ML models for solving business problems.
* You have excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to take ownership.
* You have great communication skills and fluency in English.
* You have proficiency in SQL, the ability to query and manipulate databases.
* You have great data visualization techniques, the ability to create meaningful visualizations and communicate insights
* You have proficiency in Python (or R) programming language, have experience working with ML
* You have experience working with a Cloud solution (Google Cloud Platform is preferred).
* You know MLOps principles and applied them in your previous projects.

### **What we offer:**

* A unique opportunity to be a part of SEB’s data journey.
* High engagement from the organization to accelerate the AI journey.
* A truly international environment to work side-by-side with experienced colleagues in a diverse and high-performing team.
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.

**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.  

We are looking forward to your application by June 30th, 2024. Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application before the deadline. If you have questions about the position, please contact Gavin Whyte,Head of Data & Reporting Services &GBS Data & Analytics Officer, at gavin.whyte@seb.se.
**Learn more about working at SEB here:****www.sebgroup.com/career**
It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: DevOps Engineer - Malmö or Lisbon
description:
Are you a talented and experienced DevOps Engineer looking for a new and exciting opportunity? Look no further! Our innovative company is currently seeking a skilled individual to join our dynamic team. If you have a deep understanding of system maintenance, setup, backup, and configuration, as well as a passion for optimizing infrastructure and streamlining operations, we want to hear from you.
  
  

**Here's what we're looking for:**  

* Manage system maintenance, setup, backup, and configuration for Ubuntu, Postfix, and Maria DB.
* Develop and maintain efficient and scalable infrastructure solutions.
* Implement and manage firewalls, SMTP, TCP/IP, DNS, and hosting configurations.
* Development and troubleshooting within PHP, Laravel and Python.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and deployment of applications.
* Continuously monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and provide timely resolutions.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends to drive innovation and efficiency.
* Proven experience in system maintenance, setup, backup, and configuration for Ubuntu, Postfix, and Maria DB.
* Strong understanding of firewalls, SMTP, TCP/IP, DNS, and hosting.
* Proficiency in scripting and automation tools for infrastructure management.
* Solid knowledge of version control systems and CI/CD pipelines.
* Familiarity with containerization technologies such as Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Effective communication and collaboration abilities.
* While not required, familiarity with Microsoft Exchange Online would be a plus.


**In return, we offer:**  

* The chance to work on a platform that's making a real difference in the world
* A close-knit team of founders who are passionate about what they do
* Opportunities to develop your skills and take on new challenges
* The freedom to influence everything from our working methods to the end result
* The possibility to work from our offices in Malmö and Lisbon.


At Nimblr, we believe in taking care of our team. That's why we offer not just a competitive salary, but over 40 different perks to help you thrive both in and out of the workplace. The benefits cover everything from flexible working hours and regular team events to option agreement, which gives you the opportunity to invest in our company and share in our success.
  
  

Looking for a company that's innovative, dynamic, and changing the game? We're it! Apply now to join our team and let's create something amazing.

title: Kan du VB.Net och vill ha en Tillsvidareanställnng?
description:
techlove AB har fått uppdraget av vår kund att hitta 2 stycken systemutvecklare inom VB.Net för tillsvidareanställning.
  
Vår kund vill anställa en utvecklare ASAP och den andra efter sommaren.
  
  

Vår kund går bra ekonomiskt och efterfrågan på deras tjänster växet.
  
Vår kund har sina kontakter och kunder framförallt i USA, Kanada och Tyskland.
  
I dagsläget finns befintliga system som både behöver unterhållas och utveckla nya funktioner oftast i just VB.Net.
  
Vår kund är placerad i Köping. Att arbeta Remote till 100% är inga konstigheeter, kanske kan man träffas någon gång över en bit mat med tillhörande dryck.
  
  

För att alla parter skall trivas är det viktigt att du som systemutvecklare är engagerad och vill vara med i processeer och tänker själv och inte bara utför uppgifeer som du får på skrivbordet.
  
Är det så att du arbetar Remote men känner att du vill har en liten arbetsplats så finns det lösningar på detta.
  
  

Nedan är mycket av det vi arbetar med idag.
  
Kan du bocka av en stor del av nedanstående tycker vi absolurt att du skall skicka in en ansökan så tar vi det därifrån.
  
* Senior systemutvecklare inom VB.Net(fullstack)
* Typescript och Javascript
* SQL-Server och lite databasdeign.
* Vi är analyiska och självgående.
* Vi hälps åt med Arkitektur, säkerhet och kodningsstandarder

* Kunskap i C#. Är det så at du är en vass C#-utvecklare men känner att du behöver lite matchning i VB.Net sä tar vår kund hand om det.
* Webforms
* GIS-system och Integrationer
* Google Maps, Javascript SDK
* Blazor
* MS Azure
* Azure DevOps CI/CD
* API-integrationer
* Utveckla RUST full API: s


Är du den person vi söker?
  
  

Har du några frågor eller funderingar är du sjlvklart välkommen att höra av dig till Karl Eriksson på 076-500 50 36.
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan!
  
  

Vänligen
  
techlove AB

title: Senior DevOps-ingenjör – Heltid, Stockholm
description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. Besök oss på www.modernera.se.
  
På uppdrag av en kund söker vi nu en senior DevOps-ingenjör. Vår kund är en ledande specialist inom digitala lösningar som sedan 1984 skapar nya möjligheter, förenklar livet för människor och stärker kunders konkurrenskraft. Som IT-konsulter bygger de viktiga system som är centrala för kunders verksamheter inom en mängd olika branscher. Företaget har över 140 anställda och kontor i Stockholm, Uppsala, Göteborg, Malmö samt Sevilla. Kunden strävar efter att hälften av deras projekt till 2025 ska bidra till FN: s hållbarhetsmål.
  
Du kommer att arbeta i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm, med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån. Som en senior DevOps-ingenjör kommer du att vara en nyckelperson i flera av företagets projekt och bidra till att effektivisera arbetsprocesserna. Du kommer att ha ett nära samarbete med kollegor som sitter utspridda över hela Sverige, där ni tillsammans arbetar för att skapa och upprätthålla företagets externa åtaganden gentemot kunder.
  
I rollen som senior DevOps-ingenjör ingår flera kontaktytor eftersom du agerar som ett stöd åt flera projekt samtidigt. Arbetsuppgifterna inkluderar bland annat underhåll av system, installation och uppgradering av dessa när det behövs.
  
  

**Krav:**  

* Minst 4 års tidigare erfarenhet av DevOps
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift


**Meriterande:**  

* Erfarenhet från arbete i offentliga organisationer
* Programmeringskunskaper i C#, JavaScript, TypeScript eller PowerShell
* Kunskaper i Jira, Bamboo eller Bitbucket


**Du får:**  

* Ett kreativt och stimulerande arbete i en utmanande miljö inom en börsnoterad koncern
* Extra föräldraförmåner och en god företagskultur
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter för den som vill avancera
* En flexibel arbetsplats med stor frihet att planera din vardag så att arbete och privatliv kan samordnas
* Ett modernt och välutrustat kontor i Stockholm med tillgång till eget gym, cykelgarage och takterrass


Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund på heltid. Anställningen inleds med en sex månaders provanställning, som därefter övergår i en tillsvidareanställning. Tillträde: Omgående.
  
  

**Ansökan:**  

Skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Ange "Senior DevOps-ingenjör – Heltid, Stockholm" i ämnesraden.

title: Network Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Vår kund söker en dynamisk och mångsidig tekniker som kan förstärka vårt support team!
  
  

Rollen innebär att du kommer att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där du hanterar både fysiska och virtuella klientmiljöer samt en rad olika tekniska verktyg och system. Som person behöver du vara driven, relativt självgående och ha en positiv inställning. Du trivs med att arbeta i en teammiljö och har förmågan att lösa problem på ett effektivt sätt.
  
  

**Kvalifikationer:**  

En djupare teknisk IT-kunskap, Windows, Linux, Nätverks-tekniker, servrar
  
**Erfarenhet av 2:**nd och 3:rd Line Support
  
En prestigelös och lösningsorienterad inställning
  
Erfarenhet av att jobba agilt med drift och förvaltning
  
Goda kunskaper i Jira
  
Erfarenhet av DevOps och ITIL
  
God förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska
  
Vi ser det även som meriterande om du arbetat med ServiceNow
  
Meriterande att ha arbetat med Monitorering/övervakning
  
  

**Övrigt:**  

**Uppdragsort:** Göteborg
  
**Uppdragslängd:** 11 månader
  
  

Visst låter detta som ett spännande uppdrag?
  
Sök redan i dag så berättar vi mer. Vi behöver en ansökan inkluderat CV som matchar vår kunds önskemål. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så vänta inte med din ansökan då vi behöver komplettera med mer information och anbudstiden är kort.
  
  

NXT Interim och NXT Rekrytering är ett nischat och innovativt företag som är verksamma inom konsult och rekryteringsbranschen. Vi är verksamma inom HR, IT, Ekonomi, Sälj och Marknad och har 20 års erfarenhet i branschen. Vi erbjuder våra konsulter bl a sjukförsäkring, remote-arbetsplatser och flera andra förmåner som förgyller deras vardag. Vid projektanställning tillämpar vi kollektivavtal.

title: Cloud Platform Engineer / DevOps engineer to ABAX Norway / Sweden / Poland
description:
Join us on our mission to deliver mobility data insights that empower people to do more with less! At ABAX, we're transforming the telematics industry in Europe. We help businesses with mobile workforces work smarter by reducing costs, optimizing operations, and improving sustainability, efficiency, and safety.
  
Ready to craft the future of cloud infrastructure with us? Become the architect of secure, scalable, and resilient systems that drive our business objectives forward. Dive into the world of optimized operations, where minimizing expenses and maximizing efficiency define your path to success!
  
  

**Some of the other things you will be working on:**  

Design, implement, and manage cloud infrastructure using platforms such as Google Cloud Platform, AWS, or Azure.
  
Serve as an approver and quality gate for merge requests (MRs) submitted by developers to introduce new infrastructure using Terraform.
  
Monitor and optimize cloud infrastructure performance, security, and cost.
  
Implement best practices for cloud security, including identity and access management, encryption, and network security.
  
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to cloud infrastructure and applications.
  
Participate in development operations on-duty rotation.
  
  

**Nice-to-have:**  

Understanding of security or networking concepts and protocols is preferred but not mandatory.
  
Previous experience in DevOps is a plus
  
  

What's in it for you?
  
We understand that a happy employee is a productive one. That's why we offer competitive benefits such as Multisport membership, flexible working hours, and occasional remote work options. Your well-being is paramount, supported by private healthcare, insurance, and a pension plan.
  
  

**We believe you have:**  

Relevant BSc in tech/IT, software development, or other relevant field.
  
Relevant experience as a Cloud Platform Engineer orSRE Engineer or similar role.
  
Strong proficiency in cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform,AWS, or Azure
  
Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform or Ansible.
  
Proficiency in one of the programming languages such as Python, Go, or .Net, and scripting languages such as Bash or PowerShell.
  
Knowledge of containerization and orchestration technologies such as Docker and/or Kubernetes.
  
Familiarity with centralized monitoring and logging tools.
  
  

**Personal attributes:**  

Discover a role crafted for someone who thrives on our four core values: enthusiastic,customer-centric,innovative, andsustainable. Approach challenges with an analytical mindset and a keen eye for detail.We envision a candidate who finds energy in cross-team collaboration, seamlessly navigating through different departments and geographies. At ABAX, we celebrate teamwork and motivationfor cooperation across teams, departments, and geographies, where being a team player is the key to our ongoing success.Picture yourself in a position that sparks your curiosity, encourages working smarter, and values continuous feedback for your growth.
  
  

**Other information:**  

**Start date:** As soon as possible /As agreed.
  
**Work extent:** Full time.
  
**Remote Status:** Fully remote
  
**Location:** While this position is ideally based in one of the following three countries: Norway, Sweden or Poland.
  
  

**Our hiring process:**  

1. We do look at your resume when some kind of experience is required but – and then conduct a short phone call where we ensure that our goals are aligned. In addition, find out a little bit more about who you are and why you are interested in this position.
  
2. We send out our technical test, focusing on how you approach the work.
  
3. In-depth interview with one or two of our stake holders, could be a team member for example – to get to know each other even better. At this stage, we deep dive into the technical test that you have done.
  
4. Second interview with the hiring manager and our recruitment specialist – focusing even more on who you are and also – what you know.
  
5.Digital reference checkthrough our supplier RefApp
  
6.Offer and celebration!

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) Developer
description:
We are looking for an experienced developer with hands-on experience with cloud platforms and automation frameworks. If you enjoy working in an international environment in a role where your commitment and drive is highly valued- then this might be the right role for you! Apply for this position today as we apply ongoing selection!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 In Central Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 Upon agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 Sometimes it's said that no day is like the other, and in this position, that's truly the case. As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) Developer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the reliability, scalability, and performance of our clients systems. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and maintain robust infrastructure and automation solutions. Your work will be divided equally between development and maintenance. You will also play a big role in developing and maintaining the security systems. The role will adapt to your previous experience, shaping itself around your existing knowledge and skills.
 


  


 You will be introduced into a welcoming environment and offered training and support from your colleagues. You will be a part of a team consisting of 4 other employees with the Software Engineer Manager as your direct supervisor.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* The opportunity to develop on a personal and professional level
  
* To become part of a large international company at the forefront of technology
  
* To become a part of a company that values innovation, commitment and drive
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Design, build, and maintain infrastructure to support the growing platform
  
* Develop and implement automation tools and processes
  
* Monitor system performance and proactively identify and resolve issues
  
* Stay current with industry trends and best practices in SRE and DevOps methodologies
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Strong programming skills in languages such as Python or Java
  
* Hands-on experience with cloud platforms, preferably GCP but AWS or Azure also works
  
* Experience in DevOps and automation frameworks such as Terraform and Kubernetes
  
* Fluency in English, both written and verbal. If you have knowledge in Swedish it is considered a merit
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Self-sufficient
  
* Problem solver
  
* Quality-oriented
  
* Adaptable
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
 



 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Sofia Axelsson or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on recruitmentstockholmsouth@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15104482

title: Tekniker med Linux-inriktning
description:
**SWG har ordet**
 SWG är en marknadsledande leverantör i Sverige av fastighetssystem. Vi brinner för våra lösningar och för att ge fastighetsbolag och bostadsbolag långsiktigt hållbara system och kundnära tjänster. Vi finns idag representerade på sex orter i Sverige och har kontor i Stockholm, Eskilstuna, Karlstad, Borlänge och Göteborg.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I denna roll lägger du främst fokus på installation, releasehantering, integration, konfiguration och testning. Det ingår en del felsökning med utmanande problem att lösa för våra kunder. Systemen är egenutvecklade och skräddarsydda för varje kund. Som tekniker finns du till hands för kunden när problem dyker upp och du hjälper dem remote via fjärrstyrning. Du stöttar pågående nyutvecklingsprojekt, gör uppgraderingar och förändringar i kundernas system – allt för att deras upplevelse ska bli så bra som möjligt. I denna tjänst kommer du primärt arbeta mot Fast2-systemet. Förutom stöttning av externa kunder så hanterar du även en del interna ärenden.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden innefattar bland annat:**
* Design och implementering av högtillgängliga, skalbara och säkra system och applikationer
* Skapa och underhålla skript och automatiseringsverktyg med hjälp av PowerShell, Bash och liknande skriptspråk
* Implementera och optimera konfigurationshanteringsverktyg som Puppet
* Övervaka och felsök produktionssystem, applikationer och infrastruktur med expertis
* Samarbeta tätt med utvecklare och intressenter för att säkerställa enkel implementering och smidiga utrullningar
* Övervaknings- och loggningsverktyg för monitorering av systemhälsa


**Om dig**
 Vi ser att du som söker har god erfarenhet och kunskap av Linuxarbete med fokus på applikationsinstallationer och konfigurationer. Du har tidigare jobbat med felsökning och har en stark problemlösningsförmåga och förmåga att utföra felsökningar med precision. Du bör ha djup förståelse för Docker och containeriseringsteknologier som Kubernetes. Har du DevOps-erfarenhet är det ett stort plus. I rollen krävs det goda kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift och har du engelska-kunskaper är det meriterande.
   

  

**Utöver ovanstående tror vi att:**
* Du är bekväm med Ubuntu och RHEL Linux
* Du behärskar skalskriptspråk som PowerShell och bash
* Du har färdighet i konfigurationshanteringsverktyg så som Puppet
* Du har god kunskap i databashantering i MS SQL och MySQL


**SWG erbjuder**
 Du kommer bli del av ett team som idag består av två personer som du jobbar tätt med samt en teamledare. Som medarbetare hos SWG så erbjuds du flexibilitet för att få livet att gå ihop, men vi ser gärna att du är på plats någon dag i veckan då vissa interna ärende förmedlas på plats. Hos SWG erbjuds du en arbetsplats med högt i tak och ett stort utrymme att tycka till och påverka. Stockholmskontoret är beläget i ljusa, fräscha, moderna lokaler i Värtahamnen och där arbetar cirka 55 personer. Läs mer om företaget här: https://www.swg.com/se/
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Vi tillämpar löpande urval i denna process vilket innebär att tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Vi rekommenderar dig därför att ansöka så snart som möjligt!
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar kring Asta Agencys rekryteringsprocess, tveka inte att höra av dig till kandidat@astaagency.se.
   

  

 Om Asta Agency
   

  

 Asta Agency är ett bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag där du som jobbsökare står i fokus. Vi jobbar med attraktiva arbetsgivare i hela tjänstemannasektorn i storstäderna.
   

  

 Hos Asta Agency har du möjlighet att antingen jobba som konsult eller att bli rekryterad direkt till våra kunder. Vi är din partner på vägen mot en framgångsrik karriär.
   

  

 Om detta inte skulle vara rollen för dig just nu uppmanar vi dig att connecta med oss eller söka efter fler jobbmöjligheter på vår hemsida.

title: Lead Frontend Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 We are seeking a skilled and experienced Lead Frontend Engineer with expertise in modern micro-frontend architecture and engineering leadership to join our dynamic development team. Your primary focus will be to lead the engineers in your product team towards efficient workflows, great quality code and contribute to best practices for our community of Frontend developers.
   

  

 You will collaborate with our engineers of different competences, product managers, designers, and business experts to deliver high-quality, scalable, and user-friendly software solutions. The ideal candidate is passionate about frontend development, has a strong leadership skills, and keeps up to date with the latest trends and best practices in frontend development.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Architecture Design: Design and develop the frontend architecture for large-scale web applications, considering scalability, performance, and maintainability. Define architectural patterns, frameworks, and libraries to be used in the development process.
* Technical Leadership: Provide technical leadership and guidance to frontend development teams. Mentor junior developers and promote best practices, coding standards, and architectural principles. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align technical decisions with business goals.
* Frontend Development: Hands-on development of frontend code using modern web technologies, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, micro-frontends, and frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js. Write clean, modular, and well-documented code that adheres to industry best practices and coding standards.
* Performance Optimization: Identify and address performance bottlenecks and optimize frontend code for improved speed and responsiveness. Ensure the application is optimized for different browsers and devices, providing a seamless user experience.
* Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate effectively with designers, backend developers, and other stakeholders to understand business requirements, provide technical insights, and ensure smooth integration of frontend and backend components. Communicate technical concepts and decisions to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
* Testing and Quality Assurance: Implement and promote frontend testing strategies, including unit testing, integration testing, and end-to-end testing. Ensure high code quality through code reviews, automated testing, and continuous integration practices.
* Deployment and release: Collaborate with DevOps and backend teams to ensure smooth deployment and release of frontend applications. Participate in the design and implementation of CI/CD pipelines to automate build, testing, and deployment processes. Coordinate with stakeholders to plan and execute deployment strategies, ensuring seamless releases and minimizing downtime. Monitor and troubleshoot production issues related to frontend components and provide timely resolutions.
* Research and Innovation: Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in frontend technologies, frameworks, and tools. Evaluate and recommend new tools or methodologies that can improve frontend development processes and overall system performance.


**Qualifications**
**Requirements:**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Extensive experience in frontend development, with a strong focus on architecting complex web applications.
* In-depth knowledge of frontend technologies, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js.
* Proven experience in designing scalable and maintainable frontend architectures.
* Strong understanding of web performance optimization techniques and best practices.
* Experience with frontend build tools, package managers, and version control systems (e.g., Webpack, Babel, npm, Git).
* Familiarity with backend technologies and the ability to collaborate effectively with backend engineers.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex technical challenges.
* Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to influence and inspire a team.


**Additional Information**
**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a dynamic organization committed to exceeding customer expectations through collaboration, innovation, and technology. Our tech organization caters to the unique needs of millions of customers, delivering end-to-end solutions for all our brands. As we accelerate digitalization, we seek strong leaders who can bring their best capabilities, innovative ideas, and talented technologists to support the transformative journey of H&M Group.
   

  

 Shaping the future of fashion with people, data, and tech. The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits and a flexible work life, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 H&M Group is a value-driven company that wants to lead the way to a more inclusive environment. We are committed to create an inclusive & diverse workplace with a culture that is dynamic and innovative.
   

  

 We welcome your application regardless of who you are, where you’re from and what you like.
   

  

 We welcome applicants with different backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.
   

  

 We welcome all applicants to strengthen our innovative and diverse culture.
   

  

 Learn more about our I&D work https://youtu.be/veRbl9Cijts
   

  

**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Please apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 We will review and interview applicants on-going.
   

  

**Please do not send applications to individual email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page. We look forward to receiving your application!**

title: Azure Devops Engineer
description:
*Vill du vara med och skapa nya tjänster och automationer för våra kunder inom Cloud Transformation? Är du teknikdriven och vill arbeta i en mindre grupp med en tight gemenskap som ligger i framkant med relevant teknik? Då är du precis den vi söker!* 




  





**Azure DevOps Engineer på Advania** 
 🚀
 



 På Cloud Transformation, inom Advanias största affärsområde Managed Services Provider, hjälper vi våra kunder att etablera och utnyttja sin molnmiljö på bästa möjliga sätt.
 



  





 I rollen som DevOps Engineer hos oss arbetar du agilt med till exempel Azure DevOps och dess komponenter såsom pipelines, CI/CD för att hjälpa våra kunder att lyckas i molnet. Du har också möjlighet att stötta i kundleveranser och jobba med arkitektur eller säkerhet vid intresse.
 



 Den geografiska placeringen spelar oss mindre roll. Jobba utifrån den placering som passar dig och din situation. Våra medarbetare finns bland annat på följande orter i Sverige: Stockholm, Göteborg, Norrköping, Örebro och Halmstad.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder en rolig och utmanande roll i en innovativ miljö, där vår gruppering växer snabbt. Om du vill vara med och utveckla framtidens teknik och samtidigt ha kul på jobbet, så är detta din chans att ansluta till vårt team!
 



  





**Vad vi söker hos dig** 
 ✨
 



 För att du ska trivas och passa hos oss söker vi dig som är en teamplayer och självgående med öppenhet för att hjälpa andra. Vi tror att dina personliga egenskaper är avgörande för hur väl du kommer trivas hos oss, därför tror vi att du är nyfiken och teknikdriven, med tidigare erfarenhet av praktiskt arbete med Azure.
 



  





 Det skulle vara fantastiskt om du också har erfarenhet av att arbeta med automatisering och optimering av infrastruktur i Azure med verktyg som Bicep, PowerShell och Azure DevOps-pipelines.
 



  





 Det är meriterande om du tidigare har erfarenhet av utveckling i språk eller tekniker såsom Python, Node.js, TypeScript, PowerShell, REST, YAML, Git men det är inget krav då vi har flera fantastiska medarbetare med den bakgrunden. Är du rätt person kan vi hjälpa dig utvecklas inom området Cloud Transformation.
 



  





**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!** 
 👋
 



 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
 



  





 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut.
 



  





 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.

title: Echandia söker en erfaren Cloud Engineer!
description:
Echandia är ett innovativt företag som verkar inom sjöfartsindustrin, de utvecklar och tillverkar kraftfulla energilagringsystem för fartyg och andra storskaliga tillämpningar. Här erbjuds du möjligheten att bli en del av ett företag som arbetar med toppmoderna batterisystem och moderna tekniker samt som är med och bidrar till de globala klimatmålen, inte minst inom sjöfartsektorn. Det här jobbet är för dig med erfarenhet av att arbeta med molnapplikationer och som vill bli en del av ett företag som är på en spännände tillväxt resa!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Echandia Marine AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna, Pampas Marina
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 I den här rollen kommer du att arbeta nära tvärfunktionella team för att designa, implementera och optimera skalbara molnapplikationer. Du kommer att spela en avgörande roll i utvecklingen och underhållet av molnbaserade applikationer som driver deras innovativa marina lösningar. Som utvecklare ansvar du för att säkerställa tillförlitligheten, säkerheten och prestandan hos molninfrastrukturen samtidigt som du samarbetar med intressenter för att definiera krav och leverera högkvalitativa lösningar. Som en integrerad del av organisationen kommer du att ha gott om möjligheter att utveckla dina färdigheter och växa professionellt.
   

 Det här är en konsultuppdrag, vilket innebär att du kommer att anställas som konsult av Academic Work. Uppdraget är långsiktigt där ambitionen är att bli överrekryterad av Echandia.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Du erbjuds en stödjande och inkluderande arbetsmiljö där kreativitet och innovation uppmuntras
  
* Denna roll presenterar unika utmaningar och möjligheten att göra en betydande inverkan på framtidens hållbara sjötransport
  
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har omkring 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att designa, utveckla och implementera molnbaserade applikationer.
  
* Har god kompetens inom programmeringsspråk som C#, Python eller Node.js för att bygga skalbara och pålitliga molnlösningar.
  
* Har en god förståelse för mikrotjänstearkitektur och containeriseringsteknologier som Docker och Kubernetes.
  
* Har starka problemlösningsfärdigheter och förmågan att felsöka komplexa problem i distribuerade molnmiljöer.
  
* Har goda kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmågan att samarbeta effektivt med tvärfunktionella team för att leverera kvalitativa molnlösningar.
  
* Talar obehindrat i både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift då detta är arbetsspråk.
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Erfarenhet inom lågnivåprogrammering, exempelvis C-programmering.
  
* Erfarenhet inom Azure AD och Azure molnutveckling.
  
* Erfarenhet av maskininlärning.
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Samarbetsinriktad och kommunikativ
  
* Självgående
  
* Problemlösande
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned innan sista ansökningsdag om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Echandia Marine AB**

 Du kan läsa mer om Echandia på deras hemsida: Echandia – energy storage solutions for heavy-duty maritime electrification
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Sophia Gyllenhammar eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sts04@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15104590

title: Data Engineer within Cloud solutions
description:
**Därför är detta jobbet för dig**
 Du vill jobba i team med kollegor som stöttar, utmanar och har kul tillsammans. Du brinner för att utveckla digitala produkter med fokus på hög kvalitet och hållbarhet med en modern teknikstack och AI. Du vill hamna på ett företag där du har inflytande på vad vi gör och hur vi gör det, där din och teamets vision blir verklighet uppe i molnet. Du vill göra skillnad genom att bidra med nya perspektiv och färdigheter till projekt för lokala såväl som globala kunder, som påverkar människors liv till det bättre.
   

  

**En karriär att vara stolt över**
 Hos oss kommer du att vara med och forma framtidens industri, med banbrytande teknik och projekt som på riktigt skapar en bättre vardag för människor. Vi specialiserar oss på att skapa intelligenta system som hanterar allt från datautvinning till uppkopplade konsumentprodukter för våra kunder. Våra DevOps-team driver innovation genom att effektivisera utvecklings- och driftsprocesser. Vi kombinerar expertisen inom utveckling och drift för att skapa en sömlös och snabb leveranspipeline. Med fokus på automatisering, ML och AI säkerställer vi hög kvalitet, kontinuerlig leverans och förbättrad skalbarhet för våra produkter och tjänster.
   

  

 Vi är kärnan i "Cloud meets industry" - där vi använder molnteknologi som AWS och Azure för att revolutionera traditionella branscher. Vårt arbete inom exempelvis medicinteknik förbättrar processer och serviceförmåga med molnplattformar och IoT-data pipelines, vilket optimerar fjärrservice och underhåll.
   

  

 Inom området Data Engineering använder vi oss av avancerade datainsamlings- och analysverktyg för att leverera lösningar som förutser underhållsbehov och förbättrar driftsäkerheten. Inom exempelvis fordonsindustrin förbättrar vi effektiviteten genom plattformar som proaktivt minskar driftstopp och stärker vår och våra kunders roll i den digitala transformationen.
   

  

**Därför är du rätt för rollen**
 Du har ett genuint intresse för teknik och har arbetat ett par år i liknande roll efter att ha tagit examen från en teknisk högskola eller universitet. Du har tidigare experimenterat eller jobbat med att implementera ML och AI i ditt dagliga arbete och vill fortsätta utveckla den förmågan. Tekniskt är du rustad med en modern stack som inkluderar bl.a. Node, React, Redux, Typescript, Azure, AWS-tjänster som Lambda och RDS, stöttade av CI/CD-verktyg som GitHub Actions. Du och teamet kommer att välja de teknologier som behövs för att lösa uppgiften, inte tvärtom. Därför är du också en bra kommunikatör både internt och externt när det gäller krav, önskemål och tekniska val.
   

  

**Om Knightec**
 Vi är en strategisk partner inom produkt- och tjänsteutveckling och är dedikerade till att hjälpa företag att driva positiv förändring för morgondagens affärsmöjligheter. Vi tror att samarbete och samskapande är nycklarna till framgång. Vi närmar oss våra kunders utmaningar ur ett helhetsperspektiv. Därför har vi samlat experter från hela världen som bidrar med unika perspektiv och färdigheter till diskussionen. Vi har förmånen att arbeta med kunder som delar vår passion för att bidra till en mer innovativ och hållbar värld. Tillsammans med dem skapar vi produkter och tjänster som levererar värde till både kunder och företag, löser verkliga problem och hjälper organisationer att transformera.

title: Senior Software Developer to PerkinElmer
description:
When joining PerkinElmer, you select an experienced and trusted leader in scientific solutions, with the support of a global service network and distribution centers, providing the right solution, at the right time, to meet critical customer needs. With over an 80+ year legacy of advancing science and a mission of innovating for a healthier world, our dedicated team collaborates closely with commercial, government, academic and healthcare customers to deliver our broad portfolio of analytical solutions, and OneSource services.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Hybrid working – 3 days in Hägersten Office
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 According to agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 PerkinElmer in Stockholm is looking for a motivated, experienced senior software development engineer professional to accelerate our growth of our Perten instrumentation which tests quality and performance in the Food Industry. Perten Instruments, a part of PerkinElmer’s Food Solutions business, has a rich 60-year legacy of providing leading testing instrumentation to the food industry, including near-infrared, process NIR, and rheology solutions.
 


  


 As a Senior Back-end Engineer, you will play a critical role in developing and maintaining the cloud infrastructure and services that power the Food instrument. We think that you have prior experience in AWS C# .NET windows stack, CQRS, Event Sourcing, and DDD, as you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing scalable and resilient systems. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to architect solutions that leverage these principles to enhance our products' performance, reliability, and maintainability. This role requires a deep understanding of distributed systems, event-driven architectures, and domain modelling. Write clean, maintainable, and testable code, following industry best practices and coding standards. Participate in architectural discussions and contribute to the overall system design.
 


  


 Identify and address performance bottlenecks, security vulnerabilities, and other issues in the back-end infrastructure. Monitor and troubleshoot production systems to ensure their stability and availability. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to debug and troubleshoot issues in legacy code bases.
   




**Work tasks**
  
* Develop and maintain scalable, reliable, and high-performance backend systems using C#, .NET, IIS, SQL Server and AWS
  
* Understand and analyze legacy software systems to identify areas for improvement, updates, and modernization
  
* Collaborate with stakeholders, architects, and developers to devise strategies for upgrading and migrating legacy systems
  
* Develop and implement plans for refactoring, rewriting, or integrating new functionalities into existing software
  
* Perform maintenance tasks, bug fixes, and optimizations on legacy codebases
  
* Design and optimize databases and data models to efficiently store and retrieve large volumes of data
  
* Conduct thorough code reviews and provide constructive feedback to ensure high-quality codebase
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Bachelor/Master of Science in Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
  
* Proven work experience (5+ years) in software development using C# and .NET framework.
  
* Database: Microsoft SQL server
  
* Proficiency in designing and deploying applications on AWS cloud services (e.g., EC2, Load balancer, S3, Lambda)
  
* Strong knowledge of software architecture, design patterns, and best practices.
  
* Experience of working with Rest API and Microservices based architecture
  
* You have experience building micro services and can decompose large monoliths into highly scalable, distributed, smaller components that follow micro service paradigms.
  
* Proficiency in writing efficient and optimized SQL queries
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Hands on experience in implementing Software Design Patterns and Enterprise level Design patterns [ e.g. Pub-Sub, DDD, CQRS and event sourcing]
  
* Experience with DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and infrastructure as code tools is a plus
  
* Experience with modernization strategies, refactoring, and migration of legacy systems is a plus.
  
* Adaptability and willingness to work with diverse technologies and systems.
  
* You are comfortable with asynchronous programming, event driven architectures and writing decoupled applications.
  
* Drive continuous improvement by staying updated with emerging technologies and industry trends in AWS
  
* Background with database design, from crafting a schema from scratch, to writing efficient queries. Candidate should understand execution plans and how to utilize indexes
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 



 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Julia Fresk or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on julia.fresk@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105073

title: Technical Specialist - Nalco Water
description:
Nalco Water, an Ecolab Company, is looking for a skilled **Technical Specialist** based in the **Gothenburg** area in **Sweden**. In this role, you will provide on-site field service and assist customers with problem-solving support regarding Nalco Waters’ products, applications, and solutions. The position primarily focuses on the Refinery & Petrochemical Industry in Sweden, with potential for progression into a Sales Engineer role.

**What You Will Do:**

* Demonstrate a strong commitment to safety by adhering to defined metrics, systems of work, and tools to protect yourself, co-workers, customers, and the Nalco Water brand.
* Demonstrate safe driving techniques and maintain company vehicles and equipment in a professional manner.
* Support to district sales personnel in the handling of company program service calls on existing products and services and assist in the correction of problems as appropriate.
* Assess on-site field problems and operate necessary testing equipment to bring systems into customer conformance.
* Coordinate and manage replacement parts programs with the individual manufacturing plants to ensure the availability of components as needed.
* Assist in the preparation of reports detailing technical problems and solutions to initiate necessary corrective product modifications and/or recommended process changes. Document value provided to the customer whenever possible.
* Qualify, coordinate, and monitor outside subcontractor network as required to ensure repair timelines are maintained and customer satisfaction is maintained.
* Work with other district personnel toward continuous improvement of policies and procedures resulting in increased customer satisfaction.
* Provide installation resource services as needed (e.g., field surveys, installation checklists, rollout support).
* Stay informed about industry advances through continuous internal education.
* Participate in design reviews, new application start-ups, and evaluations. Assist in critiquing products for serviceability, performance, and reliability. Inter-act with appropriate company resources and work as a team.

**Qualifications:**

* A degree in an engineering discipline is advantageous but not required. Relevant skills may also be obtained from technical roles such as maintenance, equipment supply, electrical work or programming.
* Good Computer Skills (Office, CRM, cloud based ptatforms)
* A personable and communicative approach
* Strong work ethic and commitment
* English Language skills required.
* Commercial attitude
* Valid B driving license.

**Who Should Apply:**


The ideal candidate,

* is comfortable in customer interaction and fieldwork rather than office settings.
* has a strong sense of responsibility and the ability to work without supervision.
* enjoys working alone with also a great deal of interaction with colleagues.

**Travel Requirements**


A common month could include a couple of overnights within the Nordic countries. Ability to work flexible hours to ensure service delivery.

**Application deadline:** The application deadline is as soon as possible. Candidates will be invited for interviews on an ongoing basis.

**Contact:** Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your experience and qualifications relative to the requirements listed. For further questions related to the position, please contact Jesper Pot, Divisional Sales Manager Industrial – Netherlands & Nordics. Phone: +31 (6) 12767174. Email: jpot@ecolab.com.

*Every day, we make the world cleaner, safer and healthier – protecting people and vital resources. Ecolab is the global leader in water, hygiene and energy technologies and services. Around the world businesses in foodservice, food processing, hospitality, healthcare, industrial, and oil and gas markets choose Ecolab products and services to keep their environment clean and safe, operate efficiently and achieve sustainability goals. Our global workforce of over 44,000 employees is consistently delivering comprehensive solutions that meet the unique needs of our customers.*

 **Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**  

  

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, or disability.
company_description: Ecolab is the global leader in water, hygiene and infection prevention solutions and services. Every day, we help make the world cleaner, safer and healthier – protecting people and vital resources.

title: Software Manager & Product Owner
description:
Charge Amps´ chargers are managed and controlled by our own charging management system, Charge Amps Cloud, that continuously communicates with, monitors and manages them. Some key features of Charge Amps Cloud are installation support for the chargers, dynamic load balancing, user interfaces for both end users, installers and support staff, mobile Apps for Android and iPhone, and External API integrations.


We are now looking for a manager and product owner for our Cloud & App team, all based at our headquarter office in Solna, Stockholm. The position also entails a product ownership role, planning and coordinating short-term and long-term development projects in balance with technical maintenance and improvement work. You will become part of a team and report directly to the R&D manager.


As our new Manager for Cloud & App, you will be responsible for a team of twelve highly technically skilled employees and have many interactions with other parts of the company such as other R&D departments, Product Management, Sales, Support and Operations.

**W****e expect you to:**

* Have a technical depth to both partake in and drive discussions on functional behavior, system design while keeping the high-level targets in mind
* Work in a structured and pragmatic way towards solutions that are both performant and easy to use and maintain
* Be solution oriented, take initiatives to solve problems and always try to find the best solutions
* Participate in defining long term functional development och Charge Amps Cloud services

**Skills & qualifications:**

* A shown leader with at least five years’ experience of managing SW product development in an agile environment
* Master of Science degree or equivalent
* Communicate both in Swedish and English
* Hands on experience of modern tech-stack technologies such as .NET, React, databases, Kubernetes, Grafana, and Microsoft Azure
* Experience from EV charging systems

**What we offer:**


Competent colleagues dedicated to creating a brighter world


A chance to be part in accelerating the transition to an electrified life


An opportunity to work with electrifying products which is smart, beautiful, and sustainable

 **About Charge Amps**


Charge Amps is a pioneering provider of charging solutions for electric vehicles. Through intelligent and sustainably produced products, Charge Amps accelerates the shift towards electric mobility. Charge Amps was founded in 2012 in Stockholm, Sweden. Today, the company has approximately 100 colleagues, operates in five countries and works toward end consumers, retailers and larger companies. Find out more at chargeamps.com

title: Cloud Tech Lead
description:
* *Ansök senast: 31 juli 2024*
* *Stockholm*
* *Hybrid*
***Arbetsuppgifter***
---------------------

*Vi söker en Cloud Security Tech Lead som vill vara med och forma Handelsbankens molnsäkerhet. Vi har stort fokus på tillgänglighet och säkerhet med strävan mot PaaS och Cloud Native i Azure.*

***Ditt team***  

*Du kommer bli del av Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE), ett agilt och tvärfunktionellt team som ansvarar för Cloud-plattformen i Azure. Teamet består av säkerhetsingenjörer, molnarkitekter, utvecklare och supportpersonal som tillsammans arbetar med att designa, implementera och vidareutveckla molnlösningar.*

*Vi samarbetar med operativa team för hantering av säkerhetslösningar och -incidenter men även compliance- och riskhanteringsteam för att säkerställa att alla lösningar uppfyller regulatoriska krav.*

***Din roll***  

*Rollen som Cloud Security Tech Lead är både operativ och strategisk. Du kommer ansvara för low level design, implementera och vidareutveckla säkerhetslösningar och arkitektur för Azure. Ditt ansvar innefattar att utvärdera och integrera nya säkerhetsteknologier inom banken infrastruktur. Du kommer även delta i strategiska beslut som kopplat till bankens moln- och säkerhetsstrategier. Rollen innebär även att du kommer tekniskt vägleda säkerhetsteamet, vara deras länk till andra ledare inom banken och då arbeta nära flera utvecklingsteam för att kontinuerligt integrera säkerhetstänket.*

***Vi har riktigt bra förmåner***
---------------------------------

* *Tjänstepension*
* *Vinstdelningssystem*
* *Gruppförsäkring*
* *Friskvårdsbidrag*
* *Bidrag vid föräldraledighet*
* *Banktjänster*
* *Banking services*
* *Benefit in connection with parental leave*
* *Health promotion subsidy*
* *Group insurance*
* *Occupational pension*
* *Profit-sharing scheme*
***Kvalifikationer***
---------------------

***Din profil***  

*Du har omfattande erfarenhet av att arbeta med molnsäkerhet i Azure, och Microsoft Defender for Cloud. Därtill har du kunskap och praktiskt erfarenhet inom infrastruktur, Azure Kubernetes och relevanta Saas-tjänster. Du är tydligt insatt inom säkerhetsprotokoll och -standarder som SoGP, ISO, CIS, NIST och kan praktiskt omvandla det till tekniska krav.*

*Du har tidigare ansvarat för att leda utvecklingsarbetet inom närmsta teamet där det är meriterande om du har haft ansvar som säkerhetsarkitekt eller liknande. Vi ser det som meriterande om du har Microsoft certifieringar inom molnsäkerhet, arbetat med andra plattformar, automatisering, IaC, eller JSON.*

*Då vi samarbetar med hela koncernen behöver du behärska god svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.*

*Rollen innebär samarbete med flera olika delar av koncernen så vi ser det som viktigt att du kan anpassa din kommunikation beroende på mottagaren. Du inkluderar olika perspektiv och framför samtidigt din åsikt på ett tydligt, inlyssnande och respektfullt sätt. Ditt arbetssätt är lösningsorienterat där du tar dig an problemet med den kompetens som finns i teamet. Samtidigt har du förmåga att fatta självständiga beslut och leda teamet mot ett gemensamt mål.*

***Vi erbjuder***

* *en trygg och stabil arbetsgivare*
* *dynamiskt och stimulerande arbete*
* *work-life balance*
* *kompetens- och karriärutveckling*
* *inkluderande- och jämställd arbetsmiljö*
* *konkurrenskraftigt förmånspaket*

***Kontaktuppgifter***

***Chef:*** *Amanda Wärmé, amanda.warme@handelsbanken.se*  

***HR:*** *Sofia Åkerblom, sofia.akerblom@handelsbanken.se*  

***Fackliga representanter Finansförbundet:*** *Per Almshult, per.almshult@handelsbanken.se*  

***Fackliga representanter Akademikerföreningen:*** *Bjarne Nilsson, bjarne.nilsson@handelsbanken.se*

***Välkommen med din ansökan***

*/#LI-SA1*


  
**Om företaget**
----------------

Hos oss får du ett stort eget ansvar och möjlighet att påverka din egen och bankens framtida utveckling. Våra olika perspektiv, insikter och innovativa idéer utgör en grund för hur vi tillsammans bygger vidare banken för framtiden. För oss är utveckling allt och när du utvecklas, utvecklas banken.


Vi har ett unikt sätt att bedriva bank som bygger på en stark tilltro och respekt för den enskilda människan. Våra värderingar och starka företagskultur har en avgörande betydelse för vår framgång och guidar oss om hur vi uppnår våra mål, samarbetar och stöttar varandra. Genom stark lokal förankring, ett decentraliserat arbetssätt och ett långsiktigt perspektiv skapar vi hållbara relationer genom livets olika skeenden. Hos oss på Handelsbanken är alla viktiga. Vi kommer från olika platser med olika bakgrund, erfarenhet och utbildning. Tillsammans är vi Handelsbanken.  



  

Mer om Handelsbanken *Mer om Handelsbanken*

title: Partner Development Manager Sweden
description:
**If you run toward knowledge and problem-solving, join us**
============================================================


In a world of cloud complexity, NetApp simplifies. Our customers are looking for a more unified and secure multicloud experience, and we provide the services, infrastructure and expertise they need to achieve it.



If you want to have a real impact, NetApp is the place for you. You’ll make a difference—while still maintaining a healthy work-life balance. Who are we? Forward-thinking technology people with a heart. Join us.


**Partner Development Manager Sweden**
======================================


Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden


**Job category:** EMEA Sales


**Job ID:** 126622-en\_US


**About NetApp**


We’re forward-thinking technology people with heart. We make our own rules, drive our own opportunities, and try to approach every challenge with fresh eyes. Of course, we can’t do it alone. We know when to ask for help, collaborate with others, and partner with smart people. We embrace diversity and openness because it’s in our DNA. We push limits and reward great ideas. What is your great idea?


"At NetApp, we fully embrace and advance a diverse, inclusive global workforce with a culture of belonging that leverages the backgrounds and perspectives of all employees, customers, partners, and communities to foster a higher performing organization." -George Kurian, CEO

**Job summary**
---------------


We are seeking a driven Partner Development Manager to deliver on our Hybrid Cloud Strategy and drive adoption of NetApp's Infrastructure Solutions and Cloud Services. As part of the Nordic Partner Team, you will work with various levels of partner organizations, developing joint GTM strategies and executing Joint Business Plans. Your role involves supporting partners in their Hybrid Cloud Strategy and digital transformation, leveraging internal functions to establish credibility. You will own partner engagement and growth as well as collaborating with the sales team. NetApp sells products or services through Distributors and Channel Partners.

**Job requirements**
--------------------


You are a self-motivated, trustworthy, and proactive individual with a strong desire to drive business initiatives and development with partners. Your influence increases partner preference for NetApp, boosts market penetration, and expands the share of wallet. You excel at translating NetApp's Infrastructure solutions into partner strategies and goals. You actively seek new contacts and opportunities within partner organizations, while also building external networks to support business needs. Additionally, you possess a solid understanding of the industry ecosystem.

**Education**
-------------


Our ideal candidate brings preferably a minimum of 8 years of partner engagement experience and a proven track record. A broad knowledge of IT-Infrastructure solutions is desired.


#LI-DNI


Did you know…  

Statistics show women apply to jobs only when they’re 100% qualified. But no one is 100% qualified. We encourage you to shift the trend and apply anyway! We look forward to hearing from you.

**Why NetApp?**


In a world full of generalists, NetApp is a specialist. No one knows how to elevate the world’s biggest clouds like NetApp. We are data-driven and empowered to innovate. Trust, integrity, and teamwork all combine to make a difference for our customers, partners, and communities.  

  

We expect a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time off per year to volunteer with their favorite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. We also offer financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.  

  

If you run toward knowledge and problem-solving, join us.
