title: Cyber Security Architect
description:
**Job Description**
 Do you have a curious and analytical mindset and get inspired from being part of building a new world class cyber security organization? Then H&M Group can offer you a position that matches your personality! We are looking for Cyber Security Architect to join our organization based in Stockholm.
   

  

**Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Contextualize corporate strategic vision, conducting analysis, identifying opportunities, and defining strategic activities in the Cyber Security domain.
* Analyze, design, develop, and maintain roadmaps and implementation plans to enable future-state security capabilities, ensuring organizational resilience, stability, and operational excellence.
* Drive continuous improvement and simplification to enhance end-to-end business value, collaborating across the organization to lower the total cost of ownership.
* Develop control mechanisms to manage Cyber risks in alignment with business risk appetite.


**Architecture Enablement** 
 :
   

  

* Develop conceptual and logical architecture designs, creating artifacts such as security principles, guardrails, capability models, and future state blueprints.
* Facilitate the delivery of targeted business outcomes, including drafting and proposing Architecture Decision Records, anchoring and ratifying Architecture Decisions, and monitoring their adoption and effectiveness.
* Maintain a registry of security solutions relevant to the domain, ensuring security capability maturity and managing the lifecycle of Architecture Decision Records.


**Change Enablement** 
 :
   

  

* Identify interdependencies and employ holistic thinking to design and implement solutions, considering cross-team perspectives.
* Act as a facilitator for complex technical topics, collaborating across functions to ensure comprehensive consultation.
* Communicate security best practices to embed security into platforms and products, sharing knowledge with the engineering and delivery community.


**Qualifications**
 What you need to succeed:
   

  

* Mastery of multiple security areas with deeper expertise in one or more of the following: Device security, Application security, Data security, Cloud security, Network security, Secure development, and IAM.
* Demonstrated skills and experience in information security within an international and diverse context.
* Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively within a non-hierarchical culture of


**Additional Information**
**Working with tech at H&M Group**
 Shaping the future of fashion with people, data, and tech. The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  

**What we offer!**
 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, flexible work life, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits etc. There are endless opportunities to experiment and grow in any direction that you want, and when you grow, we grow. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 This is a full-time position with placement in Stockholm

title: Chief Technology Officer
description:
**Chief Technology Officer (CTO)** 




  





 We are working with an innovative start-up in the AI space, currently in the pre-seed funding stage, dedicated to transforming education and training through cutting-edge artificial intelligence. The mission is to revolutionise how language and communication skills are taught, making learning more engaging, personalized, and effective. With a dynamic team they are poised for rapid growth and impactful change in the education-technology sector.
 



  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm
 



**Job Type:** 
 Full-Time
 



**Salary:** 
 Competitive, with equity options
 



  





**Job Description:** 




 As the Chief Technology Officer (CTO), you will be a key member of the executive team, responsible for driving the technological vision and strategy of the company. You will lead the development and implementation of innovative AI solutions that will shape the future of education and training. This role requires a visionary leader with a deep technical background, strong leadership skills, and a passion for transforming education through technology.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  





**Technology Strategy and Vision:** 



* Develop and execute the company’s technical strategy in alignment with business goals.
* Identify emerging technology trends and ensure the company remains at the forefront of AI advancements in education.
* Oversee all system design and changes in system architecture.



  





**Leadership and Team Management:** 



* Lead, mentor, and grow the engineering and product development teams.
* Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
* Manage the technology team’s budget and resource allocation.



  





**Product Development:** 



* Drive the development of AI-based educational products from concept to launch.
* Ensure the scalability, performance, and reliability of the company’s technology infrastructure.
* Oversee the development and maintenance of software, algorithms, and data systems.



  





**Collaboration and Communication:** 



* Work closely with the CEO and other executive team members to define product roadmaps and business strategies.
* Liaise with stakeholders, including investors, partners, and customers, to communicate technical plans and progress.
* Ensure effective communication and collaboration between engineering, product, and other departments.



  





**Risk Management and Compliance:** 



* Identify and mitigate technological risks.
* Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards, particularly regarding data privacy and security.



  





**Experience:** 



* Proven experience as a CTO or in a similar leadership role, preferably in a start-up environment.
* Extensive experience in AI/ML, natural language processing, and/or educational technology.
* Demonstrated success in developing and deploying scalable software products.
* Experience with pre-seed or early-stage companies is highly desirable.



**Technical Skills:** 



* Deep understanding of AI/ML frameworks, tools, and technologies.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or C++.
* Experience with cloud services (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) and data infrastructure.



**Leadership Skills:** 



* Strong leadership and team management abilities.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strategic thinker with the ability to execute and deliver results.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* **Education:** 
 Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Ph.D. is a plus.



  





**Benefits:** 



* Competitive salary with equity options
* Opportunity to work in a fast-paced, innovative start-up environment
* Flexible working hours and remote work options
* Professional development opportunities
* Collaborative and inclusive company culture

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Quotacom are proud to be partnered with a leading business within Parcel Distribution and E-Commerce, based in Sweden.
 



  





 With international presence, and over 20,000 employees, they are committed to leveraging data-driven insights to optimise operations and deliver exceptional customer experiences.
 



  





 In addition, they are leading the way in integrating cutting-edge technology into their operations, such as AI and Machine Learning.
 



  





 As part of their strategic growth plans, they are seeking a Senior Data Scientist.
 



  





 The ideal candidate will possess expertise in Time Series Analysis, Forecasting, Optimisation, and Machine Learning. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in driving data-driven decision-making processes, optimising operational efficiency, and enhancing our competitive edge in the market.
 



  





**Responsibilities:**




  




1. **Forecasting and Prediction:**


* Develop and implement robust time series forecasting models to predict parcel flows and volumes in both short-term and long-term windows.
* Utilise advanced machine learning techniques to enhance the accuracy and reliability of demand forecasts.
* Generate actionable insights from forecasting models to support strategic and operational decision-making processes.


1. **Optimisation and Decision Making:**


* Optimise resource allocation, route planning, and workforce management using mathematical optimisation algorithms.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement optimisation solutions that maximise efficiency while minimising costs.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives by identifying areas for optimisation and implementing data-driven solutions.


1. **Geospatial Analysis:**


* Leverage geospatial data to analyse and optimise parcel delivery routes, terminal operations, and network design.
* Develop geospatial forecasting models to predict parcel demand and optimise service coverage across different regions.
* Utilise geographic information systems (GIS) tools to visualise and analyse spatial data for strategic decision-making.


1. **Data Science Engineering:**


* Collaborate with data engineers to design and deploy scalable data pipelines for processing, analysing, and visualising large volumes of data.
* Utilise cloud-based platforms such as AWS, Azure, and Databricks to build and deploy data science solutions.
* Implement best practices for data governance, version control, and model deployment to ensure reproducibility and scalability.



  





 To learn more, please apply to this position, or email joe@quotacom.com with your CV to set up a confidential discussion.
 



  





*At Quotacom, we take the security and privacy of your personal data very seriously, any data we hold will be in accordance with data protection legislation. Full details of our privacy notice can be found at www.quotacom.com/privacy-notice*

title: Partner Engineer, Google Workspace
description:
**Minimum Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 6 years of experience as a partner engineer in a cloud computing environment, or in a customer or partner-facing team such as Professional Services, Solutions Architect or Systems Engineering.
* 6 years of experience with enterprise productivity (e.g., workspace) solutions, including unified communications and collaboration, and Generative AI.
* Experience engaging with, and presenting to, technical stakeholders and executive leaders.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Understanding of productivity technologies and how they can integrate with AI, audio/video systems to deliver next generation user experience.
* Ability to clearly articulate and present Google Workspace value to executive audiences, line of business and technology stakeholders of partners and customers organizations.
* Ability to build relationships with partners within a specific market.


**About The Job**
 The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are developed for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
   

  

 In this role you will develop Google Workspace technology partners outcomes through education, support, guidance and partnership and enabling them to drive innovation for customers.
   

  

 Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Assess and analyze partners business and technical performance to support their growth. Help develop technology goal for their solutions.
* Work with partner technical teams to incorporate their existing solutions with workspace or develop proof-of-concepts industry or vertical solutions that allow partners to maximize workspace advantages.
* Advise on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure. Provide best practice advice to customers and partners and provide feedback from the field to Google Engineering teams.
* Provide design, migration and deployment expertise. Lead product and solution briefings and proof-of-concept work, alongside product management.
* Develop close relationships with Google’s Partner and Google Workspace Sales Managers to grow the relevance and impact of focused partners to the business.


 Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google's Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.
   

  

 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are committed to building a workforce that is representative of the users we serve, creating a culture of belonging, and providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding), expecting or parents-to-be, criminal histories consistent with legal requirements, or any other basis protected by law. See also Google's EEO Policy, Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal, Belonging at Google, and How we hire.
   

  

 If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.
   

  

 Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles unless stated otherwise in the job posting.
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees, or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Lösningskonsult inom ärendehantering med erfarenhet av offentlig sektor!
description:
Som konsult inom ärendehantering hos Tietoevry möter du en varierande vardag. Här träffar du dina kunder regelbundet och varvar denna sociala roll med arbete från Tietoevrys egna kontor i Solna. Härifrån görs research och förbereds presentationer tillsammans med dina teamkollegor, allt för att på bästa sätt hjälpa dina kunder att ta ytterligare steg mot en digitaliserad informationshantering. Låter det som ditt nästa karriärsteg? Välkommen in med din ansökan!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Tietoevry Tech Services AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Vi söker just nu en Lösningskonsult inom ärendehantering till Tietoevrys Public 360 team, som fokuserar på smartare administration och bättre medborgartjänster inom offentlig sektor. I denna konsultativa och rådgivande roll arbetar du tillsammans med bl.a. Projektledare och Utvecklare med att hjälpa företag inom offentlig sektor att digitalisera sin informations- och dokumenthantering, genom systemet Public 360°. Du kommer till en avdelning med mycket på gång och som präglas av en framåtanda och ett fartfyllt tempo.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En arbetsplats med stora ambitioner där du får arbeta med moderna lösningar och kompetenta kollegor
  
* En komplex roll där vi erbjuder en långsiktig kompetensutveckling anpassad efter dina behov
  
* Att vara ansvarig för att leda nya och existerande kunder, kopplat till Tietoevrys produkt Public 360, genom deras digitaliseringsresa.
  
* En provanställning om 6 månader direkt hos Tietoevry
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Analysera och utveckla kunders processer med fokus på informationshantering, processkartläggning och processutveckling och krav
  
* Omsätta kundens processer till lösningar i eller kring Public 360°
  
* Tillsammans med teamet utveckla befintliga affärer och ta fram förslag och planer på hur kunder kan maximera sin nytta av investeringen i Public 360°
  
* Hålla i utbildningar i Public 360° samt kunna demonstrera Public 360° och dess moduler
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
  
* Har minst tre års erfarenhet av att arbeta med eller inom offentlig sektor från relevant område. Vi ser att du arbetat i en liknande roll som konsult, alternativt inom offentlig sektor; till exempel som mötessekreterare, registrator eller handläggare
  
* Har professionell kunskap i svenska och goda kunskaper i engelska då båda språken används i rollen
  
* Har ett grundläggande intresse för verksamhetsutveckling genom digitalisering och teknik
  


  


 Det är meriterande om du tidigare kommit i kontakt med ärendehanteringssystem inom offentlig sektor men inget krav för tjänsten.
 


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga:**
  

 Du är flexibel och kan med lätthet skifta fokus mellan dina olika ansvarsområden. Du trivs i en självgående roll där du ges stort utrymme att själv planera dina dagar och driva ditt arbete framåt på ett effektivt sätt. Då rollen är rådgivande till sin karaktär är du orädd i bemärkelsen att du vågar utmana kunder och presentera nytänkande idéer och lösningsförslag. Du har många kontaktytor internt på avdelningen samt externt hos kunder, vilket gör att din förmåga att skapa goda samarbeten blir avgörande för att lyckas i denna roll. Självklart ser vi att du har en positiv inställning och en entusiasm och energi som smittar!
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned innan sista ansökningsdag om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Tietoevry Tech Services AB**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Sofie Gillberg eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sofie.gillberg@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15104697

title: Data Innovation Manager
description:
Hey! Have you ever wondered what fascinating insights can be derived from a vast pool of connected vehicles? How could it be used to lead the charge to transform the future of electrification through data?
   

  

 If this sounds like you - then you might be the perfect fit for our creative, diverse, and dynamic team with a very mixed background. What unites us is the ability to solve problems with data and finding innovative solutions to new problems.
   

  

 We are part of the Sales & Marketing organization at Scania. The world of transport and logistics is electrifying rapidly, and Scania is facing the biggest shift in our history. Our target is to take a leading role in the transformation by introducing new tailor-made products, services, and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

 We are working within the area of e-Mobility analytics, working both with our end customers to describe their operations in an electrified world – but also cross-functionally within the company, using our vast pool of connected vehicle data to create strategic insights.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 Right now, we are looking to strengthen our competence within data science. You will work as a part of the team, analyzing data from our connected vehicles and transform it into actionable insights. Your focus will be to create a structured approach for our concepts, and take a leading role in developing and setting up our cloud based environments.
   

  

 In order to do this, you will probably need
   

  

  

* an engineering degree within system/computer science or similar
* proven experience (minimum 3 years) in data science, business analytics, or a similar role
* understanding of data technologies, including cloud solutions and big data platforms
* basic insight in artificial intelligence and machine learning, with a focus on sales and marketing applications
* proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R and SQL, and experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
* excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think creatively and strategically
* exceptional communication skills with the ability to translate complex data concepts into actionable business insights


 Of course, what you know is really important, but who you are is also a key aspect. To feel at home in our group, we think you should have
   

  

  

* an explorative mindset
* a self-going approach, with a strong ability to take and complete your own initiatives
* a conscious drive for spreading the message on data to other cross-functions
* an inspiring and inviting attitude
* a liking for working in a still developing environment
* an openness for new perspectives and solving problems as a team


**What We Offer**
 You get the chance to try out new ideas and creative solutions within the framework of e-Mobility analytics. You will become part of an organization that is still defining the future of working with electric vehicles from a sales & marketing perspective. This means a lot of freedom, but also a lot of individual responsibility.
   

  

 The job offers flexible working arrangements, allowing you to balance your professional and personal commitments effectively. As one example, we have an office close to Hötorget complementing our main site in Södertälje. A hybrid work setup is a natural part of our way of working.
   

  

 In today's dynamic workforce, professional development is crucial, and this role offers ample opportunities for growth and advancement, ensuring you stay ahead in your career.
   

  

**Application**
 If this sounds interesting, don’t hesitate to apply! But not later than June 19, 2024.
   

  

 If there are any questions, contact me Marie Hammar (head of the team), marie.hammar@scania.com, +46 737483141 or Erica Lindroth (Talent Acquisition Specialist), erica.lindroth@scania.com.
   

  

 We are looking forward hearing from you!
   

  

*Kindly notice that a background check might be conducted for the position.*

title: Data Scientist in Group and Business Services Data & Analytics Team | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Do you see the potential in data and want to contribute to accelerating our data driven automation journey using Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and other data driven automation tools? Then this might be the right challenge for you!
   

  

 We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our group of data professionals. Our Data & Analytics Office is a function within the Group & Business Services (GBS) - a cross-divisional function support SEB’s business across multiple business areas. Our mission is to empower Group & Business Services by unlocking the potential of data we create in our processes to identify improvements with a focus on data driven automation. We provide support to enable data-driven decision-making and leverage process intelligence across Group & Business Services.
   

  

 As a part of the SEB Group, we provide world-class financial services to support SEB on the journey of becoming the leader in efficiency and innovation. Our dedicated team of over 2800 employees consistently strives to enhance business development and growth. If you want to be part of an engaging and enabling environment where you can turn your everyday actions into global results, this is where you get to shine.
   

  

**About the role:**
 As a Data Scientist, you will play an important role in accelerating our organization's data journey and creating business value. In this role you are expected to understand business needs and pain points in the process flows that can be addressed through data-driven solutions. You will have to analyze large datasets, apply advanced statistical and machine-learning techniques to drive actionable insights, data-driven decisions and improve services to the customers.
   

  

**Core roles and responsibilities:**
* Work closely with stakeholders to understand their business needs and identify problems that can be solved using AI/ML techniques.
* Collect and refine business requirements using various methods, such as data-driven insights, interviews, document analysis and workflow analysis.
* Identify opportunities for AI/ML use cases, focusing on optimizing our manual processes and improving customer service.
* Lead and drive data workstreams engaging stakeholders and cross-functional teams in the implementation of the solutions.
* Collect, clean and analyze large amounts of data from various sources using various tools, methods, and formats to create business insights.
* Create ML algorithms and models to address specific business challenges and identify business opportunities
* Deploy models into the production environment, take care of the maintenance, monitor performance and secure reliability.
* Collaborate with the Data, ML/AI, Cloud Engineers, Data Scientists and DevOps teams across the bank to accelerate AI/ML use cases


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
* You have a strong academic background in Machine Learning and Data Science (at least hold a Master’s degree in relevant fields).
* You have working experience as a Data Scientist or similar role for at least 3 years and have been involved in developing and deploying ML models for solving business problems.
* You have excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to take ownership.
* You have great communication skills and fluency in English.
* You have proficiency in SQL, the ability to query and manipulate databases.
* You have great data visualization techniques, the ability to create meaningful visualizations and communicate insights
* You have proficiency in Python (or R) programming language, have experience working with ML
* You have experience working with a Cloud solution (Google Cloud Platform is preferred).
* You know MLOps principles and applied them in your previous projects.


**What we offer:**
* A unique opportunity to be a part of SEB’s data journey.
* High engagement from the organization to accelerate the AI journey.
* A truly international environment to work side-by-side with experienced colleagues in a diverse and high-performing team.
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 We are looking forward to your application by June 30th, 2024. Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application before the deadline. If you have questions about the position, please contact Gavin Whyte, Head of Data & Reporting Services &GBS Data & Analytics Officer, at gavin.whyte@seb.se .
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/career**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
**Salesforce Developer** 




**Hybrid - Stockholm, Gothenburg or Malmö** 




  





 Our client, a renowned Salesforce Summit Partner, is a leading player in the consulting and digital services space. They are dedicated to driving digital transformation for their clients, offering cutting-edge solutions that combine advanced technology with human insight. They are now looking to expand their team with a talented Salesforce Developer.
 



  





 As a Salesforce Developer, you will be instrumental in designing, developing, and implementing innovative Salesforce solutions tailored to meet client needs. Working closely with clients, project managers, and fellow developers, you will deliver bespoke, efficient Salesforce applications that drive success.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop customised Salesforce solutions.
* Work with business analysts and stakeholders to translate requirements into technical specifications.
* Integrate Salesforce with other systems.
* Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues, providing ongoing support and maintenance.
* Stay updated on the latest Salesforce features and best practices.

**Requirements:**

**What’s On Offer:**

* Access to the latest technologies and continuous learning.
